Add spinach and feta to the hot pasta to wilt the spinach. Season with salt to taste. ; name: cheesy orzo ; ingredients: extra virgin olive oil, onion, garlic cloves, chicken broth, orzo pasta, parmigiano, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:Preheat an 8-inch pot with a tight fitting cover over moderate heat. Add oil, onion and garlic and saute for 2 or 3 minutes. Add broth to the pan and bring to a boil. Stir in orzo and return to boiling. Cover pot and reduce heat to simmer. Cook 15 minutes, stirring occasionally, or until liquid is absorbed and orzo is tender. Remove lid and stir in cheese. Add salt and pepper to taste. ; name: copycat sizzler rice ; ingredients: orzo pasta, butter, chicken bouillon powder, garlic powder, onion powder, long-grain rice, lemon juice, warm water ; preparation:

name: crunchy red cabbage slaw salad ; ingredients: red cabbage, carrot, red apple, green onion, mayonnaise, wine vinegar, extra virgin olive oil ; preparation:Using a large knife, shred the cabbage. Place in a large bowl with the carrot, apple and green onions. Whisk the mayonnaise, vinegar and oil. Season. Toss with the salad and serve. ; name: freezer coleslaw ; ingredients: cabbage, carrot, green pepper, salt, wine vinegar, sugar, celery seed, mustard seeds ; preparation:Mix veggies with salt. Let stand one hour. Squeeze out juice. Set aside. Boil vinegar, sugar and seeds. Cool. Mix with veggies. Put into small freezer proof containers. ; name: tossed greens with pineapple apple and feta cheese ; ingredients: apples, pineapple, red onions, feta cheese, salad greens, water, balsamic vinegar, sweet-hot mustard, garlic, salt and pepper ; preparation:Whisk together water, vinegar, mustard, garlic, salt, and pepper in a small bowl. Set aside. In a large bowl, combine greens, apples, pineapple, onion, and cheese. Pour dressing over the fruit and vegetables and toss gently to coat. Serve immediately. ; name: bell pepper cole slaw no mayonnaise ; ingredients: green cabbage, red cabbage, carrot, green pepper, sugar, red wine vinegar, water, coarse salt, black pepper ; preparation:Combine the green cabbage, red cabbage, carrot and green pepper in a large bowl. Combine sugar, vinegar and water. Whisk. Salt and pepper the slaw. Pour wet ingredients over the slaw. Toss well to coat. Cover and chill at least 1 hour. ; name: sweet and sour cabbage and carrots ; ingredients: butter, green cabbage, carrots, onion, brown sugar, reduced sodium soy sauce, cider vinegar, pepper ; preparation:In a large skillet over medium-high heat, melt butter. Add to the skillet the cabbage, carrots, onion and brown sugar. Cook, stirring often, for about 10-12 minutes until the veggies are well-browned and softened. Remove from heat and stir in the soy sauce, vinegar and pepper. Serve hot. ; name: cider braised cabbage ; ingredients: butter, onion, green cabbage, apple cider, apple cider vinegar, salt and pepper ; preparation:Melt butter in large pot over medium-high heat. Add onion. Saute until beginning to soften, about 5 minutes. Add cabbage. Saute until slightly wilted, tossing frequently, about 6 minutes. Stir in apple cider. Reduce heat to medium. Cover and cook until cabbage is tender, stirring occasionally, about 6 minutes. Uncover. Simmer until almost all liquid in pot evaporates, about 3 minutes. Stir in vinegar. Season with salt and pepper. ; name: salmon macaroni slaw ; ingredients: elbow macaroni, salmon, cabbage, celery, green pepper, onions, salt, pepper, vegetable oil, vinegar ; preparation:Cook macaroni as directed on package. Mix macaroni, salmon, cabbage, celery, green pepper and onion. Mix salt, pepper, oil and vinegar. Pour over macaroni mixture and toss. Cover and refrigerate 30 minutes. ; name: sweet and spicy coleslaw ; ingredients: green cabbage, carrots, yellow onion, mayonnaise, mustard, apple cider vinegar, sugar, black pepper, cayenne, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:

name: szechuan noodles ; ingredients: noodles, green onions, garlic cloves, peanut butter, thai sweet chili sauce, reduced sodium soy sauce, dry sherry, sesame oil ; preparation:Cook noodles as directed on the package. Drain. Mix all remaining ingredients together until well mixed. It may help to heat for a minute in the microwave. Mix noodles and sauce. Serve warm, but these also taste great cold. ; name: seasoned spinach ; ingredients: fresh spinach, green onion, sesame seeds, low sodium soy sauce, dark sesame oil, kosher salt, garlic cloves ; preparation:Steam half of spinach, covered, for 5 minutes or until the spinach wilts. Place steamed spinach in a colander. Repeat proceduce with remaining spinach. Cool slightly, and squeeze dry. Place spinach in a bowl. Add onions and remaining ingredients. Toss mixture well to combine. Serve chilled or at room temperature. ; name: gai choy ; ingredients: gai choy, canola oil, dark sesame oil, onion, garlic, fish sauce, sugar ; preparation:Trim stems and slice thin and long. Coarsely chop leaves separately from stalks. Add oil to hot skillet over medium high heat then add sesame oil, onion and garlic. Stir and cook 1 minute. Stir in sugar and fish sauce. Add stalks and cook 2-3 minutes until crisp-tender. Stir in leaves and cook and stir 1 minute or just until they wilt. ; name: stir fried shrimp with ginger and mushrooms ; ingredients: canola oil, garlic cloves, fresh ginger, mushroom, celery, toasted sesame oil, large shrimp, reduced sodium soy sauce, dried red pepper flakes ; preparation:Heat the canola oil in a large, heavy skillet over medium heat until hot but not smoking. Add the garlic and ginger, stir fry for 30 seconds. Add the mushrooms, celery and sesame oil and stir fry for 30 seconds. Add the shrimp, soy sauce and red pepper flakes, stir fry til shrimp are pink and cooked through, 3-4 minutes. Serve immediately. ; name: slow cooked teriyaki beef ; ingredients: sirloin, soy sauce, garlic cloves, fresh ginger, sugar, cornstarch, sesame oil ; preparation:Arrange sliced meat in bottom of crock pot. Combine soy sauce, garlic cloves, ginger, sugar, cornstarch and sesame oil in blender. Process until smooth. Pour mixture over meat in crock pot. Cook on low for 6-8 hours. High for 3-4 hours. ; name: hawaiian beef teriyaki ; ingredients: steak, pineapple chunks, soy sauce, brown sugar, garlic cloves, onion, sesame oil, ginger ; preparation:Drain juice from pineapple into a blender. Add soy sauce, brown sugar, garlic, onion, sesame oil and ginger. Blend until sugar is dissolved. Place beef and pineapple pieces in a resealable bag. Pour marinade into bag and turn to coat. Refrigerate for 2 to 3 hours. Preheat grill. Thread meat and pineapple pieces alternately onto skewers. Grill for about 8 to 10 minutes or until done, turning occasionally. ; name: grilled rib eye steaks ; ingredients: soy sauce, green onion, brown sugar, garlic cloves, ground ginger, pepper, salt, rib eye steaks ; preparation:In a large resealable plastic bag, combine the first 7 ingredients. Add the steaks. Seal the bag and turn to coat. Refrigerate for 8 hours or overnight. Drain and discard marinade. Grill steaks, uncovered, over medium-hot heat for 8-10 minutes or desired doneness. ; name: japanese soy glazed sweet potato ; ingredients: brown sugar, low sodium soy sauce, mirin, dark sesame oil, garlic cloves, sweet potatoes, toasted sesame seeds, nori ; preparation:

name: olive oil herb and garlic bread ; ingredients: white bread, olive oil, lemon, garlic cloves, chives, flat leaf parsley, dill ; preparation:Pre heat oven to 200 degrees celsius. Cut bread into 1. 5 cm thick slices but do not cut all the way through. Place oil, lemon rind, garlic, herbs, salt and pepper into a bowl. Mix well, brush over both sides of each slice of bread. Wrap bread tightly in foil. Place on baking tray. Bake 20 - 25 minutes or till hot. Slice all the way through and serve. ; name: chestnut and chorizo soup ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, garlic cloves, chopped tomatoes, chestnuts, chicken stock, chorizo sausage, fresh parsley ; preparation:Heat the oil in a heavy bottomed pan and add the onion and garlic and saut for 4-5 minutes, until soft. Add the tomatoes and simmer for five minutes. Then add the chestnuts and simmer for a further three minutes. Add the stock, bring to the boil and simmer until everything is tender. Allow the soup to cool a little, then liquidise it in batches. Return the soup to the pan, add the chorizo and simmer for a few minutes, or until hot. Serve with the parsley as garnish. ; name: pasta arrabbiata ; ingredients: olive oil, garlic cloves, red pepper flakes, whole canned tomatoes, sugar, tomato sauce, dry white wine, oregano, basil, pasta ; preparation:Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook pasta in boiling water until just al dente. Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a large skillet. Add garlic and red pepper flakes. Cook until fragrant. Add remaining ingredients except pasta. Simmer about 10 minutes. Drain pasta. Add to sauce and cook, stirring, about 2 minutes. Season with salt and serve. ; name: braised salmon with leeks dill ; ingredients: olive oil, leeks, garlic cloves, tomatoes, kosher salt, fresh coarse ground black pepper, dry white wine, salmon fillets, fresh dill ; preparation:Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add leek. Saut 3 minutes. Add garlic. Saut 2-3 minutes. Add tomato, salt, and pepper. Saut 2-3 minutes. Add wine and salmon. Sprinkle with dill, and bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat, and simmer 8 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. ; name: pork tenderloin napoli ; ingredients: olive oil, pork tenderloin, roma tomatoes, green olives, dry white wine, fresh rosemary, garlic, salt, black pepper, heavy cream ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400. Heat the oil in an ovenproof skillet over medium high heat. Season the meat with salt and pepper and brown the pork on all sides in the skillet. Mix together the tomatoes, olives, wine, rosemary and garlic in a bowl and pour over the pork. Place skillet in the oven and bake for 30 minutes or until it reaches an internal temperature of 160. Remove pork from skillet and cover with foil to keep warm. Place skillet with remaining tomato mixture over medium heat and gradually mix in the cream. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly, then reduce heat to low and continue cooking for 5 minutes until thickened. Slice pork and drizzle with the cream sauce to serve. ; name: spicy whitefish with olives and cherry tomatoes ; ingredients: olive oil, tilapia fillets, fresh parsley, dried red pepper flakes, cherry tomatoes, kalamata olive, garlic cloves ; preparation:Heat olive oil in heavy non-stick skillet over medium high heat. Sprinkle fish with salt and pepper. Add fish to skillet and saute until just opaque in the center, about 3 minutes on each side. Transfer fish to platter. Add parsley and crushed pepper to same skillet and saute for one minute. Add tomatoes, olives and garlic. Saute about two minutes until tomatoes soften and get juicy. Season sauce with salt and pepper. Spoon over fish and serve hot. ; name: garlic prawns with squashed tomatoes ; ingredients: head broccoli, egg noodles, peanut oil, large shelled prawns, fresh garlic cloves, cherry tomatoes, dry white wine, fresh ground black pepper, sea salt ; preparation:Cut the florets from the broccoli into bite-sized pieces and set aside. Slice off and discard any rough pieces from the remaining stalk then slice into small pieces. Cook the noodles in a pan of boiling water according to packet instructions. Add the broccoli for the final minute of cooking. Drain. Meanwhile, heat a wok or large non-stick frying pan until hot. Add the oil, prawns and garlic and fry for 1-2 minutes, until the prawns turn pink. Remove from the pan and set aside. Add the tomatoes and squash down with the back of a spatula to release the juices. Cook for 1-2 minutes then add the wine and bubble for 1 minute. Return the prawn mixture to the pan, season with salt and pepper then toss through the drained noodles and broccoli. Divide among four bowls and serve immediately. ; name: clams with cherry tomatoes ; ingredients: olive oil, cherry tomatoes, dry white wine, littleneck clams, garlic cloves, lemon, fresh parsley, french bread ; preparation:

name: weight watchers chili lime chicken 3 points ; ingredients: vegetable oil, all-purpose flour, chili powder, salt, chicken breasts, chicken broth, fresh lime juice, cilantro ; preparation:In a large nonstick skillet, heat the oil. In a large ziplock bag, mix the flour, chili powder, and salt. Add chicken and shake until well coated. Transfer the chicken to the skillet, shaking off any excess flour. Saute until cooked through, about 3 minutes on each side. Pour broth and lime juice over the chicken. Heat to serving temperature, about 30 seconds. Transfer chicken to plates. Spoon the pan juices over chicken and sprinkle with cilantro. ; name: fried corn nuggets ; ingredients: corn, eggs, all-purpose flour, sugar, salt, pepper, vegetable oil ; preparation:Combine corn, lightly beaten egg yolks, flour, sugar, salt and pepper in a large bowl. Beat egg whites with an electric mixer set at high speed until stiff peaks form, about 2 minutes. Stir egg whites into corn mixture. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Drop heaping tablespoonfuls of corn batter into skillet. Reduce heat to medium. Cook until nuggets are browned, about 3 minutes per side. ; name: basic pancakes ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, milk, unsalted butter, egg, vegetable oil ; preparation:In a small bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder and salt, set aside. In a medium bowl, whisk together milk, butter and egg. Add dry ingredients to milk mixture, whisk until just moistened. Heat a large skillet or griddle over medium. Fold a sheet of paper towel in half and moisten with oil, carefully rub skillet with oiled paper towel. For each pancake, spoon 2 to 3 tablepoons of batter onto skillet, using the back of the spoon to spread batter into a round. Cook until surface of pancakes have some bubbles and a few have burst, 1 to 2 minutes. Flip carefully with a thin spatula and cook until browned on the underside, 1 to 2 minutes more. Serve warm, with desired toppings. ; name: fried chicken drumsticks southern style ; ingredients: chicken legs, eggs, vegetable oil, flour, cayenne pepper, paprika, salt ; preparation:Before frying, boil chicken legs in a pot of water for 10 minutes. In a large saucepan, heat vegetable oil on medium heat. On a large plate, combine flour, cayenne pepper, paprika, and salt. Keep beaten eggs in a separate bowl. Take 1 chicken leg and cover it is flour mixture. Place the chicken leg in eggs and cover it in egg. Place the chicken leg back into the flour mixture and cover it again in flour. Once oil is hot and ready for frying, place chicken leg into the oil for frying. Repeat steps 5-8 for each chicken leg allowing up to 3 legs to fry at one time. Once legs are fried to a golden brown, remove from oil and place on a double-folded paper towel on a plate. Allow plenty of time to cool before serving. ; name: cumin dusted pork cutlets with citrus pan sauce ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, ground cumin, salt, ground black pepper, pork cutlets, olive oil, garlic cloves, fresh orange juice, fresh lemon juice, orange wedge ; preparation:Mix first 4 ingredients on a plate. Coat pork in seasoned flour, shaking off extra. Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add pork and saut until cooked about 3 minutes per side. Transfer to plates. Add 4 tablespoons olive oil to skillet. Add garlic and saut until golden brown for about 10 minutes. Add orange juice and lemon juice. Broil until slightly thickened, whisking occasionally for about 30 seconds. Season with salt and pepper. Pour sauce over pork. Garnish with orange wedges and serve. ; name: chicken fried chicken d v o ; ingredients: saltine crackers, all-purpose flour, potato flakes, seasoning salt, ground black pepper, egg, vegetable oil, boneless skinless chicken breast halves ; preparation:Place crackers in a large re-sealable plastic bag. Seal bag and crush crackers until they are coarse crumbs. Add flour, potato flakes, seasoned salt, and pepper to bag and mix well. Beat egg in a shallow dish or bowl. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. One by one, dredge chicken pieces in egg beat, then place in bag with crumb mixture, seal bag and shake to coat. Reduce heat to medium and cook coated chicken in skillet for 15 to 20 minutes, turning frequently, until golden brown and juices run clear. ; name: perch fillets ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, paprika, salt, egg, milk, butter, perch fillets ; preparation:Mix flour, paprika, and salt together and set aside. In a small bowl, blend the egg and the milk. Heat butter in a large frying pan. Dip perch fillets in egg wash first and then into the flour mixture. Carefully place them into the hot butter in the frying pan and brown on both sides. Remove from the butter and drain on a paper towel to absorb excess butter. Serve immediately. ; name: crusty fried chicken ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, garlic salt, salt, celery salt, pepper, paprika, chicken pieces, canola oil ; preparation:

name: sweet bread bread pudding ; ingredients: sweet bread, raisins, butter, milk, sugar, eggs, apple pie filling, cinnamon, vanilla ; preparation:Grease a 9x12 pan. Scald milk. Add sugar and butter. Mix until butter is melted. Cool. Break sweet bread into pieces. Spread apple pie filling on top of the sweet bread. Sprinkle raisins over the filling. Combine cooled milk mixture with beaten eggs. Pour liquid over the bread. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 to 30 minutes. ; name: chunky pear and vanilla bars ; ingredients: honey, vanilla extract, rolled oats, dried cranberries, pears ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Heat honey in a saucepan, then add the vanilla and stir in the oats, cranberries, and pears. Press the mixture into a 7-inch square nonstick baking pan. Bake for 20 minutes. Let cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then mark into 10 bars and let cool completely. ; name: autumn pumpkin spice fudge ; ingredients: sugar, milk, light corn syrup, pumpkin, salt, pumpkin pie spice, vanilla extract, butter, nuts ; preparation:In 3 quart saucepan, combine sugar, milk, syrup, pumpkin, & salt. Bring to a boil over high heat, stirring constantly. Reduce the heat to medium, continue boiling, do not stir. When mixture heats to 232 deg. On candy thermometer remove from heat. Stir in pumpkin pie spice, vanilla, butter& the nuts. Let cool to lukewarm. Beat until very thick& until it loses some of its gloss. Quickly, pour mixture into greased 8-inch square pan. When fudge is firm, cut into pieces. ; name: no bake bird seed cookies ; ingredients: oatmeal, raisins, sesame seeds, sunflower seeds, pure maple syrup, crunchy peanut butter, vanilla ; preparation:Stir dry ingredients together. Melt peanut butter and maple syrup until easily mixed. Add vanilla. Mix with dry ingredients until well combined. When cooled, roll into 1 inch balls. ; name: chocolate almond butter crunch ; ingredients: butter, sugar, light corn syrup, water, vanilla extract, toasted almonds, semi-sweet chocolate chips ; preparation:Melt the butter in a heavy 3-liter saucepan on low heat. Add the sugar, corn syrup and water. Cook over medium heat. Stir constantly until it reaches hard crack stage, 300 on candy thermometer. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla extract and the almonds. Spread into a buttered 13 x 9-inch pan. Let stand 5 minutes. Sprinkle with chocolate chips. When chocolate is melted, spread evenly over candy. Let cool completely, and when chocolate is set, break into pieces. ; name: rum banana sauce ; ingredients: brown sugar, butter, heavy whipping cream, maple syrup, bananas, rum extract ; preparation:In a small saucepan, combine the brown sugar, butter, cream and maple syrup. Cook and stir over medium heat for 4-5 minutes or until sauce is smooth. Stir in bananas. Heat through. Remove from the heat. Stir in extract. Serve over ice cream. ; name: new mexican hot chocolate ; ingredients: sugar, cocoa, water, cinnamon, nutmeg, milk, pure vanilla extract, whipped cream, cinnamon sticks ; preparation:Whisk together sugar, cocoa, water, cinnamon, and nutmeg in a saucepan over medium heat. Add milk and cook, stirring, until hot. Add vanilla and stir. Pour chocolate into serving cups and top with whipped cream. Sprinkle with a little cinnamon and nutmeg and serve with a cinnamon stick. ; name: baked pears with raisins ; ingredients: pears, raisins, maple syrup, butter, vanilla extract, cinnamon ; preparation:

name: cabbage and tomato chicken soup ; ingredients: chicken, cabbage, onion, tomatoes, carrots, garlic cloves, fresh chives, fresh basil, salt, pepper ; preparation:Cover chicken with water in a large pot. Cook 1 hour and remove chicken. Meanwhile, prepare remaining ingredients, and add to pot after removing chicken, and cook for 1 hour. Meanwhile, place chicken in baking dish and roast it in a 350 f oven for 30 minutes. After roasting, let chicken cool for 10 minutes before removing meat from the carcass and adding the meat to the soup pot. Simmer until the meat is heated through, and serve. ; name: coconut carrot soup ; ingredients: carrots, ginger, onion, olive oil, vegetable stock, coconut milk, curry powder, salt, pepper ; preparation:Peel and chop carrots, ginger and onion. In a pot, heat oil and fry ginger and onion until translucent. Add carrots and fry for 1-2 minutes. Add stock and boil at medium heat for about 15 minutes. Lightly warm coconut milk and steam like you would steam milk for cappuccino. Add curry powder, salt and pepper to the soup and puree it. Fold in steamed coconut milk and serve immediately. ; name: spinach risotto ; ingredients: onions, garlic, fresh lemon rind, mushroom, arborio rice, chicken stock, white wine, spinach leaves, fresh thyme ; preparation:Heat oil in large pan. Cook onion, garlic, rind and mushrooms. Stir until mushrooms are browned lightly. Add rice, stock and wine, bring to boil. Simmer, covered 15 minutes, stirring midway through cooking. Remove from heat. Let stand, covered 10 minutes. Stir in spinach and thyme. Cover for 1 minute and serve. ; name: bea s garlic potatoes ; ingredients: garlic cloves, pepper, salt, dried thyme, savory, olive oil, fingerling potatoes ; preparation:Preheat oven to 475 degrees. Finely chop garlic, and sprinkle with salt. Mash into a paste with back of spoon. Place in bowl with thyme, savory and oil. Toss potatoes with garlic mixture. Place on foil lined baking sheet and bake until browned, about 20 to 25 minutes. ; name: chicken and bacon casserole ; ingredients: lardons, olive oil, chicken, carrots, baby onions, garlic cloves, chicken stock, fresh thyme, parsley, potato ; preparation:Put the bacon into a small saucepan of cold water and bring to the boil. Simmer for three minutes, drain, and dry the bacon on kitchen paper. Heat a frying pan with two tablespoons of olive oil and saut the blanched bacon until golden and crisp. Remove to a casserole, add the chicken pieces to the pan, adding more oil if necessary. Saute the chicken until golden, and remove from the casserole. Saute the carrots, onions and garlic for a minute or so, in the same oil. Return the bacon and chicken to the pan and pour in the stock, adding a sprig of thyme. Simmer in a preheated oven at 160c for about 45 minutes, or until the chicken is tender. Skim any fat from the top of the casserole and sprinkle with chopped parsley to finish. Serve with mashed potatoes. ; name: potato soup with crispy bacon ; ingredients: oil, bacon, brown onion, garlic clove, potatoes, fresh thyme, chicken stock, water, cream ; preparation:Heat 2 teaspoons of oil over high heat and add 4 rashers of bacon and cook for 2-3 minutes or until crip and then set aside. Heat another 2 teaspoons of oil in the pan and add chopped brown onion and garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add potatoes, 2 sprigs thyme, chicken stock and water and bring to the boil and then reduce heat and simmer for 15-20 minutes. Blend until smooth and stir through cream. Divide into serving bowls and top with crispy bacon to serve. ; name: chicken and stars soup ; ingredients: chicken, carrots, onion, celery, garlic cloves, pasta, parsley, salt and pepper ; preparation:In a stock pot, place chicken, carrots, garlic, onion and celery. Cover with water. Boil for thirty to forty minutes, remove chicken from pot. Allow chicken to cool remove skin and bones, then chop chicken into bite-size pieces. Add chicken back to soup, add parsley, pasta, salt and pepper. Allow to simmer until noodles are cooked. You may need to add water to keep soup soupy after pasta has cooked. Use your own judgment. ; name: mashed garlic carrots ; ingredients: carrots, garlic, vegetable stock, dried thyme, salt and pepper ; preparation:

name: quick sticky buns ; ingredients: unsalted butter, banana, pecans, brown sugar, refrigerated buttermilk biscuits ; preparation:Heat oven to 375 drgrees. Drop a piece of butter in the bottom of each of 10 compartments of a muffin tin. Arrange the banana slices on top. Sprinkle the pecans and brown sugar over the bananas. Top each compartment with a biscuit. Bake until golden, about 8-10 minutes. Remove from oven. Place a baking sheet on top of the buns in the muffin tin while they are atill hot. Carefully flip the tin over, tapping the bottom to release the buns. Transfer to a platter, serve warm. ; name: snappy rolls ; ingredients: refrigerated buttermilk biscuits, italian salad dressing, parmesan cheese, poppy seed, sesame seeds ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f and grease a muffin tin pan. Separate biscuits and dip each into italian salad dressing to coat lightly. Fold biscuits in half. Take two of the folded biscuits and place them together, seam side down into one muffin tin. Repeat with remaining biscuits. Mix together remaining ingredients and sprinkle over the rolls in the pan. Bake until golden- approx 10-12 minutes. ; name: featherweight breakfast cake ; ingredients: butter, egg, milk, all-purpose flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, cinnamon ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Grease 8x8 square pan. Melt butter and cool slightly and add milk and beaten egg, set to the side. In bowl, sift the next four ingredients, 2 times. Add butter, milk, and egg mixture and stir only enough to smooth out any lumps. Combine the remaining sugar and cinnamon for the topping, in a small bowl or in a ziploc bag. Pour batter into greased pan and sprinkle the mixture of sugar and cinnamon over the top and bake 12 to 15 minutes. ; name: easy pineapple buns ; ingredients: crushed pineapple, brown sugar, butter, ground cinnamon, refrigerated biscuits ; preparation:Combine all ingredients except biscuits in a bowl and mix well. Spoon mixture evenly into 10 greased cups of a 12 cup muffin pan. Place 1 biscuit in each cup. Bake in pre-heated 425 degree oven for about 10 minutes. Cool 5 minutes. Remove from pan by inverting pan onto a plate. Serve warm. ; name: cottage cheese pancakes levivot ; ingredients: eggs, cottage cheese, all-purpose flour, baking powder, salt, sugar, unsalted butter, vegetable oil, cinnamon ; preparation:Beat the eggs with a whisk until fluffy. Add the cheese, flour, baking powder and salt, and 1 teaspoon of the sugar, and mix well. Heat a griddle or a nonstick skillet. Add 1 tablespoon each of the butter and the vegetable oil, and heat until the butter is melted. Pour a heaping tablespoon of batter onto the skillet, flattening slightly with the back of the spoon. Cook in batches until golden brown, turn and brown on other side. Repeat with the remaining batter, using the rest of the butter and oil when needed. Drain the pancakes on paper towels. Mix the remaining sugar and the cinnamon in a small bowl. Serve the pancakes sprinkled with the cinnamon and sugar. ; name: caramel ring a round ; ingredients: dark brown sugar, butter, water, nuts, refrigerated biscuits ; preparation:Separate biscuits and cut into fourths. In a bundt pan, place water, sugar, and butter in 425 degree oven for a few minutes, then add nuts and biscuit pieces, and coat. Biscuits should form a ring. Bake 8 to 12 minutes in 425 degree oven. Turn out onto serving platter. ; name: finnish kropser baked pancake ; ingredients: eggs, sugar, salt, milk, all-purpose flour, butter ; preparation:Preheat oven to 450 degrees. In a medium bowl, stir together sugar, flour and salt. Add eggs and milk. Beat with electric mixer until well blended. Melt butter in jelly roll pan. Pour batter in pan and bake for 30 minutes. Pancake will puff up and then flatten as it cools. Serve with syrup, jam, honey or fresh fruit. ; name: cream cheese dessert wedges ; ingredients: refrigerated buttermilk biscuits, cream cheese, sugar, egg, all-purpose flour, ground cinnamon ; preparation:

name: inside out b double t s ; ingredients: flour tortillas, mexican cheese, maple bacon, tomatoes, mayonnaise, sea salt, fresh ground black pepper, butter-flavored cooking spray ; preparation:Spray a large, flat skillet with cooking spray. Drop one tortilla in and fill with lots of cheese. Sprinkle bacon pieces over cheese. Top with another tortilla. Flip over when bottom tortilla is golden brown. Cook until cheese is melted. Slide onto a plate and cut into wedges with a pizza wheel cutter. Slather each piece with mayonnaise and top with a thick slice of tomato. Sprinkle with sea salt and freshly ground black pepper and serve. Cooking time does not include cooking time for the bacon. ; name: sonora scramble ; ingredients: onion, sweet green pepper, butter, tomatoes, eggs, monterey jack cheese, flour tortillas, salsa ; preparation:Cook the onion and pepper in a skillet in the butter until the onion is translucent. Add tomatoes. Simmer 5 minutes. Add the eggs. Cook like scrambled eggs. When cooked sprinkle the cheese over the eggs and allow it to melt. Serve warm with hot tortillas and salsa. ; name: jana s church enchiladas ; ingredients: flour tortillas, ground beef, onion, taco seasoning, cream of chicken soup, milk, green chilies, velveeta cheese, green onion dip ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Brown ground beef and onion. After meat is finished, add taco seasoning. In a saucepan, combine soup, milk, green chilies, velveeta and onion dip. Heat on low till creamy. Fill tortillas with spoonful of meat, roll and put seamside down. Pour creamy mixture over tortillas in a 9x13 pan. Cook at 350 for 20-30 minutes. ; name: michael symon s sloppy mikes ; ingredients: ground beef, bacon, american cheese, potato dinner rolls, chopped tomatoes, onion, salt, smoked paprika, olive oil, chicken stock ; preparation:Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add ground beef with a pinch of salt and paprika. In a second pan add remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil and bacon. Cook for 1-2 minutes. Add onion to pan and continue cooking. Add tomatoes and simmer for another minute. Transfer onion, tomato and bacon mixture to the browning meat. Stir to combine ingredients. Add cheese and stir to combine and melt. Serve sloppy mikes on potato rolls. ; name: kickn quesadillas ; ingredients: cheese, vegetables, hot sauce, chicken, garlic, jalapeno, tortillas ; preparation:Take your tortillas and drop in all of your ingredients on top of it. Cheese will normally go first. If you would like to add your hot sauce, drop a tsp. Of it on top of every thing. Put into a hot pan and let cook until cheese starts to melt. Next add your second tortilla on top and flip. Let cook for about 3-8 minutes until serving. ; name: homemade hamburger helper ; ingredients: oil, onion, garlic, salt, ground beef, tomatoes, macaroni and cheese mix, milk, butter, american cheese ; preparation:Start water boiling for pasta. Heat oil or butter in skillet. Add onions and garlic and saute. When wilted, add beef and seasonings. Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and prepare with milk, butter and cheese sauce packet. Set aside over low heat. When beef is only slightly pink, add tomatoes. Continue cooking till meat is done. Stir beef mixture into mac and cheese, add extra cheese and stir until melted. ; name: tortilla tomato soup ; ingredients: olive oil, tomatoes, onion, corn tortillas, jalapeno, cilantro, chicken stock, salt and pepper ; preparation:Saute tomatoes, onion, tortillas, jalapenos, cilantro in olive oil in heavy pot. Cook until tortillas and tomatoes are soft. Add chicken stock and seasonings. Bring to boil and reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Pureee soup in small batches using either a blender or imulsion type tool in the pan. Strain. Pour back in pan and reheat. Serve with crispy tortilla strips, sliced avacado, grated cheese. ; name: low carb taco potatoes ; ingredients: aluminum foil, onion, red potatoes, taco seasoning, olive oil, mexican blend cheese ; preparation:

name: incredible granola bars ; ingredients: rolled oats, oat bran, brown sugar, sunflower oil, honey, salt, cocoa nibs, dried banana ; preparation:Mix all ingredients thoroughly,. Press into an oiled 9 inch square tray,. And bake for 20-25 minutes at 350 degrees. Allow to cool before cutting into bars. Will keep for weeks stored in airtight container in fridge. Also freezes well. ; name: no bakes ; ingredients: sugar, cocoa, salt, milk, butter, peanut butter, quick oatmeal ; preparation:Mix sugar, cocoa, and salt. Add milk and butter. Boil the mixture for one minute. After boiling, add peanut butter and oatmeal. Mix well, put on wax paper. ; name: low fat granola bars ; ingredients: oats, whole wheat flour, wheat germ, ground cinnamon, honey, raisins ; preparation:Preheat oven to 300f. Coat an 8-inch square pan using nonstick cooking spray. Combine oats, flour, wheat germ, and cinnamon. Stir until well mixed. Add honey, stirring until mixture is moist and crumbly. Fold in raisins. Press mixture into pan and bake for 18 to 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool to room temperature, cut into 12 bars and serve. ; name: cocoa dreams ; ingredients: sugar, cocoa, butter, milk, quick oats, peanut butter, vanilla ; preparation:In large pan bring first 4 ingredients to a boil. Boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Add remaining ingredients and mix well. Drop by tablespoonfuls on waxed paper to set--they are not baked. ; name: raisin spice cookies ; ingredients: oatmeal cookie mix, eggs, milk, cinnamon, nutmeg, clove, raisins, pecans ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees and line large cookie sheets with parchment paper. In a large bowl, add the cookie mix and add beaten eggs, milk and spices. Stirring to blend well. Stir in the raisins and nuts. Drop by teaspoonfuls about 2 inches apart on baking sheets and bake for 12 to 15 minutes or until edges are browned. Remove to wire racks to cool. ; name: snooty modern french toast ; ingredients: whole wheat bread, egg whites, skim milk, cinnamon, nutmeg, vanilla extract, sugar, banana ; preparation:Spray and begin heating a nonstick skillet on med-high. Whisk together egg whites, spices, vanilla, sugar and milk in a bowl or small dish. Slice your bread however you desire. Dip and soak your bread until most of the mixture is absorbed. Cook bread slices on the skillet, flipping two or three times, until nice and crispy on the outside. This may take up to 4-6 minutes per side, since the bread has absorbed more than normal french toast bread. Put banana slices on top of bread, and, if you feel like adding the calories, a bit of maple syrup. ; name: banana chocolate peanut butter smoothie ; ingredients: ovaltine, banana, peanut butter, water, sugar, cashews, cinnamon ; preparation:Put all ingredients in a blender. Blend until mixed. Put cashews in if wanted. Blend, but leave cashews chunky. Pour into a glass. Put cinnamon on top of the poured smoothie. ; name: crunchy banana cinnamon oatmeal ; ingredients: oatmeal, milk, cinnamon, banana, cereal ; preparation:

name: vegetarian corn bean and rice wraps ; ingredients: black beans, corn, cooked brown rice, diced onion, tomato sauce, stewed tomatoes, extra virgin olive oil, salt, pepper, garlic ; preparation:Cook brown rice as package directs. For extra flavor, add a tablespoon of vegetarian bouillon--it makes it really tasty. As brown rice is cooking, saut the onion in a tablespoon of extra virgin olive oil. Once onion is softened and browned a bit, add drained and rinsed beans and corn. Turn off heat. Once rice is done, add to the corn and beans. Mix well. Then mix in 1 to 2 cans of tomato sauce. Cook until hot. Serve in tortillas with salsa if desired. ; name: easy vegetable rice medley ; ingredients: oil, onion, carrot, celery rib, red pepper, chicken broth, minute white rice, frozen peas, salt and pepper ; preparation:Heat oil in a skillet. Add onion, carrot, celery, and red pepper. Cook 5 minutes or until tender. Add broth. Bring to a boil. Stir in rice and peas. Cover. Simmer 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Let stand 5 minutes before serving. To save time, replace all the veggies with 3 cups frozen mixed vegetables or frozen broccoli florets and add them when you would have added the peas. ; name: turkey chili con carne ; ingredients: ground turkey, onion soup mix, chili powder, red kidney beans, black beans, crushed tomatoes ; preparation:Place ground turkey in large skillet. Sprinkle with onion soup mix. Brown meat well. Add the beans, chili powder, and crushed tomatoes. Simmer covered 30 to 40 minutes. ; name: canadian baked beans with maple syrup no molasses ; ingredients: white pea beans, onion, dry mustard, summer savory, ground black pepper, chili powder, maple syrup, salt pork, salt ; preparation:Soak beans overnight to cut down on cooking time. Drain and place in a 4 quart bean pot. Mix seasonings and maple syrup together and stir into beans. Add enough water to cover. Peel onion and remove root and blossom ends. Push whole onion down into beans and place the salt pork next to it. Bake covered in a 250 degree oven for about 8 hours. Check on them every hour or so and see if you need to add water so they never dry out. When finished if you want the sauce to be thicker then you can always stir in some refried bean flakes and let sit to thicken. ; name: day after the holiday turkey soup ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, carrots, celery, chicken stock, corn, turkey, salt, pepper, lemon ; preparation:In a heavy saucepan, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat and add finely diced onions, carrots, and celery. Cook until soft and golden brown, about 5 to 6 minutes. Add corn, turkey, salt and pepper and the chicken stock then bring to a boil. Let the soup simmer uncovered for 10 to 15 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Before serving squeeze in the juice of a lemon. Leftover rice may be substituted for the corn. ; name: mexican rice easy ; ingredients: vegetable oil, long-grain white rice, garlic salt, ground cumin, taco seasoning, onion, tomato sauce, chicken broth ; preparation:Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add rice and cook, stirring constantly. Sprinkle with salt, cumin, and taco seasoning. Cook stirring constantly, until slightly translucent. Stir in onions and cook until tender. Stir in tomato sauce and chicken broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 20 to 25 minutes. Fluff with a fork. ; name: gozzoo ; ingredients: oil, black mustard seeds, asafoetida powder, cayenne, onions, tomatoes, salt, hot chili peppers ; preparation:Heat 3 tablespoons of oil over medium-high heat. Add mustard seeds and cover until they stop sputtering. Add onions and stir. Add cayenne and asafetida and cook, stirring, until the onions have wilted. Add tomatoes, salt and chilies. Cook partially covered for 15 to 20 minutes. Allow to rest for 30 minutes before serving. ; name: world s easiest chili ; ingredients: vegetable oil, onion, ground turkey, cumin seed, tomatoes, kidney beans, red chili powder, black pepper, sazon goya, salt ; preparation:

name: wisconsin cheddar cheese and cauliflower quick gratin ; ingredients: cauliflower, water, sour cream, chives, salt & pepper, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Place cauliflower and water in a two-quart microwave dish. Cover, cook on high for 6 minutes. Stir. Cook another 6-8 minutes. Drain. In a small bowl, combine sour cream, chives, s & p. Spoon over veggies. Sprinkle with cheese. Pop it back into the microwave for another 2 minutes--cheese should be melted. ; name: syrniki with potato ; ingredients: cottage cheese, potatoes, egg, butter, sugar, flour, salt, sour cream, raisins ; preparation:First clean and peel the potatoes and boil in salted water, drain and mash. Then drain the cottage cheese, sieve to remove lumps, and mix it with the mashed potato. Beat in raw egg, salt, sugar and half the flour. Stir well to form a stiff paste. Work on a floured surface and flatten into thick pancakes about 3 inches in diameter. Coat them with flour and fry in butter on each side until golden brown. Serve hot with sour cream well chilled. ; name: two potato mash ; ingredients: potatoes, sweet potatoes, milk, cheddar cheese, sour cream, green onions, salt, nutmeg ; preparation:Peel and quarter regular potatoes. Peel and cut sweet potatoes into eighths. In a large saucepan, cover regular potatoes with cold water. Bring to a boil and cook 5 minutes. Add sweet potatoes and cook another 15 minutes or until fork tender. Drain potatoes, and return to low heat for 3 minutes to dry, shaking occasionally. Mash potatoes until smooth. Continue mashing while gradually adding milk. Stir in remaining ingredients. ; name: mashed potatoes extraordinaire ; ingredients: potatoes, cream cheese, sour cream, butter, onion powder, salt, pepper, paprika ; preparation:Cook potatoes as usual in salted water until tender. Drain. Push through potato ricer. Add cream cheese in pieces. Add next 5 ingredients. Beat until smooth and fluffy. Scrape into a 2 qt casserole. Place dabs of butter here and there over the top of the potatoes. Sprinkle with paprika. Cover and heat in 350 f oven until heated through. ; name: dill sour cream mashed potatoes ; ingredients: milk, butter, baking potatoes, salt, pepper, sour cream, dried dill ; preparation:Place milk& butter in a medium bowl. Cook potatoes in boiling water to cover, 15 minutes or until tender. Drain. Mash with milk& butter in the bowl. Stir in remaining ingredients. Serve immediately. ; name: special green bean casserole ; ingredients: butter, flour, salt, sugar, pepper, onion, sour cream, french style green beans, swiss cheese, corn flakes ; preparation:Saute onion in butter. Add flour, salt, sugar and pepper. Mix in sour cream, beans and cheese. Pour into 9x13 baking dish. Top with cornflakes. Bake at 400 degrees for 20 minutes. ; name: spinach and cheese mashed potatoes ; ingredients: potatoes, sour cream, salt and pepper, green onions, butter, spinach, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Set oven to 400 degrees. Butter a 2-quart casserole dish. In a large bowl, combine all ingredients, except the grated cheddar cheese. Spoon into prepared baking dish. Bake, uncovered for 15 minutes. Remove from oven, top with grated cheddar, bake for 5 minutes longer. If desired, roasted garlic may be added to mixture. ; name: crunchy cheese potatoes ; ingredients: sour cream, milk, chives, salt, pepper, potatoes, sharp cheddar cheese, corn flakes ; preparation:

name: lentils couscous recipe ; ingredients: lentils, couscous, onions, olive oil, water, salt, black pepper, cumin, cayenne ; preparation:Saute onions with olive oil until golden brown. Reserve 4 tablespoons of browned onions for garnish. Meanwhile place lentils, water salt, and black pepper in a different saucepan and cook for around 20 minutes or until lentils are tender. Add couscous, browned onions, cumin, and dash of cayenne to the lentils, stir, cover and simmer for about 5-10 minutes or until water is absorbed. Place lentils and couscous in serving dish and garnish with 4 tablespoons of reserved browned onions. This recipe is best when served with tomatoe salad. See my recipe for tomatoe salad. ; name: spanish chickpea soup ; ingredients: olive oil, onions, carrot, chickpeas, vegetable stock, salt and pepper, bay leaf, butter, lemon juice ; preparation:Add oil and onions to a medium saucepan and saute on low heat, stirring, until very well done. Add the carrot and chickpeas, and saute for 2 minutes, stirring continuously. Add stock and bring to boil. Add seasonings and simmer on low until veggies are tender, adding water if necessary and stirring on occasion. Remove bay leaf and puree soup. Add butter and lemon juice. Simmer until heated through. Serve hot. ; name: tomato lentil stew ; ingredients: lentils, onions, oil, chopped tomatoes, water, oregano, basil, black pepper, salt ; preparation:Cook lentils in the water. Meanwhile, chop the onions. Saut onions in a little oil. Add the tomatoes when the onions are translucent. Cook 5-10 min then add the lentils. Cook 5 more minutes. ; name: marinated garbanzo salad ; ingredients: olive oil, yellow onion, dried thyme, red pepper, dark raisin, garbanzo beans, salt, white wine vinegar ; preparation:Heat the olive oil in a saucepan. Add the onions and thyme and cook over low heat, covered, until onions are tender and lightly colored, about 25 minutes. Add chopped red pepper and cook for another 5 minutes. Add raisins and garbanzos and cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Do not overcook the garbanzos or they will become mushy. Season with salt, transfer to a bowl, and pour the vinegar over the hot mixture. Let vegetables cool to room temperature, then cover and refrigerate for at least 24 hours before serving. Allow to return to room temperature before serving. ; name: braised lettuce with peas and lemon ; ingredients: olive oil, shallots, boston lettuce, chicken broth, dried thyme, sugar, frozen peas, lemon zest, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:Heat the oil in a large skillet over moderate heat. Saut the shallots until tender, about 5 minutes. Add the lettuce, chicken broth. Thyme, and sugar and simmer covered over low heat for about 5 minutes, until the lettuce is tender. Add the peas and cook an additional 5 minutes. Add the lemon zest, salt, and pepper, and serve immediately. ; name: thymed onions ; ingredients: olive oil, unsalted butter, onions, fresh thyme, salt, black pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425f degrees. Heat the oil and butter in large roasting dish. Remove outer skins off the onions but keep them whole. Add the onions to the dish and toss them in the oil and butter mixture over a medium heat until lightly sauteed. Add the thyme and seasoning and roast for 45-50 minutes, basting regularly. ; name: white bean soup with bay and pancetta ; ingredients: olive oil, butter, onions, sea salt, bay leaves, cannellini beans, chicken stock, extra virgin olive oil, pancetta ; preparation:Heat the oil and butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion, salt and bay leaves-cook until the onion is softened. Add the beans and stock, bring to the boil, then reduce the heat and simmer 10 minutes. Remove the bay leaves and puree the soup until smooth. Serve in soup bowls drizzled with olive oil and sprinkled with the crispy pancetta. ; name: fakes salata lentil salad ; ingredients: french lentils, bay leaves, olive oil, oranges, salt, fresh ground black pepper, red onion, orange ; preparation:

name: grandma chin s sponge cake ; ingredients: eggs, sugar, salt, vanilla, butter, milk, flour, baking powder ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Beat eggs until light. Beat in sugar, salt and vanilla. Beat in milk and butter. Add dry ingredients very quickly and pour into a greased 9x13 pan. Bake 25 to 35 minutes or until toothpick placed in middle comes out clean. Serve with strawberries and whipped cream. ; name: chocolate chewy cookies ; ingredients: butter, sugar, eggs, vanilla, unsifted flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, salt, chocolate chips ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. In a bowl, combine flour, cocoa powder, baking soda and salt. Set aside. In a large mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar. Add eggs and vanilla, mix well. Gradually beat in the flour mixture then add chocolate chips. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto greased baking sheets. Bake 10-12 minutes. Let cookies rest on baking sheets for 2 minutes before removing with a spatula to wire racks to cool completely. ; name: quick chocolate chip scones ; ingredients: flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, baking soda, egg, skim milk, lemon juice, butter, chocolate chips ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f. Place wax paper on a large baking sheet. Combine dry ingredients in a large bowl. Combine other ingredients in a second bowl. Blend the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients. Add chocolate chips. Drop by large spoonfuls onto the baking sheet. Bake 15 minutes. ; name: 20 minute huckleberry muffins ; ingredients: flour, baking powder, salt, huckleberries, eggs, milk, sugar, butter, vanilla ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f grease a standard 12-muffin pan or line with paper cups. Thoroughly mix the flour, baking powder, salt and huckleberries together in a large bowl. Set aside. In another bowl, whisk together eggs, milk or cream, sugar, butter, and vanilla. Add the wet ingredients to the dry and mix together with a few light strokes just until just blended. Do not overmix. The batter should not be smooth. Divide the batter among the muffin cups. Bake for 15 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in 1 or 2 of the muffins comes out clean. Let cool for a few minutes, and serve warm. ; name: holiday eggnog bread ; ingredients: flour, baking powder, salt, butter, walnuts, egg, sugar, nutmeg, eggnog, candied fruit ; preparation:Sift dry ingredients together including sugar. Combine eggnog, melted butter and egg. Stir into dry ingredients just to blend. Blend in nuts and fruits. Place mixture into a greased and floured 9 inch loaf pan. Bake in a preheated 350f oven about 60 to 70 minutes or tested done. Remove from pan and cool completely before slicing. ; name: drop scones ; ingredients: flour, baking powder, sugar, salt, butter, egg, milk, raisins ; preparation:Preheat oven to 450. Grease or spray a large cookie sheet. Stir together dry ingredients including the sugar. Cut butter into flour mixture. Add raisins, stir to mix well. Beat egg in measuring cup. Add milk to make 1 cup. Stir into flour. Drop roughly tablespoon size scoops on cookie sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes. ; name: buckingham palace scones ; ingredients: flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, butter, egg, milk ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425f. Sift together flour, sugar, baking powder and salt. Chop in the butter until the particles of butter are the size of coarse cornmeal. Add the egg and milk. Stir quickly and lightly, only until no flour shows. Add more milk if needed to make dough soft. Turn the dough out on a floured surface and knead gently about 15 times. Cut the dough in half. Shape each half into a ball, press each down into a round and cut into 8 wedges like a pie. Place the wedges on a greased cookie sheet without allowing the sides to touch. Bake until golden brown about 12 minutes. ; name: peanut butter and chocolate chip bars ; ingredients: flour, baking powder, salt, butter, sugar, eggs, vanilla, walnuts, chocolate chips, peanut butter ; preparation:

name: bbq cheddar chicken roll ups ; ingredients: green bell pepper, red bell pepper, sweet onion, boneless skinless chicken breast, barbecue sauce, whole wheat tortillas, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Cook and stir vegetables in large nonstick skillet on medium-high heat for 3 minutes. Add chicken, cook and stir 3-4 minutes or until no longer pink. Stir in barbecue sauce. Cook on medium heat 3 minutes or until chicken is done, stirring occasionally. Spoon chicken mixture down centers of tortillas. Top with cheese. Roll up. Cut in half. ; name: barbecue chicken quesadillas ; ingredients: red onion, bell pepper, butter, cooked chicken, barbecue sauce, monterey jack cheese, cilantro, flour tortillas ; preparation:Saute onions and bell peppers in pan with butter. Remove from pan and set aside. In another pan heat through shredded chicken with bbq sauce. Lightly butter one side of a tortilla. Place butter side down in saute pan. Quickly add some of the cheese, chicken and onions to one half of tortilla. Then quickly fold in half forming a semi-circle. Continue to cook until bottom side is golden brown, then carefully flip quesadilla over. Brown other side and remove from pan. Repeat with remaining ingredients. Cut quesadilla into wedges and serve with additional barbecue sauce. ; name: tostadas burros pronto ; ingredients: refried beans, green chili, beef broth, tostadas, flour tortillas, lettuce, chopped tomato, cheddar cheese, salsa, enchilada sauce ; preparation:Mix beans, green chiles, and broth. Heat in microwave until hot or heat on the stove if desired. Warm tostada shells in 350 oven for 3 to 4 minutes. Place some of the bean mixture on the flour tortillas with cheese and roll up. Wrap with foil and place in oven for a few minutes to melt cheese. Serve the tostadas cafetieria style by having each person make their own. Put some bean mixture on top of the shell and sprinkle with cheese. Microwave to melt the cheese if desired. Put lettuce, tomatoes, and salsa on top and eat. Remove burros from the foil and top with any of the lettuce, tomatoes, salsa, or my favorite the enchilada sauce. ; name: buffalo style chicken nachos recipe ; ingredients: cooked chicken, hot sauce, butter, tortilla chips, cheddar cheese, green onions, ranch dressing ; preparation:In a bowl, toss chicken with hot sauce and butter. Layer chips, chicken mixture and cheese in baking dish. Sprinkle with green onions. Bake nachos at 350f for 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Splash on more hot sauce to taste. Serve with ranch dressing on the side for dipping. ; name: sarah s beef enchiladas with chicken soup ; ingredients: hamburger, green chilies, refried beans, cream of chicken soup, sour cream, onions, cheddar cheese, flour tortilla, salt, pepper ; preparation:Brown the hamburger. Drain off fat, mix in chillies and re-fried beans. Heat and then set aside. Mix soup, sour cream and onion together, heat on medium heat until mixed thoroughly. Add enough of the soup mixture to lightly cover the bottom of a greased 9x13 inch pan. Place a scoop of meat and scoop of soup mixture in each tortilla, sprinkle cheese on top. Place in baking dish. Repeat until dish is full. Pour remaining soup mixture on top and top that with the cheese. Bake at 300f for 30 minutes. ; name: grilled ham cheese quesadillas ; ingredients: tortillas, dijon mustard, ham, sweet green pepper, cheddar cheese, green onion, jalapeno, salsa ; preparation:Lay the tortilla on a work surface, spread it with the mustard. Lay the ham on top to cover the whole tortilla. On one side of the tortilla lay the peppers, sharp cheddar and sprinkle the chopped green onion and jalepeno over. Fold the tortilla in half. Have the grill very hot, lay the folded quesadilla on the grill and press it down. Grill for about 6 or 8 minutes until the cheese melts, then flip it and grill the other side. Use a panni press if available and no need to flip. Remove to plate and slice in half. Spread half the salsa on each tortilla half. ; name: leftover turkey or chicken enchiladas ; ingredients: cooked turkey, vegetables, cheddar cheese, mexican blend cheese, salsa, cumin, chili powder, hot sauce, tortillas ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. In a bowl toss turkey, vegetables, cheese, salsa, hot sauce, chili powder, and cumin. Spoon filling into tortilla shells. You may need to use more than four if your shells are small. Roll the tortilla up and place seam side down into a lightly greased baking pan. Top with extra cheese and salsa if desired. Baked until heated through, about 15-20 minutes. ; name: super easy cheese enchiladas ; ingredients: extra-sharp cheddar cheese, corn tortillas, vegetable oil, onion, enchilada sauce, chili without beans ; preparation:

name: cowboy soup ; ingredients: ground beef, onion, green pepper, enchilada sauce, vegetable soup, ranch style beans, whole kernel corn ; preparation:Combine ground beef, onion, and green pepper in large saucepan. Cook till onion and pepper are tender. Drain off fat. Add enchilada sauce, soup, beans, and corn to ground beef and onion mixture. Stir to combine. Simmer for 15 minutes. ; name: wimpy burgers ; ingredients: cooked bacon, hamburger, celery, onion, green pepper, tomato soup, salt, pepper ; preparation:Brown celery, onion and pepper in bacon fat until tender. Combine all ingredients in sauce pan. Cover and simmer until cooked through. Place mixture on hamburger buns. Place in warm oven until warm. ; name: hamburger casserole ; ingredients: hamburger, green beans, onion, sharp cheddar cheese, egg, tomato soup, potatoes ; preparation:Cook and mash potatoes, add egg to potatoes while mashing. Set aside. Brown hamburger and onion, drain. Add beans and soup, stir well. Place in a greased casserole dish. Put mashed potatoes on top of meat mixture. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 350 for 35-40 minutes. ; name: easy cabbage soup ; ingredients: green onions, green peppers, green cabbage head, celery, canned stewed tomatoes, lipton onion soup mix, chicken bouillon cube, salt ; preparation:Cut vegetables in small pieces. In a large pot, add vegetables, soup mix, bouillon cube and cover with water. Season as desired. Boil rapidly for ten minutes. Lower heat and simmer until vegetables are tender. ; name: cabbage creole ; ingredients: ground beef, onion, green pepper, cabbage, tomatoes and green chilies, cheddar cheese soup, salt and pepper ; preparation:Chop the onion and green pepper. Slice the cabbage. In a large pan, brown the gound beef with the onions and peppers. Drain and remove from pan. Put the sliced cabbage in the pan. Add the rotel tomatoes. Cook on medium heat until cabbage is tender. Add the meat mixture to the cabbage and stir well. Stir in the cheese soup until well blended. Cover and cook over low hear for at least 1 hour. Add salt and pepper to taste. ; name: chelle s spicy spinach dip ; ingredients: frozen spinach, sour cream, green onions, water chestnuts, dry vegetable soup mix, cayenne pepper ; preparation:Thaw spinach on counter or in microwave. Thoroughly wring out the moisture from the spinach by squeezing it in a tea towel. Chop up the spinach in the food processor and place in mixing bowl. Drain and chop up the water chestnuts in the food processor. Cut the green onions in small chunks and run through the food processor. Mix it all together with the sour cream and the soup mix. Mix in cayenne pepper to your level of hotness. Chill for at least 4 hours before serving. ; name: sweet potato tuna pattie ; ingredients: sweet potato, potatoes, tuna, curry and rice soup mix, egg, onion, oil ; preparation:Peel and cook all of the potatoes in boiling water. Chop up onion and mix with tuna, dutch curry& rice soup mix and egg. Once potatoes are cooked drain and mash. Fold potatoes into tuna mixture. Let cool. Once cooled mould into patties and fry in oil until brown. ; name: boy scout foil dinner ; ingredients: hamburger, lipton onion soup mix, onions, red potatoes, baby carrots, olive oil, salt and pepper ; preparation:

name: quick supper frit ; ingredients: potato, green onions, olive oil, eggs, milk, cheddar cheese, sausage ; preparation:In a medium sized non-stick skillet heat the olive oil. Saute the onion and potatoes until browned and tender. Pour eggs over the top and cook until almost set. Sprinkle cheese over top and cover until eggs are completely set and cheese has melted. Serve while hot. ; name: layer salad ; ingredients: iceberg lettuce, red onion, crisp bacon, cauliflower, sugar, mayonnaise, parmesan cheese, salt and pepper ; preparation:Layer salad ingredients in order as listed in air tight container. Mix salad dressing ingredients together. Put salad dressing on top of layered salad. Do not mix. Refrigerate overnight. Do not unseal until ready to serve. Mix just before serving. ; name: onion in custard ; ingredients: onion, butter, eggs, cream, salt and pepper, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Saute onions in butter until transparent, 6-8 minutes. Place in a baking dish. Beat eggs until they are light, mix in cream and seasonings. Pour mixture over onions. Sprinkle on parmesan cheese. Bake at 425, uncovered, for 15 minutes. ; name: pan haggerty ; ingredients: bacon fat, potatoes, onions, cheddar cheese, salt, black pepper ; preparation:Melt the fat over low heat in a heavy frying pan and make sure that it covers the entire surface of the pan. Fill the pan with alternate layers of potatoes, onions and cheese, beginning and ending with a layer of potatoes. Season each layer with a little salt and pepper. Fry gently for about 30 minutes, then broil for 5 to 10 minutes until the top is well browned. Serve straight from the frying pan. ; name: e z mex tex omelet ; ingredients: onion, bell pepper, butter, eggs, parmesan cheese, cream, salt, pepper, cheddar cheese, salsa ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Saute veggies in oil about 3 minutes. Mix eggs, cheese, cream, butter, salt and pepper. Pour over vegetables. Cook, stirring gently, until eggs are set on bottom, about 3 minutes. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 5 to 7 minutes or until cheese is melted and eggs are set. Cover with salsa and serve. ; name: artichoke omelette ; ingredients: light butter, onion, eggs, artichoke hearts, green olives, milk, cheese, salt and pepper ; preparation:Saute onions in butter in 12 inch fry pan. Beat eggs in bowl with artichoke hearts, olives, milk, salt and pepper. Pour mixture over onions in pan and cover. Cook over medium heat until the bottom of the omelette is golden brown, carefully lift edge with spatula to check. Lay cheese over half of omelette. Flip other half of omelette over cheese half. Wait about 1 minute. Slide out of pan and serve hot. ; name: country style scrambled eggs ; ingredients: bacon, red potatoes, onion, green pepper, eggs, milk, salt, pepper, cheddar cheese ; preparation:In a large skillet, cook bacon over medium heat until crisp. Using a slotted spoon, remove to paper towels to drain. Cook and stir potatoes in drippings over medium heat for 12 minutes or until tender. Add onion and green pepper. Cook and stir for 3 or 4 minutes or until crisp-tender. Drain. Stir in the reserved bacon. In a large bowl, whisk the eggs, milk, salt and pepper. Add to skillet. Cook and stir until eggs are completely set. Sprinkle with cheese and let stand until cheese has melted. ; name: extra sharp cheddar oven omelet ; ingredients: bacon, green onions, eggs, light cream, seasoning salt, extra-sharp cheddar cheese, sweet onion ; preparation:

name: kiwi cookies ; ingredients: butter, white sugar, sweetened condensed milk, baking powder, flour, chocolate chips ; preparation:Combine butter and sugar until creamy. Add milk, and stir. Add baking powder and flour and combine until just mixed. Add chocolate chips and mix all together. Roll dough into balls and place on an ungreased cookie sheet. Press down with fork tines. Bake in a moderate over at 350 and remove when the bottoms become golden brown. Makes approximately 14-16 cookies. ; name: krispies chocolate chippers ; ingredients: margarine, sugar, vanilla, eggs, flour, salt, baking powder, baking soda, chocolate chips, rice krispies ; preparation:Cream margarine and sugar in mixer bowl til light and fluffy. Add vanilla and eggs. Beat for 5 minutes. Sift flour, salt, baking powder and baking soda into mixture. Mix well. Stir in chocolate chips and rice krispies. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto non-stick cookie sheet. Bake at 375f for 9-10 minutes, or until golden brown. Cool on wire rack. ; name: soft and yummy chocolate chip cookies ; ingredients: margarine, brown sugar, white sugar, egg, vanilla, flour, salt, baking soda, chocolate chips ; preparation:Cream margarine. Add gradually and beat in brown sugar and white sugar. Beat in egg and vanilla. Sift and stir in flour, salt, baking soda. Add chocolate chips. Bake 10 minutes at 375. ; name: abby s ultimate chocolate chocolate chip cookies ; ingredients: butter, white sugar, eggs, vanilla extract, all-purpose flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, salt, semi-sweet chocolate chips, milk chocolate chips ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In large bowl, beat butter, sugar, eggs, and vanilla until light and fluffy. Combine the flour, cocoa, baking soda, and salt. Stir into the butter mixture until well blended. Mix in the chocolate chips. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven, or just until set. Cool slightly on the cookie sheets before transferring to wire racks to cool completely. ; name: chocolate chewy cookies ; ingredients: butter, sugar, eggs, vanilla, unsifted flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, salt, chocolate chips ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. In a bowl, combine flour, cocoa powder, baking soda and salt. Set aside. In a large mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar. Add eggs and vanilla, mix well. Gradually beat in the flour mixture then add chocolate chips. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto greased baking sheets. Bake 10-12 minutes. Let cookies rest on baking sheets for 2 minutes before removing with a spatula to wire racks to cool completely. ; name: fudge crackles ; ingredients: flour, baking powder, salt, semi-sweet chocolate chips, unsweetened chocolate squares, butter, vanilla, sugar, eggs, pecans ; preparation:Combine flour, baking powder and salt. Set aside. Melt 1 cup of semi-sweet chips, unsweetened chocolate and butter in microwave. Let cool slightly. Beat sugar and eggs until thick and creamy. Mix in melted chocolate and vanilla. Stir in flour until just mixed. Fold in remaining semi-sweet chips and pecans. Chill 30 mins. Drop by rounded tablespoon fulls on to ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 for 8 mins or until tops are cracked and shiny. Cool 3-5 mins and remove to wire racks to cool. ; name: 7 up chocolate chip pound cake ; ingredients: butter, sugar, vanilla, eggs, all-purpose flour, cocoa, 7-up soda, semi-sweet chocolate chips ; preparation:Cream butter with an electric mixer. Add sugar and vanilla. Beat until light and fluffy. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in flour and cocoa, blending thoroughly. Stir in 7up. Fold in chocolate chips. Spoon into a well greased 10-inch tube pan. Bake at 350 for 1 hour. Cool in pan on a wire rack for 10 minutes. Remove from pan, cool completely. ; name: white chocolate chip brownies ; ingredients: margarine, sugar, eggs, flour, cocoa powder, white chocolate chips ; preparation:

name: easy italian chicken soup ; ingredients: chicken breasts, olive oil, chicken broth, water, penne pasta, great northern beans, diced tomatoes with garlic and olive oil, corn, italian seasoning ; preparation:Heat broth and water to boiling. Add pasta as soon as boiling begins. Meanwhile, heat olive oil in skillet and add chicken breasts, cook until browned. Add can of tomatoes to chicken and simmer for 5 minutes. Lower pasta and broth temp to medium. Add canned ingredients, italian seasoning and chicken to broth. Simmer on medium for about 15-20 minutes or until pasta is the way you like it. ; name: tomato and crispy bacon fettuccini ; ingredients: dry fettuccine, lean bacon, green beans, yellow pepper, pasta sauce, dried basil, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Cook fettuccini in a large saucepan of boiling water until dente and drain well. Heat a dash of oil in a frying pan and quickly cook the bacon pieces until crisp and golden, set aside. Add the beans and pepper to the pan and cook until tender. Pour in the pasta sauce, add the bacon and cook, stirring until hot. Toss through the well drained fettuccini with basil leaves. Serve with grated parmesan cheese on the side. ; name: linguica and green beans ; ingredients: fresh green beans, onion, garlic cloves, green bell pepper, potatoes, linguica sausage, allspice, crushed red pepper flakes, tomato sauce ; preparation:Saute onion, garlic, and bell pepper in 1-2 tablespoons butter or olive oil until onions are tender. Place onions, garlic, bell pepper, potatoes, linguica, and green beans in a large saucepan. Add enough water to cover. Add all-spice, red pepper, tomato sauce or crushed tomatoes, salt and pepper. Cover and simmer until beans are crisp tender and potatoes are fork tender. ; name: parmesan crumbed fish bake ; ingredients: bread, basil, olive oil, parmesan cheese, white fish fillets, pasta sauce ; preparation:Preheat oven to 180c lightly grease 7cm deep 24cm square baking dish. Place bread in food processor and process until roughly chopped. Add basil and oil and process to a fine breadcrumb mixture. Transfer to mixing bowl and add parmesan. Season fish with salt and pepper. Place in a single layer in baking dish. Spoon over the pasta sauce. Sprinkle the breadcrumb mixture over the top. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until fish is cooked and top is golden. ; name: almost fat free tuna helper healthy ; ingredients: whole wheat pasta, garbanzo beans, salt, tuna, pepper, onion, olive oil ; preparation:Puree cooked garbanzo beans in a blender -- add water if necessary to get the blender to work. Chop onions and fry in olive oil. Add pureed beans, salt, crushed pepper, and tuna to fried onions. Add water until the mixture is of sauce consistency and simmer 10 minutes. Boil pasta as directed on package and drain -- add to sauce mixture. ; name: pesto chicken and pasta ; ingredients: farfalle pasta, cooked chicken, pesto sauce, roasted red pepper, sliced ripe olives, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain. Mix the cooked pasta, chicken, pesto, and bell peppers in a saucepan. Heat over low heat, stirring frequently, until hot. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Garnish with olives and sprinkle a little parmesan cheese on top. ; name: antipasto salad stack ; ingredients: rotini pasta, tomatoes, pepperoni, red kidney beans, green olives, parmesan cheese, italian salad dressing, romaine lettuce leaves ; preparation:Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain. Cool slightly. While pasta is cooking, arrange tomatoes and half of pepperoni around bottom edge of 3 quart glass serving bowl. Layer cooked pasta, remaining pepperoni, beans, olives and cheese in bowl. Drizzle with salad dressing. Top with lettuce. Cover and chill at least 1 hour or up to 24 hours. To complete recipe, toss salad gently just before serving. ; name: chef boy i be illinois ligurian pasta ; ingredients: pasta, french style green beans, potatoes, pesto sauce ; preparation:

name: old school mac n cheese ; ingredients: elbow macaroni, butter, eggs, sharp cheddar cheese, mozzarella cheese, italian cheese blend, american cheese, milk ; preparation:Boil pasta till half cooked. Drain and pou into lasagna glass casserole dish. Whisk eggs and stir into pasta, also mix in butter. Add in all cheeses and pour in milk stir around good. Cook for 1 hour in 350 degree oven until it looks like it getting crispy on top. ; name: grandma s mac n cheese ; ingredients: macaroni noodles, sharp cheddar cheese, milk, butter, salt, pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. In a 1. 5 quart baking dish put half of the macaroni in bottom of dish, followed by half the milk and half the butter. Season with salt and pepper. Cover with half the cheese. Repeat above direction for a second layer. Bake uncovered for 30 min or until cheese is thoroughly melted. ; name: comforting baked macaroni and cheese ; ingredients: cooked macaroni, butter, eggs, salt, pepper, milk, mozzarella cheese, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Cook the macaroni until done as usual. Do not overcook it. Drain macaroni in strainer. Place macaroni, butter, salt, pepper, milk, mozarella cheese, and 3 cups of cheddar cheese in casserole dish. Mix eggs in a bowl first and then stir into mixture. Cover everything with aluminum foil and cook for 45 minutes at 350 degrees. Uncover and add extra cup of cheddar cheese across the top. Bake uncovered for another 15 minutes. ; name: easiest and cheesiest stove top macaroni and cheese ; ingredients: water, butter, salt, elbow macaroni, evaporated milk, velveeta cheese ; preparation:Bring water, butter and salt to rolling boil. Add macaroni. Cook over medium heat for 8 to 10 minutes or until water is cooked down a bit and pasta is ready. Take off heat. Do not drain. Add evaporated milk and velveeta cheese. Stir, then cover pot and allow to sit for a few minutes until cheese is melted. Uncover and stir again. If too dry, add more evaporated milk. Serve. ; name: stove top cream cheese and velveeta mac and cheese ; ingredients: macaroni noodles, velveeta cheese, cream cheese, butter, flour, milk, sharp cheddar cheese, salt, white pepper ; preparation:Boil noodles and drain. While boiling, melt butter in saucepan on low -medium slowly add the flour well continuously stirring. Slowly add the milk will continuously stirring. Add the cheeses, salt and white pepper, increase heat to medium while continuously stirring until all cheese is melted. Remove from heat and let cool 10 minutes. Poor over noodles and mix well. ; name: president reagan s favorite macaroni and cheese ; ingredients: macaroni, butter, egg, salt, dry mustard, sharp cheddar cheese, milk ; preparation:Boil macaroni in water until tender and drain thoroughly. Stir in butter and egg. Mix mustard and salt with 1t hot water, and add to milk. Add cheese, leaving enough to sprinkle on top. Pour into buttered casserole. Add milk, sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350f for about 45 minutes or until custard is set and top is crusty. ; name: macaroni cheese deluxe ; ingredients: elbow macaroni, small curd cottage cheese, sour cream, egg, salt, pepper, sharp cheddar cheese, paprika ; preparation:Cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain well. Combine cottage cheese, sour cream, egg, salt, and pepper. Add shredded cheese, mixing well. Stir in the cooked macaroni. Pour into a greased 9 x 9 x 2 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with paprika. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. ; name: southern macaroni pie ; ingredients: elbow macaroni, egg, flour, salt, milk, shredded cheddar cheese ; preparation:

name: beef bean and tomato soup ; ingredients: ground beef, onion, green pepper, onion soup mix, kidney beans, tomatoes, parsley, basil, pasta, water ; preparation:Brown the ground beef in a dutch oven or heavy stock pot, season with salt and pepper. Add the chopped onion and green pepper, and saute for 5 to 10 minutes. Add the kidney beans, tomatoes, onion soup mix, parsley, basil, water. Bring to a boil, add the pasta. Reduce heat and simmer for 10- 20 minutes, until pasta is cooked. Add salt and pepper to taste. ; name: jenny approved hamburger spinach tomato pasta one dish meal ; ingredients: ground beef, onion, garlic cloves, frozen spinach, carrot, diced tomatoes, crushed tomatoes, macaroni ; preparation:Put a pot of water on to boil. Brown the ground beef with the chopped onions and garlic. Add pasta to boiling water -- cook as long as advised by box directions. Put frozen spinach and shredded carrots into a microwave-safe bowl and zap for 7 minutes. Add both cans of tomatoes to cooked meat, stir, and simmer for a few minutes. Add spinach and carrots to the meat mixture, stir, and simmer for a few minutes. Drain pasta and place in a huge serving dish. Put meat and veggie mixture into the huge serving dish and mix thoroughly with the pasta. Serve hot. ; name: picky mike s goulash ; ingredients: ground beef, onion, mixed vegetables, diced tomatoes, tomato sauce, small elbow macaroni, water, salt and pepper ; preparation:In a stew or dutch-oven pot, saute meat and chopped onions until brown. Pour off any grease. Add to browned meat& onions all of the remaining ingredients. Stir and bring to boil, then turn down to medium-low or simmer and put lid on pot. Simmer 20 minutes or until noodles are done. Stir occasionally to keep from sticking to bottom of pot. ; name: easy hamburger stew ; ingredients: lean ground beef, garlic, onion, potatoes, carrots, kernel corn, cream of mushroom soup, water, salt and pepper, worcestershire sauce ; preparation:Saute ground beef, garlic and onion. Add potatoes, carrots and corn. Stir in soup, water and seasonings. Cover and simmer until veggies are tender. Serve over steamed white rice. ; name: dressed up burger patties ; ingredients: ground beef, dry breadcrumbs, salt, pepper, egg, onion, beef broth, fresh mushrooms, water, cornstarch ; preparation:Mix first 5 ingredients. Shape into patties. Cook and brown patties, add onion, broth and mushrooms. Cover and simmer 10 minutes. Heat onion to boiling. Remove patties. Mix water and cornstarch. Add to skillet and stir until thickened. ; name: mom s stew ; ingredients: stew meat, potatoes, carrots, onion, water, salt, pepper, ketchup, cabbage ; preparation:Chop meat, potatoes, carrots and onion into similar size pieces. Place meat into heavy pan and turn on high to sear. This should only take a few minutes. Add water and simmer 2 hours. Add remaining ingredients, except cabbage and simmer 30 minutes. Add cabbage, chopped into larger pieces, a simmer an additional 30 minutes. ; name: saucy southwest sandwiches ; ingredients: ground beef, chili powder, tomatoes with onion and garlic, canned corn, hoagie rolls ; preparation:Cook meat in skillet over medium heat until browned, drain. Stir in chili powder. Stir in undrained tomatoes and corn. Heat through. Toast buns, if desired. Spoon mixture into buns. ; name: ground beef soup ; ingredients: ground beef, onion, carrots, potatoes, corn, tomato paste, water, beef bouillon, garlic ; preparation:

name: nava s jamaican inspired red beans and rice ; ingredients: olive oil, yellow onion, garlic cloves, cooked brown rice, adzuki beans, light coconut milk, fresh cilantro, salt, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:Heat the olive oil in a saucepan on medium heat. Saut the onion and garlic until the onion is translucent. Add the rice, drained beans, coconut milk and thyme if using. Bring to a simmer then cover and cook over low heat until most of the coconut milk has evaporated, about 15 minutes. Garnish with cilantro leaves. Season with salt and pepper and serve hot. ; name: caribbean chicken with rice ; ingredients: chicken breasts, black beans, ground ginger, lime juice, sea salt, fresh garlic cloves, mangoes, green onions, whole grain rice, seasoning ; preparation:Heat oven to 350 degrees. Place cubed chicken in a ungreased rectangular baking dish, 13 x 9 x 2 inches. Bake chicken for 25-30 minutes, cook thoroughly. Meanwhile, start cooking your rice according to your package directions. Then in a large bowl, add the remaining ingredients and still well. When the chicken is done remove it from oven. Spoon in the ingredients from the bowl. Cover and cook for 30 minutes. Serve hot over rice and be sure to get lots of the juice. ; name: basil green beans ; ingredients: fresh green beans, spring onion, margarine, dried basil leaves, garlic powder, pepper ; preparation:Trim and snap green beans into thirds. Mince the onion. Put water on to boil to steam beans. As soon as water boils, steam beans for 12 to 17 minutes or until tender. Melt margarine for beans and saut onions until tender.
