When the popping sound stops, remove pan from the heat and let cool slightly. Discard any kernels that have not popped. Add the chili powder. Shake the pan again and again to make sure that all of the corn is covered with chili powder. Transfer to a bowl. Add lime juice just before serving. ; name: crisp roasted broccoli ; ingredients: broccoli, olive oil, coarse salt, cracked black pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, cayenne pepper, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven and a baking sheet to 375. Cut broccoli into florets, the smaller the size the quicker it will cook and crispier it will be. Toss florets with olive oil to coat. Add remaining ingredients and toss well. Spread into a single layer on the hot baking sheet. If desired sprinkle additional parmesan cheese and black pepper on top. Bake for 10-12 minutes for small florets or 15-20 for larger pieces. ; name: simmered black beans ; ingredients: onion, green bell pepper, olive oil, garlic, ground cumin, chili powder, black beans, diced tomato, dried thyme, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:Cook and stir onion, green pepper and olive oil in medium skillet over low heat until vegetables are tender, about 5 minutes. Add garlic, cumin and chili powder, cook 1 minute. Add beans, tomatoes and thyme. Stir to combine. Cover and cook over very low heat about 10 minutes. Uncover and cook, stirring until beans are thickened, about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. ; name: cajun spiced popcorn ; ingredients: popped popcorn, butter, chili powder, onion powder, garlic powder, cayenne pepper, salt, lemon pepper ; preparation:

name: black bean brownies ; ingredients: black beans, eggs, vegetable oil, cocoa powder, salt, vanilla extract, splenda sugar substitute ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Lightly grease with cooking spray an 8x8 square baking dish. Combine the black beans, eggs, oil, cocoa powder, salt, vanilla extract, splenda in a blender. Blend until smooth. Pour the mixture into the prepared baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven until the top is dry and the edges start to pull away from the sides of the pan, about 30 minutes. ; name: no bake peanut butter cookies ; ingredients: sugar, milk, peanut butter, butter, vanilla, quick oats ; preparation:Combine sugar, butter and milk. Bring to a boil. Boil for one minute. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla and peanut butter. Then stir in oats. Drop by spoonfuls onto waxed paper. Allow to cool. ; name: vince gill s peanut butter fudge ; ingredients: sugar, evaporated milk, butter, peanut butter chips, marshmallow cream, peanuts, vanilla ; preparation:Butter sides of heavy 3 qt. Sausepan. Combine sugar, milk, and butter in pan and bring to a boil, stirring, over med. Heat. Cook and stir for 11 minutes. Remove pan from heat. Add chips, m. Cream, peanuts and vanilla. Stir until chips are melted. Spread in an 8x8 pan. ; name: chocolate custard low points ; ingredients: splenda sugar substitute, unsweetened cocoa powder, cornflour, salt, skim milk, vanilla essence ; preparation:Combine splenda, cocoa, cornflour and salt in a heavy based saucepan. Stir in the milk, beat together well. Cook, stirring over medium heat until thickened and bubbly. Continue to cook for 2 minutes, stirring continuously. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla. Pour into six dessert dishes and refrigerate. Serve with fresh fruit. ; name: bread chocolate pudding ; ingredients: bread, eggs, milk, sugar, salt, vanilla extract, chocolate chips ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f have ready a 9x13-inch baking pan. Spread the bread and chocolate chips in the pan. Beat together remaining ingredients. Pour this custard over the bread. Bake about 35 minutes, or until firm but not dry. Serve warm or at room temperature. ; name: peanut butter cream fudge ; ingredients: sugar, sour cream, salt, peanut butter, vanilla extract ; preparation:In a heavy saucepan, combine the sugar, sour cream and salt. Bring to a boil. Cover and simmer for 5 minutes. Uncover and cook over medium heat until a candy thermometer reads 238. Remove from the heat. Stir in peanut butter and vanilla. With a wooden spoon, beat until thick and creamy, about 5 minutes. Transfer to a buttered 8-inch square dish. Cool and cut into squares. Store in the refrigerator. ; name: flourless peanut chocolate cookies martha stewart ; ingredients: sugar, baking soda, salt, vanilla extract, creamy peanut butter, egg, semi-sweet chocolate chips, roasted peanuts ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a small bowl combine sugar, soda and salt. In a large bowl, stir together sugar-soda-salt-mix, egg and vanilla until well combined. I used a wire whisk for this step. Now add in the peanut butter, stir with a spoon til well combined and smooth. Fold in chocolate chips and roasted peanut pieces. With moistened hands, roll dough, about 1 heaping tablespoon at a time, into balls. Place 2 inches apart on two baking sheets. Bake for about 12-14 minutes. Cookies will still be slightly soft, but firm up while cooling. Allow to set on baking sheet for a couple of minutes and then transfer to wire racks to cool completely. ; name: flourless and sugar free peanut butter cookies ; ingredients: peanut butter, splenda sugar substitute, egg, vanilla ; preparation:

name: apple clementine chutney ; ingredients: gala apples, clementine, rice vinegar, light brown sugar, lemon, juice of, lemon zest, cinnamon, garlic cloves, red pepper flakes ; preparation:Add all ingredients to sauce pan. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes or until the mixture thickens. Use potato masher and mash after 15 minutes. Refrigerate over night. ; name: coffee soy glaze ; ingredients: brown sugar, cornstarch, brewed coffee, soy sauce, cider vinegar ; preparation:In a small saucepan blend together the brown sugar and cornstarch. Add coffee, soy sauce, and vinegar. Mix well. Cook and stir mixture till thickened and bubbly. Use to baste spareribs or pork chops during the last 15 minutes of barbecuing. ; name: brown sugared pork tenderloin ; ingredients: cider vinegar, light brown sugar, salt, garlic, paprika, pork tenderloin ; preparation:Combine first 6 ingredients in a large zip-top freezer bag. Add pork to bag. Seal bag, and marinate in refrigerator 30 minutes, occasionally turning bag. Preheat grill to medium-high. Drain marinade from plastic bag into a small saucepan. Bring to a boil. Boil 1 minute. Remove from heat and set aside. Grill tenderloins, uncovered, over medium-high heat 10 to 12 minutes on each side or until pork is barely pink inside or a meat thermometer inserted in thickest portion of tenderloin registers 155, basting often when reserved marinade. Remove from grill. Let stand 10 minutes. ; name: nutty caramel corn ; ingredients: brown sugar, margarine, corn syrup, salt, butter flavoring, maple flavoring, cream of tartar, baking soda, popped corn, mixed nuts ; preparation:In saucepan, combine brown sugar, margarine, corn syrup, and salt. Boil for 6 minutes, stirring constantly. Add flavorings, cream of tartar, and soda. Pour over popped corn and nuts, mixing thoroughly. Spread glazed mixture out on a large baking sheet. Bake in 200 oven for one hour. ; name: sticky fingers ; ingredients: brown sugar, worcestershire sauce, ketchup, honey, hot sauce, apple cider vinegar, breaded chicken tenders ; preparation:Cook chicken as directed. Combine all other ingredients in a medium sized bowl. Toss chicken in the sauce. Spread chicken on a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 for 5-7 minutes. The longer it cooks the stickier they become. ; name: hot spiced apple cider in a crock pot ; ingredients: apple cider, whole nutmegs, cinnamon sticks, orange, apple, whole cloves, crystallized ginger, brown sugar, cloth, string ; preparation:Pour enough cider to fill crock pot to full. Add brown sugar. Stick whole cloves into skin of orange and apple wedges. Place apple, orange and all remaining ingredients into cheese cloth, tie with string and drop into crock pot. Bring to a boil, about 2 to 2 hours on high. Once the cider is boiling, reduce setting to low. Keep on low for 2 hours or more before serving. Replenish with additional cider when needed. If cider is cold, return setting to high until heated. Serve or have guests serve themselves from the crock pot. If desired, leave a bottle of spiced rum nearby. ; name: mini meatloaf low carb ; ingredients: low-sugar ketchup, splenda brown sugar blend, apple cider vinegar, colby-monterey jack cheese, lean ground beef, egg whites, breadcrumbs, salt, black pepper, onion powder ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 350f spray a baking dish with cooking spray. Cut the 4 oz of cheese into 4 equal parts, longways. Mix together the ingredients for the sauce. Set both aside for later. Using your hands, mix the remaining ingredients together in a large bowl. Divide the mixture into 4 equal parts. Take the divided amount & shape it around 1 chunk of cheese, making it into a loaf shape. Place into the baking dish then repeat with the other 3. Brush the sauce over all 4 meatloaves. Bake in the oven for 35-40 minutes then drain off any excess grease. Serve immediately or let cool then freeze in individual containers for later use. ; name: sweet and sour kielbasa kabobs ; ingredients: brown sugar, cornstarch, apple juice, cider vinegar, orange zest, kielbasa, green bell pepper, onion, pineapple chunk ; preparation:

name: simple light lemon pie ; ingredients: sugar-free vanilla pudding mix, sugar-free lemon gelatin, water, lemon juice, reduced fat graham cracker crust, light whipped topping ; preparation:In small saucepan, combine pudding mix and gelatine. Add water and lemon juice. Stir until smooth. Cook and stir over medium heat until mixture comes to a boil. Cook and stir 1-2 minutes longer or until thickened. Remove from the heat. Cool clightly. Pour into crust. Cover and refrigerate for 3 hours or until set. Spread with whipped topping. ; name: peanutty chocolate pudding ; ingredients: nonfat milk, sugar-free instant chocolate pudding mix, natural-style peanut butter, sugar-free whipped topping ; preparation:In a mixing bowl, combine milk and pudding mix. Beat on low speed for 2 minutes. Beat in peanut butter until smooth. Spoon into desert dishes. Top with whipped topping if desired. ; name: coconut protein bars ; ingredients: sweetened flaked coconut, quick oats, whey protein powder, skim milk, fat-free sugar-free instant chocolate pudding mix ; preparation:Mix all ingredients together in a bowl. Spread half of mixture evenly in bottom of pan. Add layer of coconut. Spread 2nd half of mixture over coconut layer. Place in fridge overnight and cut into 8 individual squares. ; name: easy frozen peanut butter chocolate pie lower fat ; ingredients: chocolate crumb crusts, prepared fat-free chocolate pudding, reduced-fat peanut butter, cool whip lite, magic shell ice cream topping ; preparation:In a mixing bowl using a wooden spoon mix together the chocolate pudding and peanut butter until well combined. Using a spatula fold in the thawed cool whip topping until completely blended. Transfer the mixture into the pie crust. Freeze until completely firm. When to pie is frozen drizzle the magic shell over the top and return to freezer until ready to serve. Thaw slightly before serving to allow easier slicing. Place any leftover pie in the freezer. ; name: strawberry jello pie ; ingredients: 10-inch baked pie shells, strawberries, strawberry jell-o gelatin dessert, vanilla pudding mix, water, cool whip ; preparation:Place strawberries in the pie shell. Set aside. Mix jello and pudding with water. Heat to a full boil, then remove from heat. Pour over berries and chill. Top with 1 t. Cool whip, if desired. ; name: chocolate old fashioned pie ; ingredients: 9 inch pie shell, sugar, salt, cornstarch, flour, cocoa powder, butter, milk, vanilla extract ; preparation:Bake pie crust according to directions and let cool. Combine all remaining ingredients in a large pot and heat to a simmer, stirring constantly until thickened. Remove pan from burner and place a piece of plastic wrap directly on top of chocolate filling. Let pan stand until cool. Spoon filling into pie crust. Serve with whipped cream. ; name: diet parfait sunday ; ingredients: sugar-free instant butterscotch pudding mix, fat-free sugar-free instant chocolate pudding mix, skim milk, cool whip lite ; preparation:Mix the butterscotch pudding with two cups skim milk until lump free and pour into 8 dessert bowls. Chill until firm. Spread the cool whip on top of the butterscotch pudding. Mix the chocolate pudding with two cups skim milk until lump free and pour carefully on top of the cool whip. Refrigerate until pudding is well set, this dessert is best well chilled. If desired sprinkle the top with a small quantity of chopped nuts or add a dab more cool whip. ; name: banana cream protein pie ; ingredients: 9-inch low-fat pie shell, sugar-free fat-free banana cream pudding mix, skim milk, vanilla protein powder, banana, sugar-free cool whip ; preparation:

name: maple roasted root vegetables ; ingredients: yukon gold potatoes, sweet potato, parsnips, beets, sweet onions, olive oil, maple syrup, garlic ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 400. Place the cut root vegetables in a single layer on one or two large baking sheets. Stir together the oil, maple syrup and garlic cloves and drizzle over the vegetables. Stir to combine the oil with the veggies and then spread once again in a single layer on the baking sheet. Season with salt and pepper. Bake for about 1 hour until the vegetables are done and a little caramelized from the syrup. Serve immediately. ; name: potato nuggets with dill cream ; ingredients: potatoes, fresh dill, butter, heavy cream, salt & pepper ; preparation:Steam or boil your new potatoe nuggets until cooked. Melt butter in a skillet, add potatoes, toss to coat. Mix dill into the cream. Pour dilled cream over the potatoes and continue cooking over medium-low heat until the cream has turned into an almost golden sauce, stir frequently. Season to taste. ; name: garlicky potato puffs ; ingredients: potatoes, butter, garlic cloves, potato starch, salt, fresh ground black pepper, eggs, parsley, paprika ; preparation:Pre-heat oven to 400f. Add the minced garlic to the melted butter and allow to stand until needed. Peel, dice, and boil potatoes till tender. Mash with a potato masher. Add all ingredients to the potatoes and mix well. Place large tablespoons of the mixture in a buttered baking dish or on a cookie sheet. Sprinkle each with paprika, if desired. Bake in the oven for about 10 to 12 minutes, or until golden brown. ; name: not so sweet sweet potato casserole ; ingredients: sweet potatoes, butter, apple cider, salt, ground black pepper, gruyere cheese, fresh parsley ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375f. Bake potatoes whole, in their skins on a foil lined jelly roll pan until they are soft when pierced with a fork. Remove from oven and let cool until you can handle them, then peel off the skins. Mash the potatoes along with butter, cider, salt and pepper, until smooth enough to your liking. Grease an oval baking dish and spoon the mashed potatoes into the dish. Sprinkle with the shredded cheese and bake at 375f for about 30 minutes, uncovered, or until heated through and the cheese is melted. Sprinkle parsley over the top and serve. Make ahead. When ready to serve them, thaw completely, place into the baking dish as described above, top with cheese, and bake at 350f for about 40 minutes, then sprinkle with parsley before serving. ; name: swedish creamed potatoes with dill ; ingredients: potatoes, butter, flour, cream, kosher salt, white pepper, fresh dill ; preparation:Boil whole, unpeeled potatoes in unsalted water until fork-tender. Remove and allow to sit until cool enough to touch. Peel potatoes, then chop into 1 dice. In a saucepan over medium-high heat, stir together butter and flour to make a light roux, but do not allow to darken. Add cream, salt, and pepper and whisk steadily until incorporated and thickened into a cream sauce, about 5 minutes. Stir in potatoes, turn heat to medium-low, and allow potatoes to stew just until warmed. Garnish with chopped dill and serve. ; name: roasted potatoes with sage and garlic ; ingredients: small potatoes, flour, oil, garlic cloves, sage leaf, unsalted butter, kosher salt, fresh pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 450f and place a large, heavy skillet or roasting pan in the oven to heat. Place the potatoes in a large saucepan and cover with cold salted water. Put on high heat to boil. Once boiling, lower heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Drain the potatoes well, and place on paper towels. Put the flour on a plate. When the potatoes are dry, roll them in the flour to coat. Remove the hot skillet from the oven and add the oil and potatoes. Roast, shaking the pan occasionally until the potatoes are golden brown all over, about 30 minutes. Remove from the oven and add the garlic, sage and butter. Return to the oven for one minute. Season generously with salt and pepper and serve. ; name: zesty potato soup ; ingredients: potatoes, water, garlic clove, salt, pepper, milk, american cheese, chicken bouillon granule, butter, dried parsley ; preparation:In large sauce pan, combine first 5 ingrediants. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 15 minute do not drain-- mash potatoes in liquid until almost smooth. Add remaining ingredients. Cook until cheese is melted. Stir continuously. I sprinkle with crumbled bacon and shredded cheddar cheese. Enjoy. ; name: smashed potatoes with green garlic butter ; ingredients: yukon gold potatoes, heavy cream, salt, butter, garlic, fresh parsley, salt and pepper ; preparation:

name: old fashioned cream of broccoli soup ; ingredients: butter, onion, sliced mushrooms, broccoli, flour, salt and pepper, chicken broth, light cream, red wine ; preparation:Melt butter in large sauce pan. Saut vegetables in butter until tender. Sprinkle with flour, salt and pepper. Stir in well. Add chicken broth and cream. Cook until thick and comes to a slow boil. Stirring frequently. Add wine and correct salt and pepper to taste. ; name: smoky cheese log ; ingredients: cream cheese, monterey jack cheese, cooked bacon, sesame seeds, chives, worcestershire sauce, liquid smoke, assorted fresh vegetables ; preparation:In a mixing bowl, combine the first seven ingredients. Mix well. Shape mixture into a log. Cover and refrigerate for 8 hours or overnight. For topping, combine the bacon, sesame seeds and chives. Roll cheese log in topping. Serve with vegetables or crackers. ; name: broccoli supreme ; ingredients: broccoli spears, garlic cheese rolls, cream of mushroom soup, sliced mushrooms, seasoned dry bread crumb ; preparation:In a saucepan, boil broccoli for 3 minutes, and drain. Place broccoli in a 2-quart baking dish. In another saucepan, combine cheese roll, soup, and mushrooms. Heat on medium, stirring constantly until cheese melts. Spoon cheese-mushroom mixture over broccoli. Sprinkle breadcrumbs over top of casserole. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. ; name: mushroom parmesan polenta ; ingredients: cremini mushrooms, unsalted butter, water, cornmeal, parmesan cheese, half-and-half, salt, pepper ; preparation:In small skillet, saute mushrooms in butter until lightly browned, 5 minutes. Set aside. Bring water to boil in medium pan. Gradually add cornmeal, stirring constantly, until mixture is smooth and soupy. Continue cooking and stirring over medium heat until mixture is as thick as cooked oatmeal. Stir in cheese and half-and-half. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in mushrooms. Serve immediately. ; name: mushroom and wine steak sauce ; ingredients: fresh mushrooms, butter, onion, garlic, condensed beef broth, tomato paste, ground pepper, cornstarch, water, dry red wine ; preparation:Melt butter in a saucepan. Add mushrooms, onion and garlic. Saute until golden, about 5 minutes. Stir in broth, tomato paste and black pepper. Bring to the boiling point. Reduce heat and simmer, covered, for 10 minutes. Blend cornstarch with water. Mix some of the hot mushroom sauce into cornstarch mixture and return to saucepan. Cook and stir until clear and thickened. Stir in wine and cook until hot. Serve over steak, hamburgers or other meat. ; name: portobello croque monsieur ; ingredients: portabella mushroom, extra virgin olive oil, salt & freshly ground black pepper, unsalted butter, white bread, pesto sauce, gruyere cheese ; preparation:Using a dessert spoon, scrape out the black gills from the underside of the mushroom cap. Removing the gills reduces the amount of black juice the mushroom will exude. Heat the oil in a medium nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the mushroom, flat side down, and cook until the underside is browned, about 4 minutes. Turn the mushroom an cook until tender, about 2 minutes. Transfer to a plate and season with salt and pepper. Wipe out the skillet with moist paper towels. Add the butter and melt over medium heat. Placed the mushroom cap on one slice of bread, spread with the pesto, and sprinkle with the cheese. Top with the remaining bread and place the sandwich in the skillet. Cook, turning once, until both sides of the sandwich are golden brown, about 5 minutes. Serve hot. ; name: mushrooms and alioli tapas ; ingredients: mushrooms, extra virgin olive oil, sea salt, sherry wine, mayonnaise, french bread ; preparation:Heat olive oil in pan. When the oil is hot, add the mushrooms, salt and sharry. Cover, and lower heat. Cook until liquid is released from mushrooms, about 10 minutes. Drain and set aside. Toast bread slightly, just to dry it out a bit. Spread toast with alioli and top with mushrooms. Broil for about 30 seconds or until alioli starts to bubble. Serve warm. ; name: happy hour mushrooms ; ingredients: mushrooms, butter, garlic, monterey jack cheese, dry white wine, soy sauce, fine cracker crumb ; preparation:

name: bacon biscuit puffs ; ingredients: biscuits, cheddar cheese, mayonnaise, onion, bacon, sugar, garlic salt, hot pepper sauce ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Separate each biscuit into 3 pieces. Place on baking sheet. Combine the cheese, mayo, onion, bacon, sugar, garlic salt and hot pepper sauce in a medium bowl. Mix well. Place a spoonful of the mixture, spreading evenly, on each biscuit round. Bake 10 minutes or until golden. ; name: club sandwich ; ingredients: bread, mayonnaise, american cheese, ham, tomatoes, lettuce, crisp bacon, monterey jack cheese, deli turkey ; preparation:Spread mayonnaise on one side of a piece of toast. Add layer of american cheese, ham, two slices of tomato, two leaves of lettuce, and two pieces of bacon. Spread mayonnaise on second piece of toast and place on top, mayo side down. Spread mayonnaise on top of that second piece of toast. Layer monterey jack cheese, the rest of the tomatoes, lettuce, turkey and bacon on top. Spread mayonnaise on third piece of toast and place on the stack mayo side down. Slice the sandwich in quarters diagonally. Skewers or long toothpicks may be used to hold all the layers together. ; name: bacon and tomato spread ; ingredients: cream cheese, mayonnaise, garlic salt, tomatoes, bacon ; preparation:Blend cream cheese with mayonnaise until smooth. Add garlic salt and tomato. Cook bacon until crispy. Drain and crumble. Add bacon to cream cheese mixture when ready to serve. Serve as spread with party rye rounds or as a dip. Thin with a little milk if necessary. ; name: mexican grilled cheese sandwiches ; ingredients: bread, jalapeno jack cheese, taco seasoning mix, salsa, butter ; preparation:Heat a griddle, sandwich maker, or a skillet over medium heat. In small bowl, mix butter and taco seasoning mix. Spread half of mixture on one side of each piece of bread. Put cheese slices onto bread and top with remaining bread slices. Place the sandwiches, buttered sides down, on hot griddle. Spread top sides with remaining butter mixture. Cook until golden brown on both sides and cheese is melted. Serve with salsa as a dip. ; name: white cheese dip ; ingredients: white processed cheese, milk, canned jalapeno slices, garlic cloves, salt ; preparation:In saucepan heat milk to a simmer. Cube cheese. Add to milk and stir until melted. In blender jar add jalapenos and juice. Blend till minced. Add to melted cheese. Add garlic and salt. Serve with tortilla chips or use as a sauce for chimichangas or burritos. ; name: b l a bacon lettuce apple bites ; ingredients: bacon, bibb lettuce, sharp cheddar cheese, apple, lemon juice, mayonnaise, flour tortillas ; preparation:Toss apples with lemon juice. Cook bacon in large skillet till crisp. Drain on paper towel. Spread 1 tbl. Mayonnaise on each tortilla. Divide cheddar cheese, lettuce, bacon, and apples between each tortilla. Roll tightly. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate 30 minutes. Slice into inch rounds and serves. ; name: you will love it jalapeno and cheese dip ; ingredients: jalapeno jack cheese, sour cream, mayonnaise, garlic, chopped pimiento, green onions, sunflower seeds ; preparation:Mix together the cheese, sour cream, mayonnaise and garlic. Do not cover. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 20 minutes or microwave on high for about 7 minutes, stirring occasionally. Mix in half of the pimento, onion and sunflower seeds. Bake for 5 more minutes, or microwave on high for an additional 2-3 minutes. Garnish with the remaining ingredients. Serve with tortilla chips. Can be refrigerated for up to a week and reheated in oven or microwave until hot. Stir well. ; name: chris grilled jalapeno wraps ; ingredients: jalapenos, turkey bacon, cream cheese, cheddar cheese ; preparation:

name: green pea and potato soup ; ingredients: frozen peas, potatoes, chicken stock, water, olive oil, onion, garlic, parmesan cheese, salt and pepper ; preparation:Heat oil in a large saucepan, add onion and garlic, cook, stirring until the onion is soft. Pour the chicken stock into the saucepan with the onion and garlic and bring to the boil. Add the potatoes, boil uncovered for 5 minutes. Stir in the peas, bring to the boil and cook for a further 5 minutes or until the chopped potatoes are tender. Blend potato and pea mixture in batches until smooth. Serve soup with sprinkled with parmesan cheese. ; name: skillet squash au gratin ; ingredients: butter, summer squash, onion, salt, pepper, tomatoes, soy sauce, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Melt butter in skillet. Add squash, onion, salt, pepper and tomatoes. Cook, covered 12-15 minutes or until tender. Sprinkle with soy sauce to taste, if desired. Transfer to a serving bowl and sprinkle with cheese. You can use canned italian- or mexican-flavored tomatoes for a different flavor. ; name: harvest vegetable roast ; ingredients: butternut squash, new potatoes, red onion, parsnip, brussels sprouts, olive oil, dried marjoram, garlic pepper seasoning, seasoning salt ; preparation:In a big mixing bowl, add the first 5 ingredients. Stir to combine. Add in the olive oil, marjoram, garlic-pepper, and seasoned salt. Toss to coat. Spread vegetables out into a 17x11 or 15x10 inch baking pan that has been sprayed with non-stick cooking spray. Bake at 425 for 30-45 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Stir and turn vegetables several times during baking. ; name: the black eyed peas baked squash ; ingredients: yellow squash, eggs, whole wheat rolls, butter, sugar, salt, pepper, onion ; preparation:Cut squash and onion in pieces, boil together, then reduce heat until tender. Drain & mash squash some. Combine squash, onion, eggs, bread bits, butter, sugar, salt. Put into a 3 quart dish that has been oiled. Bake at 350 until lightly browned. Sometimes i toss in some velveeta - when the kids were small they liked it with the cheese. ; name: peas n peppers ; ingredients: red peppers, water, frozen peas, butter, orange rind, dried rosemary, salt and pepper ; preparation:Cut the peppers in half lengthwise, remove stems, seeds and white membrane. Bring the water to a boil, add peas, return to boil cook 5 minutes until peas are tender, drain, reserve the cooking water. Puree the peas in your food processor add 5 tbsp of the reserved water and the butter return to saucepan and stir in the orange peel& rosemary heat through. Meanwhile immerse the peppers in boiling water and blanch for apprx 5 minutes or until the peppers are hot but still crisp fill the peppers with the pureed peas. Serve hot. ; name: easy risotto with bacon peas ; ingredients: onion, olive oil, butter, streaky bacon, risotto rice, vegetable stock, frozen peas, salt and pepper ; preparation:Finely chop the onion. Heat the olive oil and butter in a pan, add the onions and fry until lightly browned. Add the bacon and fry for a further 5 minutes, until it starts to crisp. Add the rice and stock, and bring to the boil. Stir well, then reduce the heat and cook, covered, for 15-20 minutes until the rice is almost tender. Stir in the peas, add a little salt and pepper and cook for a further 3 minutes, until the peas are cooked. Serve sprinkled with freshly grated parmesan and freshly ground black pepper. ; name: roasted butternut squash with lime and rosemary ; ingredients: butternut squash, butter, olive oil, lime juice, fresh rosemary, sea salt, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f. Peel squash and cut into cubes about 1 inch square. Put squash into plastic mixing bowl, add olive oil, lime juice, and minced rosemary and toss well so squash is all coated with oil. Arrange squash on roasting pan in single layer. Dot with butter. Roast for 40-50 minutes, turning several times, or until squash is quite softened and getting browned on the edges. Season with sea salt and fresh ground black pepper, and serve hot. ; name: black eyed peas with winter squash brown rice ; ingredients: winter squash, black-eyed peas, whole grain brown rice, olive oil, garlic, bell pepper, onion, salt, pepper, hot pepper sauce ; preparation:

name: asian scrambled eggs ; ingredients: garlic clove, fresh ginger, peanut oil, mushroom, snow peas, red bell pepper, scallions, reduced sodium soy sauce, egg whites, egg ; preparation:In a skillet or wok on medium-high heat, brown garlic and ginger in half of the oil. After a couple of minutes, add mushrooms, snow peas, and pepper. Stirfry until mushrooms start to brown, and lose most of their moisture. Add chopped scallions. Stir fry for another couple of minutes while drizzling half of the soy sauce over ther mixture. Remove vegetables from skillet. Add the remaining oil, then eggs. When eggs start to bubble around the edges, stir them with a spatula until scrambled. Just before eggs are completely cooked, add vegetables and mix thoroughly. Serve warm, with remaining soy sauce drizzled over top after cooking. ; name: chicken tenders w balsamic vinegar glaze ; ingredients: olive oil, chicken tenders, black pepper, garlic, balsamic vinegar, honey, low sodium chicken broth ; preparation:Heat oil over med-high heat. Add chicken season with pepper. Cook 3 to 4 min on each side. Remove chicken and set aside. Reduce heat to low-medium, add garlic and saute. Then add vinegar, honey and chicken broth. Scrape bottom of pan and heat 1 minute. Return chicken to pan, mix ingredients and heat through. ; name: sole with light lemon sauce ; ingredients: low sodium chicken broth, garlic cloves, carrots, asparagus, sole fillet, flour, butter, dry white wine, lemon peel ; preparation:In large deep skillet, add broth, garlic, carrots and asparagus and bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium low, add fish and cook for about 3 minutes until fish is done. Carefully remove fish and veggies with a slotted spoon to serving plate. Cover and keep warm. Mix together flour and butter. Bring the broth to a boil and gradually whisk in the butter mixture until sauce begins to thicken. Remove from heat and whisk in wine, lemon rind and juice. Season with pepper is desired. Pour sauce over fish and veggies. Serve with potatoes, brown rice or a multigrain roll. ; name: mellow garlic and basil vinaigrette ; ingredients: garlic, extra virgin olive oil, fresh basil leaves, white wine vinegar, lemon, zest of, dijon mustard, table salt, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:Put garlic and oil in a small saucepan and heat to medium low, so the cloves are just barely sizzling but not browning. Simmer for 10 minutes and remove from the heat, and add 10 of the basil leaves. Let sit for approx. 20 minutes and then remove the garlic and basil leaves. In a small bowl, whisk together the vinegar, lemon zest, mustard, salt and pepper. Slowly whisk in the flavored oil until the dessing is creamy and blended. Roll the remaining basil leaves into a tight roll and slice across to make thin shreds. Stir into dressing. ; name: canadian maple syrup glaze for fish meat ; ingredients: maple syrup, dijon mustard, garlic cloves, balsamic vinegar, salt, black pepper ; preparation:Whisk ingredients together. Cover salmon, halibut or ham steaks with glaze, reserving some for serving. Refrigerate for 1-6 hours. Bake, fry or barbecue as usual. Brush remaining glaze on before serving. ; name: asparagus with sesame oil vinaigrette ; ingredients: asparagus, garlic, salt, fresh ground white pepper, dijon mustard, fresh lemon juice, sesame oil ; preparation:Boil the asparagus in a large quantity of water for 3 to 5 minutes, depending on thickness, then drain and run under cold water to stop the cooking. Dry thoroughly. Combine the garlic, salt, pepper, mustard and lemon juice in a bowl and whisk to blend. Whisk in the sesame oil. Pour over the asparagus, toss and serve. ; name: stir fried shrimp with ginger and mushrooms ; ingredients: canola oil, garlic cloves, fresh ginger, mushroom, celery, toasted sesame oil, large shrimp, reduced sodium soy sauce, dried red pepper flakes ; preparation:Heat the canola oil in a large, heavy skillet over medium heat until hot but not smoking. Add the garlic and ginger, stir fry for 30 seconds. Add the mushrooms, celery and sesame oil and stir fry for 30 seconds. Add the shrimp, soy sauce and red pepper flakes, stir fry til shrimp are pink and cooked through, 3-4 minutes. Serve immediately. ; name: roasted garlic and mustard dipping sauce weight watchers ; ingredients: low sodium vegetable broth, cold water, cornstarch, malt vinegar, roasted garlic cloves, dijon-style mustard, honey, peanut oil, salt, fresh ground pepper ; preparation:

name: easy garlic chicken breasts ; ingredients: lime juice, olive oil, garlic, boneless skinless chicken breasts, salt & pepper ; preparation:In a medium bowl, whisk together the lime juice, olive oil, and garlic. Season with salt and pepper generously, and add chicken, making sure it is well-coated with the marinade. Marinate chicken, covered in fridge for at least 3 hours and preferably overnight. Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Remove chicken from marinade and discard marinade. Arrange chicken breasts in a shallow baking pan. Season with salt and pepper and roast for 25-30 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and the juices run clear when you prick it with a fork. ; name: make ahead swiss chicken ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breast halves, swiss cheese, reduced-fat cream of chicken soup, light sour cream, white wine, garlic powder, dry mustard, cayenne pepper, crouton ; preparation:Grease a 9x13 disposable foil pan with non-stick cooking spray. Place chicken pieces in dish. Sprinkle with swiss cheese. Mix together remaining ingredients and spread over cheese. Cover dish with foil. Place croutons in a ziploc bag and crush with a rolling pin. Tape bag of crushed croutons to dish. Freeze. When ready to bake, thaw in refrigerator overnight. Uncover dish and sprinkle with croutons. Bake at 350 degrees for 50 minutes or until bubbly. Cover with foil mid-way through cooking if croutons start getting too brown. ; name: glorious chicken ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, margarine, water, ritz cracker crumbs, parmesan cheese, cream of chicken soup, sour cream, mushrooms ; preparation:Roll chicken breasts first in the margarine, then in the crumb mixture. Place in a 9x13 pan sprayed with non-stick cooking spray. Mix soup, mushrooms, water, and sour cream. Pour this mixture over the chicken. Sprinkle with remaining crumbs and drizzle on any leftover margarine. Bake at 350 for one hour or until done. ; name: birthday caramel chicken ; ingredients: skinless chicken breasts, real butter, white sugar, sweet onions, parsley, lemon pepper, garlic salt, lemon juice ; preparation:Clean the chicken and cut into 6 serving pieces. Pat chicken dry and place into a long glass baking dish. Set aside. Using a cast-iron fry pan melt butter on medium and quickly stir in the sugar stirring constantly until melted and caramel color. Lower heat and add the onions or leeks. Stir to coat onions then pour directly over the chicken. Add the parsley, lemon pepper, garlic salt and lemon juice. Bake at 350 for 60 minutes. ; name: easy elegant chicken and sherry ; ingredients: boneless chicken breasts, cream of chicken soup, sour cream, sliced mushrooms, sherry wine, paprika ; preparation:Place chicken breasts in casserole dish. Mix together soup, sour cream, mushrooms and sherry. Pour over chicken. Sprinkle with paprika. Bake 1 hour and 10 minutes at 350 degrees. Serve with rice. ; name: fast chicken parmesan ; ingredients: vegetable oil, lemon juice, parmesan cheese, biscuit mix, pepper, boneless skinless chicken breasts, margarine ; preparation:Mix together vegetable oil and lemon juice in small bowl. Mix cheese, biscuit mix, and pepper in a shallow small bowl. Dip chicken into oil mixture, then coat with cheese mixture. Heat margarine in large skillet over medium heat until hot. Saute chicken until golden and done. Serve with a squeeze of lemon, spaghetti sauce, or parmesan cheese. ; name: simple saucy scrumptious chicken cordon bleu ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, margarine, swiss cheese, ham, cream of mushroom soup, sour cream, salt and pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Cut chicken breasts in half to butterfly them into cutlets. Sprinkle with some salt and pepper melt margarine in skillet and brown chicken in margarine and transfer to a 9x13 pan. Pour soup and sour cream into same skillet and whisk till smooth and warm. Place ham on top of chicken and top with a slice of swiss cheese. Pour soup mixture over top and bake uncovered for 40 minutes. ; name: chicken in lemon sauce ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, butter, salt and pepper, sherry wine, fresh lemon rind, lemon juice, heavy cream, parmesan cheese ; preparation:

name: old fashioned lemonade ; ingredients: lemons, zest of, sugar, water, fresh lemon juice, cold water ; preparation:To make the sugar syrup, in a medium saucepan combine the zest, sugar and water. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring to dissolve the sugar. Remove from the heat, cover and let steep for 15 minutes. Transfer the syrup to a 2-quart pitcher. Let cool. Add the lemon juice, chopped lemon rinds and cold water. Stir well to combine. Chill until very cold. Serve over ice. ; name: oregon cran applesauce ; ingredients: water, red wine, sugar, frozen cranberries, cooking apples, fresh lemon juice, cinnamon stick ; preparation:In a large saucepan over medium heat, add the water, wine and sugar, stirring to dissolve. Add the cranberries, apples and lemon juice. Bring mixture to a boil. Reduce heat and gently boil, uncovered, stirring occasionally until the cranberries pop and apples softened, approximately 15 minutes. Transfer sauce to a food processor and puree. Add the cinnamon stick. Let stand several hours before serving. ; name: berry syrup ; ingredients: water, sugar, berries, vanilla, lemon juice ; preparation:In a small saucepan combine water and sugar. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Stir in berries. Cook until the berries have mostly broken down, approximately 10-15 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla and lemon juice. Enjoy. ; name: bavarian strawberry cream pie ; ingredients: strawberry, sugar, cold water, unflavored gelatin, boiling water, fresh lemon juice, heavy cream ; preparation:In a large bowl, crush strawberries and add sugar. Let stand 30 minutes. Pour cold water in a bowl and add the unflavored gelatin to the top. Let stand 5 minutes. Add boiling water to dissolve the gelatin. Stir. Stir in the the strawberries and add fresh lemon juice. Chill the gelatin until it is the thickness of unbeaten egg whites. Whip the cream until firm peaks form. Gently fold into strawberry mixture. Pour into pie crust and refrigerate for at least 4 hours. ; name: strawberry iced tea fizz ; ingredients: fresh strawberries, sugar, boiling water, tea bag, frozen lemonade concentrate, club soda, ice cube ; preparation:In bowl, combine strawberries and sugar, set aside. In large bowl pour water over tea bag, steep 5 minutes. Discard tea bag. Cool tea to room temperature. Stir in strawberries and lemonade concentrate, chill. To serve, stir in club soda. Ladle over ice cubes in tall glasses. Serve with spoons. ; name: pineapple and raspberry cocktail ; ingredients: fresh raspberries, fresh strawberries, icing sugar, lime, juice of, pineapple, grapefruit, oranges, lime ; preparation:Make the raspberry juice by whizzing together the raspberries, strawberries and icing sugar. Press through a sieve into a jug. Add about 100ml water to the sieve and push through the pulp to get as much flavour out of it as possible. Stir in the lime juice and chill until needed. Now make the pineapple juice by chopping up the flesh and whizzing in your food processor with the icing sugar. Push through a sieve into a jug. Add 100ml water and stir in the grapefruit, orange and lime juice. Stir until needed. Put a few ice cubes and a slice of lime in each glass. Fill up with the pineapple juice, then top with the raspberry juice. ; name: lime yogurt dessert ; ingredients: boiling water, lime gelatin, ice cubes, yogurt ; preparation:Pour boiling water over jello in large bowl. Stir until dissolved. Add ice cubes. Stir until jello begins to thicken. Remove any unmelted ice. Add yogurt, beat with hand mixer until smooth. Pour into dessert dishes. Refrigerate until firm, about 45 minutes. Top with cool whip if desired. ; name: raspberry cordial ; ingredients: frozen raspberries, sugar, boiling water, lemons ; preparation:

name: baked beans southern style ; ingredients: pork and beans, onion, yellow mustard, maple syrup, brown sugar, ketchup, worcestershire sauce, pepper bacon ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. In a large bowl combine first seven ingredients, stir well. Lightly spray pam in a medium size casserole dish and pour in bean mixture. Place slices of bacon over top of beans. Cover and bake 30 minutes. Uncover and bake extra 15 minutes. ; name: taverns ; ingredients: water, onion, ground beef, ketchup, chili powder, yellow mustard, hamburger buns ; preparation:Add onions to water in medium saucepan. Boil on medium heat until onions are transparent. Add ground beef and ketchup. Continue cooking on medium heat for 15 minutes. Add mustard and chili powder. Serve on hamburger bun. ; name: iraqi white bean stew ; ingredients: dry white bean, lamb, onion, corn oil, tomato paste, crushed tomatoes, curry powder, salt and pepper ; preparation:Put the lamb meat in a pot, cover with water. Bring to the boil, let it boil for about 30 minutes, lower heatand let it simmer for about 1 hour. In another pot, fry the onions in corn oil on medium heat until it becomes transparent. Add the meat, beans and tomato paste, stir for about 1 minute until the mixture is well-blended. Add the crushed tomato and the spices and the remaining water of boiled beans. Bring the mixture to a boil, let it boil for 15 minutes, lower the heat and let it simmer for 60-90 minutes. Serve with rice and green salad. ; name: red rice sausage ; ingredients: vegetable oil, hot smoked sausage, onion, green pepper, celery, water, tomato sauce, salt, black pepper, parboiled rice ; preparation:Heat the oil in a heavy pan over medium heat. Add the sausage pieces and cook until brown, about 5 minutes. Add the onions, green peppers, and celery. Cook for 3 minutes. Add the water, tomato sauce, salt and pepper. Heat to boiling. Stir in the rice. Reduce heat to simmer. Cook covered, until rice is tender, about 30 minutes. Remove from heat and keep covered until time to serve. ; name: three dollar baked beans ; ingredients: pork and beans, black beans, onion, smoked bacon, catsup, barbecue sauce, brown sugar, white sugar ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Brown bacon until crisp then drain on paper towels. Cook onions in bacon drippings until translucent. Drain any excess fat from pan. Add beans, catsup, barbecue sauce, sugars and bacon to pan. Stir and pour into a baking pan. Bake for 1 hour. ; name: canned green beans that don t taste like canned green beans ; ingredients: green beans, onion, garlic, crushed red pepper flakes, olive oil, soy sauce, red wine vinegar, water, salt and pepper ; preparation:Saute the onion, garlic and crushed red pepper flakes in 2 tablespoons of the olive oil over medium heat until the onions begin to start getting tender. Pour the green beans on top of the onion mixture and cover with a lid. Cook for about 5 minutes on low heat so that the beans can begin to take on the onion flavor. Add in the soy sauce, vinegar and two more tablespoons of the olive oil and half of a cup of water. Stir mixture together and cover with a lid and cook on low heat for 20-30 minutes. Before serving, drizzle the last tablespoon of the olive oil over the beans and season to taste with salt and pepper. ; name: quick meatball sandwiches ; ingredients: meatballs, ketchup, brown sugar, onion, garlic powder, liquid smoke, sandwich buns ; preparation:Place meatballs in an ungreased 1-qt. Baking dish. Combine the next five ingredients. Pour over meatballs. Cover and bake at 350 for 1 hour. Serve on rolls. ; name: vegetarian beanies n weenies ; ingredients: white beans, tofu hot dogs, ketchup, brown sugar, water, molasses, mustard powder, garlic powder ; preparation:

name: aunt norma s chocolate nut toffee ; ingredients: pecans, margarine, brown sugar, chocolate chips ; preparation:Spread nuts on bottom of a well-buttered 8x8 pan. Combine margarine and brown sugar in a heavy saucepan and bring to a full boil. Boil for 7 minutes, stirring constantly. Pour mixture over nuts, being sure to cover them all. Scatter chocolate chips over toffee. Cover until chips have softened, then spread evenly. Refrigerate until chocolate has set, turn out on a board and break into bite-sized pieces. ; name: apple cinnamon butter crunch ; ingredients: butter, brown sugar, flour, cinnamon, walnuts, apples, nutmeg ; preparation:Set oven to 375 degrees. Butter a 9 x 9-inch or an 11 x 7-inch baking pan. In a mixing bowl combine all the butter crunch. Mix well to combine with a wooden spoon. Sprinkle half of the mixture onto the bottom of the pan and press down light with back of a spoon. Bake for 15 minutes, or until lightly browned. In a mixing bowl combine the apple slices, brown sugar, flour, cinnamon, nutmeg and melted butter. Toss to combine. Spoon the mixture into the baked crust. Bake for about 30 minutes, or until apples are tender. Remove from oven and sprinkle the remaining butter crunch over the apples, then return to oven for about 10 minutes. Cool to room temperature. ; name: d s potato chip cookies ; ingredients: butter, margarine, granulated sugar, brown sugar, egg yolk, flour, potato chips, walnuts, vanilla ; preparation:Cream sugar and butter until creamy. Add all other ingredients. Make into balls, the size of small walnuts, flatten with fork and place onto greased cookie sheet. Place about 3 inches apart, as they spread while baking. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minute. I do not have the quantity for this recipe. If you know, please post. I am guessing. ; name: fudgie scotch squares ; ingredients: sweetened condensed milk, graham cracker crumbs, chocolate chips, butterscotch chips, walnuts ; preparation:Mix condensed milk, graham cracker crumbs, chocolate chips, butterscotch chips, and walnuts together well. Press into pam sprayed then well buttered 9 inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees fahrenheit for 30 minutes. Cool 45 minutes. Cut into squares. ; name: choc walnut and oat slice ; ingredients: butter, brown sugar, honey, rolled oats, self raising flour, walnuts, chocolate chips ; preparation:Heat oven 180c. Grease and line pan - 20cm x 30 cm. Melt butter, sugar and honey in pot. Stir gently till sugar dissolves. Stir in oats, flour and nuts. Cool mixture. Add choc chips. Press mixture into pan. Bake 20 minutes. ; name: pecan crunch fudge ; ingredients: brown sugar, butter, evaporated milk, butterscotch chips, marshmallow creme, pecans, almond brickle chips, vanilla, pecan halves ; preparation:Combine brown sugar, butter and evaporated milk in a 3 quart saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until mixture reaches soft ball stage. Remove from heat. Stir in butterscotch morsels and marshmallow creme. Beat vigorously with a wooden spoon until mixture is smoooth and just begins to cool. Stir in chopped pecans, brickle chips and vanilla. Spread mixture evenly into 2 buttered 8-inch square pans. Cool completely, and cut into squares. Gently press pecan half on each square if desired. Store in airtight container. ; name: choco banana squares ; ingredients: butter, sugar, light brown sugar, banana, flour, baking powder, salt, semi-sweet chocolate chips ; preparation:Cream first three ingredients together. Mix in bananas. Combine dry ingredients in a bowl and then add to wet mixture. Stir in cocolate chips. Spread batter in a greased and floured 10x5 inch jelly roll pan and bake at 350 for approximately 25 minutes or until the top is golden. ; name: chocolate toffee crunch candy ; ingredients: walnuts, brown sugar, butter, semi-sweet chocolate chips ; preparation:

name: slow cooker chicken with rosemary apples and onions ; ingredients: onions, apples, chicken pieces, salt, ground black pepper, fresh rosemary leaves, chicken stock, cream of celery soup, cooked rice ; preparation:Arrange onion and apple slices in bottom of slow cooker. Place chicken pieces on top and season all over with salt and black pepper. Sprinkle rosemary over chicken. In a medium bowl, whisk together chicken stock and soup. Pour mixture over chicken. Cover and cook on low for 6 to 8 hours or on high for 3 to 4 hours. Serve chicken, sauce, apples, and onions over rice. ; name: tahini rotini ; ingredients: garlic cloves, chickpeas, tahini, lemon juice, soy sauce, cayenne, vegetable broth, rotini pasta, broccoli florets, roasted sesame seeds ; preparation:In a food processor, combine garlic, chickpeas, tahini, lemon juice, soy sauce, and cayenne and process until smooth. Stir in broth and keep warm. Cook rotini according to package directions. Add broccoli during last 5 minutes of cooking. Drain pasta and broccoli. Toss with sauce, sprinkle with sesame seeds. ; name: chickpea and broccoli curry stew ; ingredients: vegetable oil, onion, garlic clove, curry powder, roma tomatoes, chickpeas, tomato ketchup, broccoli, tabasco sauce, salt ; preparation:In a medium pot, heat the oil on medium heat. Add the onion, the garlic and the curry powder. Saute for 2-3 minutes, then add the rest of the ingredients, plus a cup of water. Simmer for 30 minutes. Serve over basmati rice with a squirt of lime juice. ; name: creamy chickpea rosemary soup ; ingredients: olive oil, garlic cloves, fresh rosemary leaf, crushed red pepper flakes, chickpeas, chicken broth, fresh lemon juice, sea salt ; preparation:In a large saucepan, heat the oil over medium heat and add garlic, rosemary and red pepper flakes. Cook, stirring constantly, until the garlic starts to brown, about 1 minute. Add chickpeas and cook 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Add chicken broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 30 minutes. Let cool slightly. Transfer soup to a blender. Cover loosely, and puree until just smooth. Return to the saucepan and stir in lemon juice and sea salt to taste. Serve, garnished with a fresh rosemary sprig, or an additional drizzling of olive oil. ; name: pineapple fried rice ; ingredients: vegetable oil, garlic clove, fresh ginger, crushed red pepper flakes, cooked rice, light soy sauce, crushed pineapple in syrup, green onion ; preparation:In large nonstick skillet, heat oil over medium-low heat until hot. Add garlic, ginger and red pepper, cook and stir 2 minutes. Increase heat to medium-high. Add rice and soy sauce. Cook 2 minutes, stirring frequently. Add pineapple, tossing to combine. Heat rice through. Sprinkle with green onions before serving. ; name: around the world marinade for beef or chicken ; ingredients: oil, soy sauce, dried onion, garlic cloves, lime juice, lemon juice, cayenne, tandoori paste, dark brown sugar ; preparation:In a food processer or blender, put in oil, soy sauce, onion, garlic, lime and lemon juices, cayenne, tandoori paste, and sugar and puree. In a gallon size zip top bag, put pieces of selected meat and pour in marinade. Seal bag, removing as much air as possible. Allow steak to marinate for at least 1 hour in refrigerator. Then grill or broil selected meat to doneness. ; name: pasta arrabbiata ; ingredients: olive oil, garlic cloves, red pepper flakes, whole canned tomatoes, sugar, tomato sauce, dry white wine, oregano, basil, pasta ; preparation:Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook pasta in boiling water until just al dente. Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a large skillet. Add garlic and red pepper flakes. Cook until fragrant. Add remaining ingredients except pasta. Simmer about 10 minutes. Drain pasta. Add to sauce and cook, stirring, about 2 minutes. Season with salt and serve. ; name: zippy tomato soup ; ingredients: crushed tomatoes, onion, celery rib, garlic cloves, chicken stock, smoked paprika, cayenne, rosemary, dried marjoram, sour cream ; preparation:

name: ham broccoli breakfast casserole ; ingredients: white bread, cubed ham, frozen broccoli, sharp cheddar cheese, milk, eggs, salt, dry mustard, butter ; preparation:In a 9x13x2-inch baking dish, put enough of the bread pieces into the bottom of the pan to make a thin layer. Make a layer of ham, followed by a layer of broccoli, and then the cheese. Whisk together milk, eggs, salt, and dry mustard. Pour over top. Toss remaining bread with butter. Sprinkle over the top of the casserole. Bake at 325 for 45 minutes. Let cool for about 20 minutes. Cut into squares. ; name: sauerkraut mit kielbasa ; ingredients: turkey kielbasa, sauerkraut, granny smith apples, onion, low-sodium low-fat chicken broth, caraway seed, low-fat swiss cheese ; preparation:Place half the sauerkraut in a slow cooker, and top with the sausage. Cover with the remaining sauerkraut, apples, and onion. Pour chicken broth over all, and sprinkle with caraway seeds. Cover, and cook on high 3-4 hours or low 6-8 hours. Place each serving in a broiler-safe individual bowl or casserole, sprinkle with swiss cheese and place under broiler for 1-2 minutes until cheese turns bubbly and brown. ; name: double cheese soup ; ingredients: butter, onion, celery, flour, milk, cheddar cheese, gouda cheese, salt, hot sauce, chives ; preparation:Melt butter in saucepan. Add onion and celery, stir to soften. Add flour, to thicken. Slowly whisk in milk until smooth. Bring to a simmer. Add cheeses stirring until blended. Add salt& pepper to taste and garnish with chives. ; name: lazy eggs ; ingredients: ham, fresh tomato, cheese, egg, butter, salt & pepper ; preparation:Heat oven to 170. Lightly grease inside of a muffin tray with butter. Line 1 muffin well per person with ham,. Place approx 1 tsp chopped tomato in each well,. Top with grated cheese & crack an egg on top. Season with salt & pepper. Place into the oven for 18 to 20 mins until egg white is cooked and. Yolk is as firm as you like. ; name: ham and manchego panini with dipping sauce ; ingredients: country bread, ham, manchego cheese, olive oil, apricot jam, dijon mustard ; preparation:Divide ham and cheese evenly between two pieces of bread and top with remaining bread. Brush tops of sandwiches with 2 teaspoons oil. In a large nonstick skillet, heat remaining oil over medium-low heat. Place panini in skillet, oiled side up. Cover and cook until golden and cheese has melted, 5-8 minutes per side, pressing down with spatula occasionally. For sauce, mix together jam and dijon. ; name: baked eggs oamc ; ingredients: bread, mild cheddar cheese, ham, bell pepper, onion, eggs, milk ; preparation:Mix bread, cheese, ham, bell pepper and onion. Spread in a 13x9x2 inch baking dish treated with nonstick spray. Whisk eggs and milk, and pour over top. Cover dish with foil and freeze. To prepare for serving, thaw dish, and bake uncovered in a preheated 375 oven for 45 minutes. ; name: green tabasco breakfast burritos ; ingredients: flour tortillas, tomatoes, tabasco jalapeno sauce, eggs, salt and pepper, green onion, ham, unsalted butter, monterey jack cheese ; preparation:Wrap the tortillas in foil and place them in a 300f oven for 10 minutes. Combine the tomato and 1 tablespoon of the tabasco green sauce in a small bowl and set aside. In another bowl, beat the eggs with salt and pepper, and then stir in the green onion and ham. Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the butter and heat until melted, tilting the pan to cover the bottom and sides. Quickly add the egg mixture and cook until the eggs begin to set. Push the cooked portions to the side, allowing the uncooked egg to run to the bottom of the pan. When the eggs are cooked but still soft, sprinkle the remaining 1 tablespoon tabasco sauce evenly over the surface and top with cheese. Remove from the heat and divide among the tortillas. Roll up the tortillas and serve immediately. ; name: westphalian tortellini ; ingredients: tortellini, sweet butter, westphalian ham, heavy cream, parmesan cheese, fresh chives, frozen peas, salt and pepper ; preparation:

name: microwave banana pudding ; ingredients: granulated sugar, cornstarch, salt, milk, egg yolks, butter, vanilla, vanilla wafers, bananas, whipped topping ; preparation:In large microwavable bowl, combine sugar, cornstarch and salt. Gradually stir in milk and mix well. Microwave on high for 4 minutes. Remove from microwave. Stir in egg yolks. Microwave at 3-minute intervals. Stirring well after each until pudding is thick and creamy. Stir in butter and vanilla. In 9x13-inch glass pan, layer vanilla wafers on bottom, then half bananas, then half of pudding. Repeat layering process. Refrigerate. Top with whipped cream before serving. ; name: chocolate french silk pie copycat bakers square s french silk ; ingredients: butter, fine sugar, unsweetened chocolate, vanilla, eggs, whipped cream, frozen pie crust ; preparation:Bake a pie crust or use a mrs. Smiths frozen crust and make according to package directions. Beat sugar and butter until sugar is not grainy. Add chocolate and vanilla. Add eggs, two at a time, beating 5 minutes after each addition. Pour into cooled pie crust. Chill 2 hours or until firm. Before serving, top with whipped cream and a little grated chocolate. ; name: toffee dip with apples ; ingredients: brown sugar, powdered sugar, vanilla extract, reduced-fat cream cheese, toffee pieces, pineapple juice, red delicious apples, granny smith apples ; preparation:Combine first 4 ingredients in a bowl. Beat at medium speed of a mixer until smooth. Add toffee bits and mix well. Cover and chill. Combine juice and apples in a bowl. Toss well. Drain apples. Serve with dip. ; name: buttery cinnamon sheet bread ; ingredients: frozen bread dough, butter, white sugar, brown sugar, pecans, cinnamon, powdered sugar, whipping cream ; preparation:Set oven to 375 degrees. Grease a 15 x 10-inch jelly-roll pan. Spread the room temperature thawed dough on the bottom of the greased jelly-roll pan. Spread the softened butter over the dough, then prick holes in the dough with a fork. In a bowl stir together both sugars with cinnamon and nuts, then sprinkle all over the top of the buttered dough. Bake for about 15-20 minutes or until golden brown. Whisk the powdered sugar with the whipping cream until desired consistancy, then drizzle over the warm bread,. Cut into squares or triangles. Serve warm. ; name: classic two crust apple pie ; ingredients: tart apples, lemon juice, sugar, flour, cinnamon, nutmeg, butter, pie crusts ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425f. Peel, core and thinly and thickly slice the apples. Toss with lemon juice if using. Combine and mix apples, sugar, flour, cinnamon and nutmeg. Pour into crust-lined pie plate. Dot with butter. Place top crust, seal and vent. Cover edges of crust with narrow band of aluminum foil, shiny side out. Bake at 425f for 20 minutes. Reduce temperature to 375f and bake another 30-40 minutes until filling is bubbling and crust is nicely browned. If necessary remove foil last 10 minutes to brown edges. ; name: pumpkin cream pie ; ingredients: powdered sugar, cream cheese, butter, vanilla, pumpkin pie spice, canned pumpkin, 9-inch graham cracker crust, sugar, heavy cream ; preparation:Beat first 5 ingredients together until fluffy, 1-2 minutes. Blend in pumpkin. Spoon into crust. Chill throughly. Top with whipped cream. ; name: sweet bread bread pudding ; ingredients: sweet bread, raisins, butter, milk, sugar, eggs, apple pie filling, cinnamon, vanilla ; preparation:Grease a 9x12 pan. Scald milk. Add sugar and butter. Mix until butter is melted. Cool. Break sweet bread into pieces. Spread apple pie filling on top of the sweet bread. Sprinkle raisins over the filling. Combine cooled milk mixture with beaten eggs. Pour liquid over the bread. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 to 30 minutes. ; name: quick easy and yummy apple tart ; ingredients: puff pastry, apples, brown sugar, salt, caramel topping, whipped cream, powdered sugar, vanilla ice cream ; preparation:

name: chicken and avocado tortilla cups ; ingredients: cooked chicken, iceberg lettuce, avocado, tomatoes, mayonnaise, sweet chili sauce, basil, flour tortillas, mixed salad green ; preparation:Preheat oven to 200c. Lightly grease 4 holes of a 6 hole texas muffin tray. Combine chicken, lettuce, avocado, tomato, mayonnaise, chilli sauce and basil in a large bowl. Microwave tortillas on high in 15 second bursts until pliable and carefully place in prepared muffin holes, shaping into cups and then bake for 5 minutes or until golden and crisp. Place tortilla cups on serving plates and fill with chicken mixture and top with extra basil leaves. Serve with salad mix. ; name: continental b l t crunch ; ingredients: bread, olive oil, dried tomatoes, lettuce leaves, parmesan cheese, prosciutto ; preparation:Cut the crusty bread into thick slices. Brush well with olive oil. Sprinkle generously with parmesan cheese. Add slices of semi dried tomatoes. Add crisp lettuce leaves. Top off with thin slices of prosciutto. ; name: frog hollow chicken sandwiches ; ingredients: chicken breast fillet, white wine, celery, celery leaves, fresh chives, mayonnaise, lemon, juice of, salt and pepper, bread ; preparation:Preheat oven to 180 c. Place chicken in baking dish with celery leaves and wine. Cover dish with foil and cook chicken 20 - 30 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to cool. Drain. Roughly chop chicken. Mix in a large bowl with with all other ingredients, adding enough mayonnaise to moisten chicken and bind ingredients. Cut crusts off of bread and spoon mixture on the centre of half the bread and spread to the edge with knife. Top with remaining half of bread, pressing down gently. Cut each sandwich into 3 fingers. Place in baking dish cover with a damp tea towel and seal with plastic wrap. Sandwiches can be stored in refrigerator up to 6 hours. ; name: tastes like chick fil a chicken salad sandwich ; ingredients: cooked chicken breasts, celery, sugar, salt, fresh ground pepper, sweet pickle relish, mayonnaise, bread ; preparation:Pull apart the chicken into large chunks and either cut it into a small dice or process in a mini food processor. Place chicken in a large mixing bowl and add all remaining ingredients. Mix well. Toast your bread of choice and place salad in between toasted bread and serve. I also like to serve it in a lettuce cup with crackers for a little variety. ; name: b l a bacon lettuce apple bites ; ingredients: bacon, bibb lettuce, sharp cheddar cheese, apple, lemon juice, mayonnaise, flour tortillas ; preparation:Toss apples with lemon juice. Cook bacon in large skillet till crisp. Drain on paper towel. Spread 1 tbl. Mayonnaise on each tortilla. Divide cheddar cheese, lettuce, bacon, and apples between each tortilla. Roll tightly. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate 30 minutes. Slice into inch rounds and serves. ; name: crab stuffed eggs ; ingredients: eggs, white crab meat, mayonnaise, relish, tabasco sauce, fresh chives, salt and pepper, mixed salad greens ; preparation:Spoon out the egg yolks and put them into a large bowl, keeping the egg whites on the side. Mash the yolks with a fork and mix well with the crab meat, mayonnaise, relish and tabasco. Adjust seasoning as necessary. Spoon the mixture back into the egg whites, piling it up. Sprinkle the chives over the eggs. Arrange salad leaves on a plate and place the eggs on top. Chill for about 1 hour until ready to serve. ; name: thalhimers chicken salad ; ingredients: cooked chicken breasts, celery, lemon juice, mayonnaise, white pepper, salt ; preparation:In a large bowl, combine chicken, celery, lemon juice and mayonnaise. Stir to blend. Add pepper and salt and mix thoroughly. Chill before serving. 8 servings. ; name: classic club sandwich ; ingredients: white bread, mayonnaise, lettuce leaves, tomatoes, cooked bacon, cooked chicken breasts, sticks ; preparation:

name: vanilla pound cake ; ingredients: sugar, unsalted butter, eggs, vanilla, all-purpose flour, baking powder, milk ; preparation:Heat oven to 350f. Combine sugar and melted butter in large bowl. Beat at medium speed, scraping bowl often, until creamy. Add eggs,, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Add vanilla. Beat until well mixed. Stir together flour and baking powder in small bowl. Gradually add flour mixture alternately with milk to butter mixture, beating at low speed until well mixed. Pour batter into greased and floured 10-inch angel food cake pan. Bake for 50 to 60 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes. Remove from pan. ; name: easy baked custard ; ingredients: sugar, all-purpose flour, vanilla extract, salt, milk, eggs, margarine ; preparation:Preheat oven 350 f. Combine all ingredients in a blender. Blend until smooth. Pour into a buttered 9-in. Deep-dish pie or cake pan. Bake at for 50 minutes or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack until room temperature. Refrigerate until serving. ; name: abby s ultimate chocolate chocolate chip cookies ; ingredients: butter, white sugar, eggs, vanilla extract, all-purpose flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, salt, semi-sweet chocolate chips, milk chocolate chips ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In large bowl, beat butter, sugar, eggs, and vanilla until light and fluffy. Combine the flour, cocoa, baking soda, and salt. Stir into the butter mixture until well blended. Mix in the chocolate chips. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven, or just until set. Cool slightly on the cookie sheets before transferring to wire racks to cool completely. ; name: cornmeal cookies ; ingredients: butter, sugar, egg, pure vanilla extract, cornmeal, baking powder, salt, flour ; preparation:Mix softened butter and sugar until creamy. Add the egg and vanilla and beat well. In a separate mixing bowl, mix together the cornmeal, baking powder, salt and flour. Add to the creamed mixture. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto a greased cookie sheet. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven about 15 minutes or until lightly brown. ; name: mama jan s super yummy sugar cookies ; ingredients: butter, egg yolks, sugar, salt, baking powder, flour, vanilla extract, almond extract ; preparation:Cream together the butter and sugar. Add egg and mix well. Sift dry ingredients together and blend into sugar mixture. Mix well. Add extracts and blend well. Chill one hour. Roll out to thickness of half your little finger and cut with cookie cutters. Bake at 400f for 8-10 until edges are golden. ; name: top secret recipes version of ihop french toast by todd wilbur ; ingredients: eggs, milk, vanilla, all-purpose flour, salt, butter, thick bread, powdered sugar ; preparation:Beat eggs in a shallow bowl. Add milk, vanilla, flour, and salt to eggs. Beat with an electric mixture until all is well combined. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. When the surface is hot, add about a teaspoon of butter. Dip the bread into the batter and drop it onto the hot skillet. Let cook for 2-3 minutes on each side or until each side is golden brown. Cut toast in half diagonally and sprinkle with powdered sugar. ; name: birthday cookie ; ingredients: butter, brown sugar, sugar, egg, vanilla extract, all-purpose flour, baking soda, salt, chocolate chips ; preparation:Cream butter and sugars. Add egg and vanilla. Mix on low speed, add dry ingredients. Mix well. Stir in chocolate chips or m&ms. Spray a 12 inch round pizza pan with pam and spread cookie dough evenly to the edges. Bake at 325 degrees f for 15 to 20 minutes, or until light golden brown. When cool, decorate as desired. ; name: eggnog quick bread ; ingredients: eggs, white sugar, butter, eggnog, rum extract, vanilla extract, all-purpose flour, baking powder, salt, ground nutmeg ; preparation:

name: red curry with vegetables ; ingredients: coconut milk, red curry paste, chicken stock, fish sauce, brown sugar, zucchini, sugar snap peas, mushroom, bamboo shoot ; preparation:Combine 4 ounces coconut milk, curry paste, stock, fish sauce, and sugar and bring to a boil. Simmer for 15 minutes. Add vegetables and remaining coconut milk and simmer an additional 15 minutes. If using snow peas, add just before serving. Serve with rice. ; name: asian style salmon or tofu ; ingredients: bok choy, red bell pepper, salmon fillets, pepper, scallions, low sodium soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, gingerroot ; preparation:Heat oven to 400. Tear off four 15-inch squares of parchment paper. Arrange them evenly on baking sheets. Divide the bok choy and bell pepper evenly on the squares. Place the salmon on top of the vegetables and sprinkle with pepper. Top each square with scallions. In a small bowl, combine soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, and ginger. Spoon the mixture over the salmon or tofu. Top with another 4 squares of parchment paper and fold the edges over several times to seal. Bake for 15 minutes. When done baking, slit the parchment paper to open and serve, being cautious of the hot steam. For vegetarian use only the tofu. ; name: barbecued fish steaks ; ingredients: salmon fillets, onion, garlic, butter, lemon juice, soy sauce, salt, orange juice, ground pepper ; preparation:Saut onion and garlic in butter or margarine until tender. Add ingredients through ground peppercorn and simmer for about 7 minutes, stirring occasionally. Cool. Pour liquid into a zip-lock type storage bag. Add salmon. Marinate in refrigerator 45 minutes, turning after about 20 minute intervals. Remove fish from marinade. Place on well-greased, hinged wire grill. Cook 2 inches from coals for 3 minutes, basting frequently with sauce. Turn and cook for about 5 minutes longer, or until fish is done. ; name: salmon with lemon capers and rosemary ; ingredients: salmon fillets, extra virgin olive oil, salt, fresh ground black pepper, fresh rosemary leaf, lemon slices, lemon juice, marsala wine, capers, aluminum foil ; preparation:Brush top and bottom of salmon fillets with olive oil and season with salt, pepper, and rosemary. Place each piece of seasoned salmon on a piece of foil large enough to fold over and seal. Top the each piece of salmon with 2 lemon slices, 1 tablespoon of lemon juice, 2 tablespoons of wine, and 1 teaspoon of capers. Wrap up salmon tightly in the foil packets. Place a grill pan over medium-high heat or preheat a gas or charcoal grill. Place the foil packets on the hot grill and cook for 10 minutes for a 1-inch thick piece of salmon. Serve in the foil packets. ; name: roast salmon with lime salsa ; ingredients: limes, red onion, cilantro, jalapeno, canola oil, sugar, sea salt, salmon fillets, fresh ground pepper ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 425. Using a sharp knife, carefully peel the limes. Be sure to remove all of the bitter white pith. Working over a bowl, cut in between the membranes to release the lime sections into the bowl. Cut each section crosswise into quarters. Return the limes to the bowl and stir in the onion, cilantro and jalapeo. Add 1 tablespoon of the oil, the sugar and a pinch of salt and toss well. Heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of oil in an ovenproof skillet until shimmering. Season the fillets on both sides with salt and pepper and add to the skillet, skinned side up. Cook over moderately high heat until golden brown on the bottom, about 2 minutes. Transfer the skillet to the oven and roast the salmon for 5 minutes, or until just cooked through. Transfer to 4 dinner plates, spoon the salsa on top and serve. ; name: thai green curry salmon ; ingredients: skinless salmon fillet, unsweetened coconut milk, green curry paste, brown sugar, fish sauce, fresh lime juice, red bell pepper, mushroom, fresh basil, jasmine rice ; preparation:

name: smoked sausage potato chowder ; ingredients: smoked sausage, beef broth, water, scalloped potatoes mix, frozen mixed vegetables, salt, lemon pepper, whole milk, fresh chives ; preparation:Brown sausage in a soup pot over medium high heat. Add broth and water, potatoes and mixed vegetables, bring to a boil. Reduce heat, whisk in sauce mix, salt and lemon pepper until blended. Cover and simmer over low heat 10-15 minutes or until potatoes are tender, stirring occasionally. Stir in milk, cook uncovered, over medium heat until heated through. Remove from heat, stir in chopped chives and serve. ; name: smoked salmon tea sandwiches with dill cream cheese ; ingredients: bread, unsalted butter, fresh dill, cream cheese, smoked salmon ; preparation:Spread one teaspoon of butter on one side of each slice of bread. Mix the dill into the cream cheese. Spread the cream cheese on the buttered sides of bread. Layer the salmon on the cream cheese on one slice of bread, and cover with other bread slice. Cut the sandwich on the diagonals to create four triangles. ; name: minestre ; ingredients: smoked ham, string bean, potatoes, garlic cloves, chicken broth, dried thyme, black pepper, salt, olive oil ; preparation:Cut ham into bite-sized cubes. Peel and cut potatoes into bite-sized cubes. Remove ends from string beans and rinse. Peel and chop garlic. Heat olive oil in large pot of medium high heat. Saute meat in oil until lightly browned. Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Add string beans, potatoes, thyme, pepper and salt. Add broth and additional water to just cover. Turn heat to low and simmer for 45 minutes. ; name: mustard herring senapsill ; ingredients: herring fillets, egg yolks, swedish mustard, red wine vinegar, salt, white pepper, sugar, vegetable oil, dried dill weed ; preparation:Drain herring. Place in a medium bowl. In a small bowl, combine egg yolks, mustard, vinegar, salt, white pepper, and sugar. Use a whisk to gradually beat in oil until mixture is thick and creamy. Stir in dill. Pour over herring. Cover and refrigerate 3 to 4 hours. ; name: ginger lime salmon ; ingredients: salmon fillets, extra virgin olive oil, salt, cracked black pepper, lemons, ginger, limes ; preparation:Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Rub a 10 ounce skinless salmon fillet with just enough olive oil to coat. Place in a 10-inch nonstick skillet with an ovenproof handle. Season with salt and pepper, a squeeze of lemon or lime, and freshly grated ginger or garlic to taste. Bake 12-15 minutes or until firm to the touch or to your liking. ; name: smoked trout pate ; ingredients: smoked trout fillet, unsalted butter, lemon, juice of, creamed horseradish, cayenne pepper, nutmeg, fresh ground black pepper, sour cream, chives ; preparation:Skin the trout fillets removing any bones. Roughly flake half of the tout in a food processor. Add the butter, lemon juice, horseradish, cayenne pepper, nutmeg and a good seasoning of black pepper. Pulse to combine. Transfer mixture to a bowl and flake in the remaining trout. Fold in the sour cream and chopped chives. I serve this with pita bread triangles and chopped red onion and capers. ; name: lox cornucopia appetizer ; ingredients: smoked salmon, cream cheese with green onion, fresh parsley, red caviar ; preparation:Roll each slice of salmon into a cone shape. Place on wax paper. Cream the cheese until soft. Stir in the parsley. Pipe into the wee cones of salmon. Top with a tiny spoon of caviar. Arrange on a platter and refrigerate until serving time. ; name: open face salmon and egg scandinavian sandwich ; ingredients: smoked salmon, eggs, salt, black pepper, fresh dill sprigs, butter, miniature party rye rounds ; preparation:

name: kahlua bars ; ingredients: graham cracker crumbs, butter, milk chocolate chips, cream cheese, eggs, vanilla, kahlua, sugar, brown sugar ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 8x8 inch baking pan. Combine graham cracker crumbs and butter. Press into bottom of pan and bake for 8-10 minutes until slightly crispy. Cream eggs, cream cheese, vanilla, sugar, brown sugar, and kahlua until well-combined and smooth. Pour evenly over crust. Sprinkle chocolate chips evenly over filling. Bake 20 minutes. Place in fridge for about an hour to allow to cool completely before serving. ; name: layer bars ; ingredients: butter, graham cracker crumbs, coconut, chocolate chips, butterscotch chips, pecans, sweetened condensed milk ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Pour melted butter into bottom of a 9 x 13 inch pan. Sprinkle graham cracker crumbs and coconut over butter. Layer chocolate chips, butterscotch chips and nuts over crumbs and coconut. Pour condensed milk over all ingredients. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. ; name: lemon snow freeze ; ingredients: graham cracker crumbs, sugar, butter, eggs, sweetened condensed milk, lemon rind, lemon juice, angel flake coconut ; preparation:Combine graham cracker crumbs with 2 tablespoon of the sugar, and melted butter. Press mixture on bottom and sides of lightly buttered pie pan. Beat egg yolks until thick. Combine with condensed milk. Add lemon rind and juice gradually, stirring until thick. Stir in 1 cup coconut. Whip egg whites until foamy. Gradually beat in rest of sugar, then beat until stiff. Fold into lemon mixture. Pour into tray. Sprinkle top with remaining coconut. Chill in freezer until firm about 4 to 6 hours. ; name: zen bars ; ingredients: unsalted butter, graham cracker crumbs, whole almond, candied ginger, unsweetened flaked coconut, semi-sweet chocolate chips, white sesame seeds, sweetened condensed milk ; preparation:Heat the oven to 350f and arrange a rack in middle.
