In a blender, puree the pint of strawberries and add to the lemon juice. Stir well and refrigerate. Add sparkling water and stir well when ready to serve. ; name: traditional lemonade ; ingredients: lemons, caster sugar, water, of fresh mint, lemon juice, mineral water, ice cubes ; preparation:

name: warm bean and spinach salad ; ingredients: fresh spinach, cannellini beans, italian dressing, bell peppers, garlic powder, pepper, mozzarella cheese ; preparation:Remove tough stems from spinach and tear into bite-sized pieces. Place in a large bowl. Add beans and set aside. Heat dressing and bell pepper to boiling, then reduce heat. Cook uncovered, for 2 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in garlic powder and pepper. Pour heated mixture over spinach and beans. Toss, then sprinkle with mozarella. Serve warm. ; name: zucchini and tomato casserole ; ingredients: eggs, low-fat milk, parmesan cheese, salt, pepper, olive oil, onion, italian-style tomatoes, basil, zucchini ; preparation:Preheat oven to 300f. Combine first 5 ingredients in a bowl. Mix thoroughly and set aside. Heat oil in a heavy nonstick skillet over medium heat. Saut onion 5 minutes, or until softened. Stir in tomatoes and basil and saut 5 minutes. Add zucchini and saut 5 minutes, or until zucchini is tender. Stir vegetables into egg mixture. Pour into a buttered shallow baking dish and bake 15 minutes or until casserole is set. Do not overcook. Cut into wedges. ; name: pizza bagel omelets ; ingredients: eggs, parmesan cheese, italian spices, fresh garlic, pizza toppings, tomatoes, mozzarella cheese, bagels ; preparation:Melt the butter in a large frying pan. Add the parmesan cheese, italian spices, and garlic and mix well. Add the beaten eggs to the pan and cook until almost set. Top with the pizza toppings and cook until the eggs are set and the toppings are heated through. Remove the omelet from the pan and cut in quarters. Fold each quarter into a triangle and place on top of a bagel half. Top with the tomatoes and mozzarella. Broil until the cheese melts and the toppings are hot. ; name: garlic parsley frittata ; ingredients: milk, eggs, fresh parsley, garlic clove, dried chili pepper flakes, white bread, salt & pepper, olive oil, fresh parmesan cheese ; preparation:Beat together milk, eggs, parsley, garlic & chilli flakes. Add the torn bread and season with salt & pepper. Set aside for 5 mins so that the bread completely softens into the mixture. Heat the oil in a fry-pan & pour in the egg mixture. Cook for 3 mins or until golden & almost set. Flip the frittata & scatter with parmesan, cook until the underside is golden and the cheese has melted. ; name: oven fried garlic chicken ; ingredients: breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese, fresh parsley, salt, fresh ground pepper, butter, garlic cloves, chicken ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. In a shallow bowl, blend together bread crumbs, parmesan cheese, parsley, salt, and pepper. In a small saucepan, heat butter and garlic over very low heat until butter melts. Remove from heat. Brush chicken pieces with garlic butter, then roll in bread crumb mixture to coat. Place chicken skin side up on a large foil-lined baking sheet. Mix together any remaining crumb mixture and butter and sprinkle over chicken. Place in oven and bake 1 hour. ; name: onion soup with a crust kuoritettu sipulikeitto ; ingredients: onions, butter, beef stock, bay leaf, salt, pepper, french bread, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. In a heavy pot over medium heat, brown the onions in the butter. Add the beef broth and bay leaf. Add salt and pepper to taste. Cover and simmer 30 minutes. Remove bay leaf. Pour the soup into an ovenproof casserole and cover with the bread slices. Sprinkle cheese over bread slices. Bake in preheated oven until the cheese has melted and is slightly browned. Serve immediately. ; name: penne pasta with tomatoes and cheese ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, garlic, plum tomatoes, dried basil, ground red pepper, chicken broth, penne pasta, havarti cheese, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Heat 3 tbsp oil in pan. Saute onion and garlic. Mix in tomatoes, basil and ground red pepper. Bring to a boil, breaking up tomatoes. Add broth and boil. Reduce heat and simmer about 1 hour. Cook pasta and drain. Toss with 3 tbsp oil. Mix pasta with sauce and then mix in havarti cheese. Put into 9x13 baking dish and sprinkle top with parmesan cheese. Bake in 375 oven about 30 minutes. Of this recipe will easily serve 4. ; name: ravioli and spinach supper ; ingredients: chicken stock, cheese ravioli, fresh spinach, parsley, salt and pepper, parmesan cheese, italian bread ; preparation:

name: skillet pizza potatoes ; ingredients: italian pork sausage, pepperoni slice, pizza sauce, water, southern style hash browns, italian cheese blend ; preparation:Cook sausage over medium high heat. Stir in pepperoni, cook 2 more minutes. Drain. Stir in pizza sauce and water. Add hashbrowns. Cook covered 10-15 minutes over medium heat, stirring occassionally. Sprinkle with cheese and remove from heat. Cover and let stand 5 minutes. ; name: italian sausage and broccoli quiche ; ingredients: mild italian sausage, broccoli florets, italian cheese blend, eggs, heavy cream, black pepper, salt, rosemary, pie crusts ; preparation:Fry the sausage links in a skillet. When cooked through, slice thinly and set aside. Beat the eggs, cream, salt, pepper and rosemary in a bowl. Mix in the sausage, broccoli and cheese, stirring til all ingredients are coated. Pour into pie shell. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes, or until knife inserted in center comes out clean. ; name: spaghetti sauce with cream cheese salsa ; ingredients: spaghetti sauce, salsa, ground chuck, italian turkey sausage, cream cheese, onion, olive oil, salt, pepper, oregano ; preparation:Place olive oil in large skillet and turn up to medium heat. Chop onion, then add to hot oil. Saute for approximately three minutes. Add ground beef and sausage. Stir and cook until both are well browned. Remove oil from pan. Add sauce, then add the salsa. Cover and cook at medium heat until sauce starts to bubble. Cut cream cheese into chunks and stir into the sauce. Cook and stir until thoroughly melted. Serve over pasta, rice or bread. ; name: mediterranean marinated vegetable salad ; ingredients: tomatoes, green pepper, yellow pepper, zucchini, red onion, italian dressing, fresh basil, garlic cloves, italian cheese blend ; preparation:Toss tomatoes, peppers, zucchini and onions in large bowl. Combine dressing, basil and garlic. Pour over vegetable mixture, toss to coat. Add cheese, mix lightly. Refrigerate at least 1 hour before serving. Makes 8 servings, 1 cup each. ; name: sausage florentine pizza ; ingredients: hot italian sausage, fresh mushrooms, garlic, pizza sauce, dried oregano, dried basil, frozen chopped spinach, salt and pepper, boboli pizza crust, mozzarella cheese ; preparation:In a big skillet, saute the sausage, mushrooms, and garlic until the meat is browned. Crumble the sausage while cooking. Drain off fat. Remove excess fat by patting meat mixture with paper towels. Add pizza sauce, oregano, basil, chopped spinach, and salt and pepper to taste. Cook, stirring frequently, until heated through. Place pizza crust on a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake at 400 for 5 minutes. Spread meat mixture evenly over pizza crust. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until cheese melts and pizza is heated. ; name: spaghetti with italian sausage spinach and diced tomatoes ; ingredients: spaghetti, sweet italian turkey sausage, diced tomatoes, baby spinach, white onion, olive oil, garlic clove, red pepper flakes ; preparation:Boil spaghetti until al dente. Prepare a large non-stick skillet on med-high heat with olive oil. Chop sausage links into bite size chunks and cook until browned in the skillet. Chop onion into large chunks and add to the skillet, mix with sausage. Add garlic, salt, and red pepper flakes. Add tomatoes and spinach. Mix well until heated through. Serve over spaghetti or mix it all up. ; name: sausage and cabbage ciorba ; ingredients: hot italian sausage, extra virgin olive oil, green cabbage, onion, caraway seed, red pepper flakes, chicken stock, white vinegar, salt and pepper ; preparation:Brown the sausage in the evoo over med-high heat. Add the cabbage and onions. Continue to cook over med-high heat for approximately 10 minutes, or until vegetables are cooked through. Add the caraway seeds and pepper flakes. Add the chicken stock and bring to a boil. Simmer for 10 minutes, skimming foam from top. Stir in vinegar and taste. Add sour cream, if desired, when served. ; name: mozzarella ziti with sausage ; ingredients: italian sausage, onion, green bell pepper, oil, diced tomatoes, italian stewed tomatoes, ketchup, ziti pasta, mozzarella cheese ; preparation:

name: spaghetti sauce with cream cheese salsa ; ingredients: spaghetti sauce, salsa, ground chuck, italian turkey sausage, cream cheese, onion, olive oil, salt, pepper, oregano ; preparation:Place olive oil in large skillet and turn up to medium heat. Chop onion, then add to hot oil. Saute for approximately three minutes. Add ground beef and sausage. Stir and cook until both are well browned. Remove oil from pan. Add sauce, then add the salsa. Cover and cook at medium heat until sauce starts to bubble. Cut cream cheese into chunks and stir into the sauce. Cook and stir until thoroughly melted. Serve over pasta, rice or bread. ; name: penne with collards sausage and mushrooms ; ingredients: spicy smoked sausage, fresh mushrooms, garlic cloves, olive oil, collard greens, dried italian seasoning, tomatoes seasoned with basil garlic & oregano, penne pasta, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Prepare pasta according to package directions and plan to have it cooked& ready to go by the end of the cooking process. Brown sausage slices in a large deep pot until browned on each side. Remove sausage slices from the pan and drain off any fat. Add oil to the same pot, heat over medium briefly, then add garlic and mushrooms, stirring constantly until mushrooms are tender - this will take only a few minutes. Return the sausage slices to the pan along with collards, italian seasoning, and tomatoes with their juices. Cook, stirring as needed, for about 10 minutes. Add the cooked pasta and toss well. Serve with grated parmesan cheese sprinkled over each serving to taste. ; name: super easy sausage peppers ; ingredients: sweet italian sausage links, olive oil, sweet onion, green bell peppers, tomato sauce ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400. Bake cut up sausages for about 20 minute while sausage is cooking put onion and oil in large skillet saute onion till translucent. When sausage is done add to skillet with the onions and add the tomato sauce. Cook for 20 minutes then add the peppers and cook 20 minutes more. Serve over rice. ; name: sausage and cabbage ciorba ; ingredients: hot italian sausage, extra virgin olive oil, green cabbage, onion, caraway seed, red pepper flakes, chicken stock, white vinegar, salt and pepper ; preparation:Brown the sausage in the evoo over med-high heat. Add the cabbage and onions. Continue to cook over med-high heat for approximately 10 minutes, or until vegetables are cooked through. Add the caraway seeds and pepper flakes. Add the chicken stock and bring to a boil. Simmer for 10 minutes, skimming foam from top. Stir in vinegar and taste. Add sour cream, if desired, when served. ; name: one pan sausage tortellini ; ingredients: hot italian sausage, roasted garlic, onion, refrigerated cheese tortellini, tomato and basil pasta sauce, extra virgin olive oil, water, garlic salt ; preparation:Place onions, garlic and olive oil in large saucepan over medium-high heat. Squeeze sausage from casing into pan. Cook until meat is brown and no pink remains, stirring frequently and breaking meat up as it cooks. Stir in remaining ingredients. Bring to boil and cook 12 minutes, stirring occasionally, until pasta is tender and sauce thickens. ; name: the john sieble special ; ingredients: fresh spinach, sweet italian sausage, garlic, onion, olive oil, dried oregano, dried parsley, black pepper, ziti pasta, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Cook pasta according to package directions for aldente. Toss with a little olive oil and keep warm. Set aside. While pasta is cooking, in a large skillet brown the italian sausage until no longer pink. Set aside. Wipe out skillet with a paper towel and return to stove top. Heat olive oil 2-3 minutes then saute onion and garlic until onion it translucent over medium heat. Now add cleaned dry spinach to onion and garlic and toss as for stir fry adding more oil if needed until spinach is thouroughly wilted. Add herbs and pepper a minute or two before spinach is done. Combine spinach sauce with sausage and heat just long enough to heat everything through. Now toss with warm pasta and sprinkle liberally with grated parmesan or romano cheese just before serving. Serve with a crusty bread and small salad it you like. ; name: fettuccine with creamy tomato sausage sauce ; ingredients: olive oil, spicy sausage, garlic, crushed tomatoes, sun-dried tomato, dry white wine, cream, spring onions, sage leaves, fettuccine ; preparation:Heat olive oil in frying pan, cook sausages for 8-10 minutes or until cooked through. Remove from pan and chop roughly, cover to keep warm. Return pan to medium heat and add garlic, crushed and sundried tomatoes, white wine and cream and bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer, uncovered for 10 minutes or until sauce thickens slightly. Meanwhile, cook pasta according to package directions, drain. Stir cooked sausage, spring onions and sage through sauce, season to taste. Divide pasta among serving bowls and spoon over sauce. ; name: italian sausage in tomato sauce ; ingredients: italian sausage, olive oil, tomato sauce, oregano, chablis, mushroom ; preparation:

name: beef misoyaki ; ingredients: boneless rib-eye steaks, sesame seeds, light miso, sake, sugar, soy sauce, cooking oil ; preparation:Freeze steaks for 45 minutes or so until they are firm and partially frozen, then remove excess fat and slice very thin. Place in a large bowl or resealable plastic bag. In a small skillet, toast sesame seeds over high heat, swirling pan, being careful not to burn. Remove from heat and cool. Place sesame seeds in a mortar and grind finely or you may use a small coffee grinder set on pulse. Place sesame seeds in a small bowl and mix with miso, soy sauce, sugar, and sake. Add mixture to meat and work through as a marinade. Allow meat to marinate for 30 minutes to 1 hour. Heat a large skillet or griddle on high and add a little oil, and cook beef without crowding. Cook beef about 3-5 minutes or until done to your liking. Or you may place meat in broiler or grill and cook several minutes or until cooked through. Serve with steamed rice if you wish, and a stir-fried vegetable cooked with ginger and a little soy goes nicely as well. ; name: basil marinated steak ; ingredients: worcestershire sauce, fresh basil, red wine vinegar, olive oil, honey, garlic cloves, fresh coarse ground black pepper, boneless beef top round steaks ; preparation:In a large nonmetal dish or resealable food storage plastic bag, combine all ingredients except steak. Mix well. Add steak and turn to coat. Cover dish or seal bag. Refrigerate atleast 4 hours or overnight to marinate. Heat grill. When ready to grill, remove steak from marinade. Discard marinade. Place steak on gas grill over medium heat. Cook 10 to 15 minutes or until desired doneness, turning once or twice. To serve, cut steak across grain into slices. Place on serving platter. ; name: venison steak marinade ; ingredients: canola oil, lemon juice, worcestershire sauce, soy sauce, garlic, ground pepper, venison steak ; preparation:Mix all marinade ingredients together in a small measuring cup. Place venison steaks in a large zip lock bag. Pour marinade over steaks and seal bag. Place bag in a flat casserole dish so that the steaks are in a single layer. Refrigerate and marinate at least 4 hours, turning every half hour to marinate each side. Drain marinade and grill steaks to desired doneness. I double or triple this recipe for each addition package of steak. Any wild game steak can be used in this recipe. ; name: kurt busch s grilled t bone ; ingredients: worcestershire sauce, vinegar, garlic cloves, black pepper, salt, beef t-bone steaks ; preparation:In a medium size bowl, blend together worcestershire, vinegar, garlic, pepper and salt. Place steaks in a large resealable plastic bag and add marinade. Turn to coat. Refrigerate 45 minutes to an hour, turning occasionally. Heat grill to medium-high heat. Remove steaks from marinade and grill, turning once, about 3 minutes per side or until preferred doneness. Let steaks rest 5 minuts before serving. ; name: pepper beef steak packets ; ingredients: boneless beef top sirloin steak, garlic powder, black pepper, green bell pepper, red bell pepper, teriyaki sauce, cooked rice ; preparation:Preheat oven to 450 degrees f or grill to medium-high. Sprinkle both sides of steak with garlic powder and pepper. Cut in thin strips. Combine steak strips and pepper strips with teriyaki sauce. Center one-fourth of the steak mixture on each sheet of foil. Bring up foil sides. Double fold top and ends to seal packet, leaving room for heat circulation inside. Repeat to make four packets. Bake 12 to 15 minutes on a cookie sheet in oven or grill 7 to 9 minutes in covered grill. Serve immediately over rice. Makes 4 servings. ; name: beef fajita marinade super easy ; ingredients: skirt steak, garlic clove, cumin, fresh cilantro, worcestershire sauce, soy sauce, liquid smoke ; preparation:Trim fat from steak. Pound steak lightly to tenderize. Combine ingredients in gallon-size zipper baggie. Zip closed and shake well to combine. Add meat to baggie. Refrigerate overnight. Grill until desired doneness. ; name: sauteed sirloin and mushrooms ; ingredients: boneless beef sirloin, herb seasoning mix, butter, beef broth, hoisin sauce, onion, fresh mushrooms ; preparation:Cut steak into 4 servings-size pieces. Sprinkle with herb pepper or garlic pepper. In a 10-inch skillet cook steaks in hot butter over medium heat for 8 to 10 minutes or to desired doneness, turning once. Remove steak from pan. Cover and keep warm. For mushroom glaze, carefully add beef broth and hoisin, teriyaki, or worcestershire sauce to skillet. Cook until bubbly, scraping brown bits from bottom skillet. Stir in onoin wedges and sliced mushrooms. Cook over medium-high about 8 minutes or until vegetables are tender and the glaze is reduced to half its volume. Transfer warm steak to dinner plates and spoon glaze on steaks. ; name: seared sirloin with sweet balsamic sauce ; ingredients: boneless sirloin steak, water, light soy sauce, worcestershire sauce, balsamic vinegar, sugar ; preparation:

name: old fashioned bean soup ; ingredients: mutton, bacon, beef broth, olive oil, onion, celery, carrot, navy beans, salt, pepper ; preparation:Place meat, bacon and broth in a pot and bring to a boil. Cover and simmer for 1 hour. Heat oil in pan and saute onion, celery and carrot for 10 minutes. Add vegetables to the meat and simmer for 20 minutes. Add salt and pepper and serve. ; name: sweet potato and spicy carrot soup ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, sweet potatoes, carrots, vegetable stock, chili oil ; preparation:Heat the olive oil in a large saucepan and gently fry the onion over a medium heat until softened but not browned. Add the sweet potato and carrots and cook, covered, for 10 minutes or so, until the vegetables are soft but still with some bite. Pour in the stock, bring to the boil and then simmer, covered, for 30 minutes until the vegetables are tender. Pour into a blender and whizz until smooth - do this in batches if you need to. Return to the pan and gently reheat. Season if desired and either stir in the chilli oil or serve garnished with a few drops of the oil. ; name: pommes de terre avec udon ; ingredients: potatoes, cherry tomatoes, green pepper, yellow onion, olive oil, rice vinegar, fresh udon noodles, salt, pepper ; preparation:Heat olive oil in large skillet and add chopped onions. Salt the onions to bring out flavor. Cook until slightly golden. Salt potatoes, add to skillet and cook until potatoes begin to soften and turn brown around the edges. Add rice wine vinegar to help the onions caramelize and bring out the natural flavor of the vegetables. Add chopped pepper, tomatoes and fresh udon noodles. Mix together and season with salt and pepper as needed. ; name: spanish chickpea soup ; ingredients: olive oil, onions, carrot, chickpeas, vegetable stock, salt and pepper, bay leaf, butter, lemon juice ; preparation:Add oil and onions to a medium saucepan and saute on low heat, stirring, until very well done. Add the carrot and chickpeas, and saute for 2 minutes, stirring continuously. Add stock and bring to boil. Add seasonings and simmer on low until veggies are tender, adding water if necessary and stirring on occasion. Remove bay leaf and puree soup. Add butter and lemon juice. Simmer until heated through. Serve hot. ; name: turkey shepard s pie shepherd s ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, carrots, ground turkey, thyme, ground pepper, flour, chicken broth, tomato paste, mashed potatoes ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425f. Combine oil, onion and carrots. Cook 7 minutes. Then add turkey, thyme and salt. Cook until turkey is browned. Sprinkle in flour and cook until absorbed. Stir in tomato paste and broth, bring to boil. Reduce and simmer until thickened. Transfer to a 2 quart baking dish and top with favorite prepared mashed potatoes. Bake 15 minutes in oven. ; name: creamy cauliflower soup ww friendly ; ingredients: olive oil, leeks, celery, chicken broth, cauliflower, half-and-half, nutmeg, salt, pepper, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Clean and chop the leeks and celery. Heat oil in a large nonstick sauce pan, over medium heat. Add the leeks and celery, stir frequently, cook until softened, not browned, about 4 minutes. Add the broth and cauliflower, bring to boil. Cover and simmer until the cauliflower is tender, about 10-15 minutes. Remove from heat. In batches or with a blender stick, puree to desired texture. You may want to spoon out and reserve some cauliflower pieces for added texture. Stir in half & half and nutmeg and blend. Top with grated cheddar cheese. ; name: sweet cabbage salad ; ingredients: cabbage, carrot, green bell pepper, red onion, sugar, white wine vinegar, olive oil, dry mustard, celery seed, salt ; preparation:Combine first 4 ingredients in a large bowl. Toss well. Combine sugar and remaining ingredients in a small bowl, stirring with a whisk. Pour vinegar mixture over cabbage mixture, tossing gently to combine. Cover. Chill 1 hour. ; name: salmon barley pilaf ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, carrot, celery, salmon, pearl barley, rice, cilantro, pepper ; preparation:

name: strawberries and oranges in syrup ; ingredients: water, sugar, basil, strawberries, oranges ; preparation:Bring water and sugar to a boil and cook until clear and sugar is dissolved. Let syrup cool briefly and add basil. Set aside to steep and cool. Wash strawberries, removing and discarding caps and then cut into quarters. Cut away the orange peel from the oranges, and then cut oranges into sections. Put the strawberries and orange pieces in a bowl. Toss. Pour syrup over fruit. Refrigerate at least 30 minutes. ; name: berry best freezer jam ; ingredients: blueberries, raspberries, sugar, lemon juice, water, dry pectin ; preparation:Combine blueberries and raspberries in a large bowl. Stir in sugar and lemon juice. Let stand for 10 minutes. In a small saucepan, bring water and pectin to a boil. Boil for one minute, stirring constantly. Add to fruit mixture. Stir for 3 minutes. Ladle into freezer containers. Cool to room temperature, about 30 minutes. Cover and let stand overnight at room temperature before freezing. May be frozen up to one year. Store in refrigerator up to 3 weeks after opening. ; name: strawberry orange banana frappe ; ingredients: strawberries, bananas, orange juice, water ; preparation:Whizz the hulled strawberries in the food processor until very finely chopped. Whiz in the peeled bananas. Scrape down the sides. Next add the orange juice, and then, with the motor running, slowly pour in the water. Serve over ice cubes. ; name: peach melba jam ; ingredients: peaches, sugar, fresh raspberry, chambord raspberry liquor ; preparation:Combine peaches and sugar in a saucepan. Cover and let stand at least an hour to macerate, tossing once or twice. Cook over low heat until sugar dissolves and mixture darkens and turns clear, 25 to 30 minutes stirring as needed to keep from sticking add raspberries, continue cooking over low heat, stirring constantly, until mixture is thick, about 10 minutes. Stir in chambord and remove from heat. Immediately pour into 2 hot sterilized 1 pint canning jars. Once jars are sealed, let them cool completely upside down on top of a clean kitchen towel, and store in the fridge or in the freezer. ; name: citrus salad ; ingredients: ruby grapefruits, oranges, sugar, cinnamon stick, mint leaves ; preparation:Peel and remove the pith form the grapefruit and oranges. Carefully cut out the segments and mix together in a bowl. Put the sugar, cinnamon stick and mint leaves in a small pan with 3 tablespoons of water and sitr over low heat until sugar has dissolved. Remove the cinnamon stick and mint, and drizzle the syrup over the fruit. Garnish with fresh mint leaves. This salad can be kept in the refrigerator for up to 2 days and the flavor will actually improve as it develops. ; name: peach and raspberry jam ; ingredients: frozen raspberries, peaches, lemon juice, sugar, liquid fruit pectin ; preparation:Thaw berries according to package directions. Peel, pit and crush peaches. Measure thawed berries and add enough crushed peaches to make 4 cups fruit. Place in kettle, add lemon juice and sugar, mixing throughly. Bring to a full rolling boil over high heat and let boil hard for 1 minute, stirring constantly. Remove from heat, add pectin, stirring vigorously. Stir and skim alternately for about 5 minutes. Ladle quickly into hot sterilized jars. Seal 5 minutes in boiling water bath using 2 piece lids. ; name: raspberry currant jam ; ingredients: red currants, water, red raspberries, sugar ; preparation:Wash the currants and put them in a sauce pan with the water. Cover the pot and bring to a boil, stirring gently, until the currants are all popped. Press them through a sieve, and reserve the puree. Discard the skins, stems and seeds. Gently rinse the raspberries and drain them well. Mix the currant puree, raspberries and sugar in a large pot. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly, until the sugar dissolves. Boil hard until the mixture almost reaches the gell stage, about 20 minutes. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking. Remove from the heat and skim. Seal in sterilized jars. Put in a boiling water bath for 5 minutes. ; name: yummy raspberry chipotle sauce ; ingredients: fresh raspberries, sugar, ruby port, chipotle chile in adobo ; preparation:

name: chocolate crunch peanut butter treats ; ingredients: powdered sugar, peanut butter, rice krispies, oil, dipping chocolate ; preparation:Combine sugar, peanut butter, rice krispies, and oil together. Take spoonfuls sized however large you want and drop onto wax paper cookie sheet. Freeze for about 30 minutes. Remove from freezer. Shape into eggs, hearts for valentines, or other shapes according to holidays with cookie cutters if you need to. Put back on wax paper covered cookie sheet. Freeze for 2 hours. Melt dipping chocolate or chocolate with some grated paraffin wax in microwave. Dip eggs in and completely cover. Put back on cookie sheet and refrigerate. Decorate. Cooking time is freezing time. ; name: chocolate almond butter crunch ; ingredients: butter, sugar, light corn syrup, water, vanilla extract, toasted almonds, semi-sweet chocolate chips ; preparation:Melt the butter in a heavy 3-liter saucepan on low heat. Add the sugar, corn syrup and water. Cook over medium heat. Stir constantly until it reaches hard crack stage, 300 on candy thermometer. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla extract and the almonds. Spread into a buttered 13 x 9-inch pan. Let stand 5 minutes. Sprinkle with chocolate chips. When chocolate is melted, spread evenly over candy. Let cool completely, and when chocolate is set, break into pieces. ; name: butter crunch clusters ; ingredients: butter, brown sugar, corn syrup, cheerios toasted oat cereal, salted peanuts ; preparation:Heat butter in saucepan over low heat until melted. Stir in brown sugar and corn syrup. Heat to boiling over medium heat, stirring constantly. Boil and stir 1 minute. Remove from heat. Stir in cereal and peanuts until well coated. Drop mixture by tablespoonfuls onto waxed paper. Cool. ; name: chocolate crispy peanut butter balls ; ingredients: powdered sugar, butter, crunchy peanut butter, rice krispies, german sweet chocolate, semi-sweet chocolate chips, paraffin wax ; preparation:Combine first 4 ingredients in large bowl and mix well. Roll dough into 1-inch balls and chill, covered. For chocolate coating, melt german and semisweet chocolates, and paraffin wax in top of double boiler over boiling water, stirring constantly until smooth. Use a toothpick to insert in each ball, dipping balls into chocolate mixture, one at a time. Set balls on wax paper to harden. Store in airtight container in refrigerator. ; name: peanut butter rice crispy bars ; ingredients: crispy rice cereal, karo syrup, granulated sugar, peanut butter, chocolate chips, butterscotch chips ; preparation:Measure out rice crispies and set aside in large bowl. In saucepan combine sugar and karo. Bring just to simmer, then add the peanut butter and stir. Do not let the sugar mixture boil. Stir peanut butter mixture into rice crispies and stir quickly. It will start to harden immediately. Pour mixture into a 9x12 pan and flatten out evenly across pan. Combine chocolate and butterscotch chips into saucepan and melt over a double boiler and stir constantly. When melted pour over peanut butter mixture. Let it set. When set, cut into squares. ; name: fast and easy corn flake candy ; ingredients: sugar, light corn syrup, peanut butter, corn flakes ; preparation:Combine sugar and corn syrup in a dutch oven. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Stir in peanut butter. Add corn flakes and stir until all are coated with syrup mixture. Drop by tablespoon onto waxed paper. You can add 1 tsp of vanilla for a slightly different flavor. Or you can spread the mix out into a 13 x 9 dish and cut into squares. ; name: fudge crispy treats ; ingredients: crisp rice cereal, semi-sweet chocolate chips, powdered sugar, corn syrup, butter, real vanilla extract ; preparation:Combine the cereal and sugar in a large bowl an set aside. Place chocolate chips in a 1-qt microwave-safe dish. Microwave uncovered, on high for about 1 minute. Stir gently until smooth. Stir in vanilla. Pour over cereal mixture and mix well. Spoon into a greased 9x13 baking pan. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, then cut into squares. ; name: crispy peanut butter chocolate treats ; ingredients: sugar, light corn syrup, chunky peanut butter, rice krispies, semisweet chocolate morsels ; preparation:

name: creamy swiss steak ; ingredients: flour, salt, pepper, boneless beef round steak, butter, onion, condensed cream of mushroom soup, water, cooked noodles ; preparation:In a shallow bowl combine the flour, salt, and pepper. Dredge beef. In a large skillet, brown beef in butter on both sides. Transfer to a 3 quart slow cooker. Top with onion. Combine soup and water, pour over onion. Cover and cook on low 8-9 hours or until meet is tender. Serve with noodles. ; name: swiss steak quick and easy this is wrong category should be in ; ingredients: vegetable oil, cube steaks, all-purpose flour, onion, mushroom, salt and pepper, brown gravy mix, stewed tomatoes, egg noodles ; preparation:Heat oil in a dutch oven over medium heat. Dredge steak strips in flour. Working in batches, place strips in hot oil. Fry until browned on both sides. Remove to a warm platter. When all meat is browned, return meat to dutch oven, and stir in onions, mushrooms, salt, pepper, gravy mix, and stewed tomatoes. Bring to a boil, then simmer about 30 to 45 minutes. About 20 minutes before steak is finished, fill a large pot with water and bring to a boil. Add pasta, and cook until al dente, about 8 to 10 minutes. Drain. Serve swiss steak over noodles. ; name: quick stroganoff ; ingredients: butter, onion, ground beef, flour, salt, pepper, paprika, cream of mushroom soup, sour cream, noodles ; preparation:Cook noodles as directed, drain and set aside. Saute onoin in butter. Stir in groudn beef, flour, salt, pepper and paprika, saute for 5 minutes. Add soup and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from heat, stir in sour cream. Serve over hot noodles. ; name: minute steaks with taco sauce ; ingredients: butter, vegetable oil, minute steaks, button mushrooms, taco sauce, fresh parsley, salt, fresh ground pepper ; preparation:Heat the butter and oil in a frying pan. Season the steaks with salt and pepper and fry for 1 minute on each side on fairly high heat. Place the cooked steaks into a serving dish and place in the oven to keep warm. Add mushrooms to the pan. Cook on high heat and lightly brown. Remove from pan and place in oven to keep warm. Pour the taco sauce in the pan and simmer for about 1 minute. Place the mushrooms and steaks on a plate and pour the taco sauce over the steaks. Garnish with the parsley. Serve. ; name: cheese steak quesadillas ; ingredients: butter, onion, garlic powder, cheddar cheese, flour tortillas, deli roast beef ; preparation:In a large skillet melt butter over medium-low heat. Add onion and cook about 15 minutes or until onion gets soft and starts to brown, stirring occasionally. Stir in garlic powder. Remove from skillet. Place a tortilla in the same skillet. Arrange cheese slices across the whole tortilla. On one side of each tortilla, put the roast beef and top the other side with onions. Cook over medium heat until lightly browned. Carefully fold tortillas in half, pressing gently. Remove from skillet. Keep warm in the oven until remaining quesadillas are cooked. Cut into wedges to serve. ; name: awesome baked pork chops ; ingredients: pork chops, garlic powder, seasoning salt, eggs, all-purpose flour, italian style breadcrumbs, olive oil, condensed cream of mushroom soup, milk, white wine ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Rinse pork chops, pat dry, and season with garlic powder and seasoning salt to taste. Place the beaten eggs in a small bowl. Dredge the pork chops lightly in flour, dip in the egg, and coat liberally with bread crumbs. Heat the oil in a medium skillet over medium-high heat. Fry the pork chops 5 minutes per side, or until the breading appears well browned. Transfer the chops to a 9 x 13 baking dish, and cover with foil. Bake in the preheated oven for 1 hour. While baking, combine the cream of mushroom soup, milk and white wine in a medium bowl. After the pork chops have baked for an hour, cover them with the soup mixture. Replace foil, and bake for another 30 minutes. ; name: onion beer soup ; ingredients: oil, onions, sugar, flour, dark beer, chicken stock, salt & freshly ground black pepper, crusty bread, fresh parsley, gruyere cheese ; preparation:Heat oil. Add onions& sugar, cover and cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, for 20- 25 minutes or until the onions are slightly coloured. Sprinkle flour over onions& stir in. Slowly add the beer, pour in chicken stock and season to taste. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Place toast slices in ovenproof soup bowls. Pour broth into each bowl, sprinkle with some parsley& top with grated cheese. Place under broiler for a couple of minutes to melt cheese. ; name: lobster and chive bisque ; ingredients: butter, onion, all-purpose flour, milk, heavy whipping cream, dry sherry, salt, paprika, cooked lobster meat, fresh chives ; preparation:

name: orange rice and barley pilaf ; ingredients: fresh orange juice, chicken broth, long grain brown rice, barley, dry white wine, dried thyme, salt, fresh ground black pepper, parsley, walnuts ; preparation:In a saucepan over med-high heat, bring orange juice and broth to a boil. Stir in rice and barley. Add in wine, thyme, salt, and pepper. Decrease heat to low and simmer, covered, until liquid is absorbed and rice and barley are tender, about 55-60 minutes. Add in parsley and nuts. Fluff with a fork. Serve. ; name: armenian lemon rice pilaf ; ingredients: butter, long grain rice, lemon zest, white pepper, chicken broth, lemon juice, fresh parsley, lemon ; preparation:Melt butter in a skillet. Add rice and stir, about 2 minutes, making sure grains are nicely coated with butter. Add lemon zest, pepper, and the broth. Simmer uncovered over low heat for about 40 minutes, or until the liquid has absorbed and rice in tender. Remove from heat. Add lemon juice and stir. Let stand 5 minutes. Garnish with lemon slices to serve. ; name: chipotle copycat recipe cilantro lime rice ; ingredients: long grain white rice, water, bay leaf, cilantro, olive oil, lime, salt ; preparation:Rinse rice well until water runs clear. Combine rice, water and bay leaf in a pot, cover it and bring it to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer about 18 minutes. Fluff with a fork and stir in cilantro. Add oil, lime juice and salt together, stir well. Taste and adjust- might need more lime or salt. ; name: bacon and egg rice ; ingredients: long-grain white rice, water, bacon, eggs, salt, black pepper, onion, vegetable oil, scallion, sesame oil ; preparation:Bring rice and water to a boil in a 3 quart heavy saucepan, then reduce, heat to low and cook, tightly covered, until water is absorbed and rice is tender, about 20 minutes. Remove from heat and let stand, covered, 5 minutes. Gently stir rice from top to bottom of saucepan with a heatproof rubber spatula. Cook bacon in a 12-inch nonstick skillet over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until golden and crisp, about 6 minutes. Pour into a sieve set over a heatproof bowl and reserve bacon and fat separately. Whisk together eggs, t salt and t pepper in a medium bowl. Return 3 tablespoons fat to skillet and saut onion over moderately high heat, stirring occasionally, until pale golden, about 5 minutes. Add eggs and cook, stirring, until eggs are just set, about 1 minute. Make a well in center of egg mixture, then pour in vegetable oil and 2 tablespoons reserved bacon fat. Add rice, remaining teaspoon salt and remaining teaspoon pepper and cook, stirring, 2 minutes. Add bacon, scallions, and sesame oil and cook mixture, stirring, 1 minute. Serve immediately. ; name: greek rice salad ; ingredients: long grain white rice, hot water, feta cheese, pitted black olives, cucumber, olive oil, red wine vinegar, ground oregano, salt and pepper ; preparation:Cook the rice in the hot water, simmering over a low heat in a covered pan for around 20 minutes, until all the water has been absorbed. When the rice is fully cooked, remove from the heat and allow to cool, for about 10 minutes. Meanwhile, make the vinaigrette- in a bowl, beat the olive oil and red wine vinegar until they are completely blended. Add the ground oregano and salt and pepper to taste. When the rice is cool, add the cubed feta, black olives, cucumber and vinaigrette. Stir to mix and put in the fridge for 30 minutes before serving to allow the flavours to blend. ; name: greek lemon pilaf ; ingredients: butter, onion, long grain rice, orzo pasta, chicken broth, lemon juice, parsley ; preparation:In a heavy saucepan, saute onion in butter until tender. Add rice and orzo and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes. Add chicken broth and lemon juice and bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 20 minutes or until rice is tender and liquid has been absorbed. Fluff pilaf up with fork and stir in chopped parsley. ; name: tomatoe rice ; ingredients: olive oil, butter, onion, garlic cloves, tomatoes, vegetable stock, long grain rice, salt and pepper ; preparation:Heat olive oil and butter in saucepan until butter melets in a medium saucepan add the onion and garlic and saut for about 5 minutes or until onion is softened. Add the tomatoes, mix well, cover and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the stock, rice, salt and pepper, mix well and bring to the boil. Cover and simmer very gently for about 20 minutes. Serve hot or cold. ; name: oven baked orange rice ; ingredients: long grain rice, celery, onions, butter, orange rind, salt, orange juice, water, parsley, slivered almonds ; preparation:

name: not so sweet sweet potato casserole ; ingredients: sweet potatoes, butter, apple cider, salt, ground black pepper, gruyere cheese, fresh parsley ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375f. Bake potatoes whole, in their skins on a foil lined jelly roll pan until they are soft when pierced with a fork. Remove from oven and let cool until you can handle them, then peel off the skins. Mash the potatoes along with butter, cider, salt and pepper, until smooth enough to your liking. Grease an oval baking dish and spoon the mashed potatoes into the dish. Sprinkle with the shredded cheese and bake at 375f for about 30 minutes, uncovered, or until heated through and the cheese is melted. Sprinkle parsley over the top and serve. Make ahead. When ready to serve them, thaw completely, place into the baking dish as described above, top with cheese, and bake at 350f for about 40 minutes, then sprinkle with parsley before serving. ; name: sunny sauer cabbage ; ingredients: cabbage, carrots, olive oil, caraway seeds, garlic cloves, sauerkraut ; preparation:Core cabbage and cut into 1 cm wide ribbons. Use a vegetable peeler to make long ribbons from the carrots. Heat olive oil in a large frying pan. Add caraway seeds and cook for a few seconds, until their color starts to change. Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds, then add cabbage. Cover and cook 5 minutes, until cabbage is slightly softened. Mix in carrots and sauerkraut, re-cover, and cook until carrot ribbons are tender. If there is excess liquid, cook uncovered in this step, until liquid is evaporated. ; name: yet another turkey sausage and kraut skillet ; ingredients: olive oil, carrots, onion, turkey kielbasa, sauerkraut, dijon mustard, white wine, brown sugar, caraway seed ; preparation:In a large skillet heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and carrot and cook until onion begins to brown, stirring often. Add sauerkraut, mustard, sherry, caraway, and brown sugar. Mix well. Add kielbasa and bring mixture to a boil. Reduce heat to medium low and simmer, covered, for 10 minutes. Serve mixed with egg noodles, over potatoes, or with chunky rye bread. ; name: european kraut soup ; ingredients: mushroom, sauerkraut, onion, water, butter, flour, paprika ; preparation:Cook mushrooms in 1 quart of water for 30 minutes. Add kraut and cook for another 25 minutes. Lightly brown onion in 1 tablespoon butter and add to soup. In a saucepan, melt remaining butter. Whisk in flour and lightly brown. Add flour mixture to mushrooms, kraut and onions. Cook 1 -2 minutes longer. Add salt to taste. Top each serving with a dash of paprika. ; name: german potato kraut soup ; ingredients: water, potatoes, salt, kielbasa, sauerkraut, onion, sour cream, flour, garlic powder, dill ; preparation:Boil potatoes until tender. Add sausage, sauerkraut, onion, garlic and dill. Bring to boil. Add 1 cup hot mix to sour cream and flour. Combine with soup and heat. Serve immediately. ; name: dogs kraut and taters ; ingredients: sauerkraut, white potatoes, hot dogs, beer, dill, caraway seed, dried onion flakes, cracked black pepper ; preparation:In a large frying pan over medium heat, place the kraut with juice, potatoes, and hotdogs. Pour beer over top. Sprikle with dill and caraway seeds if using them. Top off with some cracked black pepper. Cover and let it simmer for 7-10 minutes until hot. ; name: rotkohlsalat mit wallnussen red cabbage salad with walnuts ; ingredients: red cabbage, salt and pepper, sugar, red wine vinegar, sunflower oil, applesauce, cranberry jam, walnuts ; preparation:Put cabbage in a bowl and season with salt, pepper and sugar. Add vinegar and oil and mix thoroughly with your hands. Cover and refrigerate at least 3 hours. When ready to serve, mix applesauce and jam and stir into the cabbage. Adjust seasonings. Top with toasted walnuts. ; name: skillet sauerkraut with frankfurters ; ingredients: sauerkraut, water, sugar, caraway seed, cooking apples, frankfurter, parsley ; preparation:

name: honey sesame pork tenderloin ; ingredients: pork tenderloin, soy sauce, garlic cloves, fresh ginger, sesame oil, honey, brown sugar, sesame seeds ; preparation:Combine soy sauce, ginger, garlic and sesame oil. Place tenderloin in a resealable plastic food storage bag and pour the soy sauce mixture into it. Marinate for 2 hours in the refrigerator. I do not recommend marinating this any longer than 2 hours - as the pork will become too salty tasting. Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Remove pork from marinade and pat dry with a paper towel. Mix honey and brown sugar on a plate. Place sesame seeds on another plate. Roll pork in honey mixture and then roll in the sesame seeds. Roast in a shallow pan for 20 to 30 minutes or until meat thermometer inserted into the thickest part registers 160 degrees. Suggested to serve over rice. ; name: the black swan house dressing ; ingredients: garlic cloves, sugar, dry mustard, salt, sour cream, red wine vinegar, oil, parsley, fresh coarse ground black pepper ; preparation:In a food processor place the garlic, sugar, mustard, salt, and sour cream. Add the vinegar. Blend on continuous speed. In a thin stream, slowly add the oil. When blended, fold in the parsley and pepper. ; name: gingered asparagus ; ingredients: rice vinegar, fresh ginger, sugar, asparagus, garlic clove, sesame oil, vegetable oil, salt, soy sauce ; preparation:Combine vinegar and ginger in small saucepan. Bring to a boil. Cook 10 to 15 minutes over medium heat. Stir in sugar. Set aside. Steam asparagus just until tender but firm. Combine garlic, oils, salt and soy sauce. Arrange asparagus on platter. Pour garlic mixture over. Cover and refrigerate. About one hour or so before serving, pour the vinegar mixture over asparagus. Serve cool. ; name: the original veggie burger falafel ; ingredients: chickpeas, tahini, flat leaf parsley, garlic cloves, lemon juice, curry powder, eggs, soy sauce, olive oil ; preparation:Drain and rinse the chickpeas and put them, along with all the other ingredients, in a blender or food processor. Pulse, scraping down the side of the bowl, to form a coarse paste. Scrape the paste into a bowl. In a nonstick frying pan, heat the olive oil. Scoop a couple of tablespoons of the falafel mixture into your hands and smooth down to form a small patty. Place a few patties in the pan and fry in small batches, turning halfway through cooking, until browned and crisp and cooked through. Drain on paper towels and serve with tahini sauce. Also delicious cold in a pita sandwich with cucumbers and tomatoes. ; name: cafe green salad by melissa d arabian ; ingredients: garlic clove, dijon mustard, balsamic vinegar, soy sauce, salt & freshly ground black pepper, olive oil, salad greens ; preparation:Rub the inside of a large wooden bowl with the garlic clove and then either discard it or save it for another use. Put the mustard in the bowl and whisk in the balsamic vinegar and soy sauce vigorously for about 10 seconds to get a creamy consistency. Season with salt and pepper, to taste. Drizzle in the olive oil as slowly as possible with 1 hand while whisking as quickly as possible with the other hand to emulsify. Lay the salad greens on top of the dressing and toss just before serving. ; name: around the world marinade for beef or chicken ; ingredients: oil, soy sauce, dried onion, garlic cloves, lime juice, lemon juice, cayenne, tandoori paste, dark brown sugar ; preparation:In a food processer or blender, put in oil, soy sauce, onion, garlic, lime and lemon juices, cayenne, tandoori paste, and sugar and puree. In a gallon size zip top bag, put pieces of selected meat and pour in marinade. Seal bag, removing as much air as possible. Allow steak to marinate for at least 1 hour in refrigerator. Then grill or broil selected meat to doneness. ; name: herbed oil vinegar dressing ; ingredients: cider vinegar, olive oil, apple juice, honey, fresh parsley leaves, dried leaf basil, dry mustard, salt, ground black pepper ; preparation:Combine all ingredients in a blender or food processor. Whirl until smooth. Place in jar with tight-fitting lid. Refrigerate for up to two weeks. Shake well before serving. ; name: giada s balsamic chicken drumettes ; ingredients: balsamic vinegar, honey, soy sauce, brown sugar, rosemary, garlic cloves, chicken drumsticks, toasted sesame seeds, fresh flat-leaf parsley ; preparation:

name: beer baked ham ; ingredients: ham, clove, bay leaf, dry mustard, brown sugar, water, beer ; preparation:Score ham. Stud top with cloves and bay leaves. Make smooth paste of mustard, sugar and water. Add additional water if necessary to produce prepared mustard consistency. Spread over entire surface of ham in baking pan. Pour in beer. Bake, covered, in 400 degree oven for 2 hours. ; name: new orleans root beer glazed ham ; ingredients: smoked ham, dry mustard, dark brown sugar, root beer, steak sauce, cloves, cinnamon stick, orange, juice and zest of, lemon, rind of ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place the ham in a broiling pan and cut shallow gashes in a criss-cross pattern across the top half. Combine the brown sugar and the dry mustard and pat it all over the ham. Put the ham in the oven. Combine all the other ingredients in a saucepan. Bring the mixture to a boil, then lower to a simmer, and cook until the liquid volumne is reduced to about one cup. Strain. Spoon some of the glaze over the top of the ham. Spoon more glaze, at 15-minute intervals, until it is all gone. Continue baking until the ham reaches an internal temperature of 160-degrees on a meat thermometer. Remove from oven and allow to rest for about one hour before carving. ; name: ham balls in sauce ; ingredients: ground ham, ground pork, ground beef, eggs, milk, graham cracker crumbs, tomato soup, vinegar, brown sugar, mustard ; preparation:Mix ham ball ingredients together. I use a stand mixer, but this can be done by hand. Form mixture into large meatballs. Place in a 9x13 pan. Combine sauce ingredients and pour over meatballs in pan. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 1 hour. If desired, spoon some of the sauce over the meatballs a couple times as they bake to keep the tops moist. ; name: russian style baked fresh ham buzhenina ; ingredients: ham, dijon mustard, dark brown sugar, salt, beer, apple cider, cloves, bay leaves, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 325 degrees f. Using a sharp knife, score the skin of the ham in a diamond oattern. Mix together the mustard, brown sugar, and salt and spread all over the ham. Place the ham on a rack in a roasting pan, add the remaining ingredients, and roast, basting with the juices, until a meat thermometer reads 170 degrees f or the juices run clear when you insert a skewer into the thickest part of the roast, about 3 hours. Let the roast stand, covered with foil. For 15 minutes. Carve into thin slices and serve with gravy, if desired. ; name: c hudson s ham potato casserole ; ingredients: cooked ham, potatoes, butter, green peppers, onion, flour, milk, mustard powder, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Saute the onion and green pepper in the butter. Gradually add flour, milk and mustard. Cook until thickened, stirring constantly. Put the ham and potatoes in a casserole dish. Pour sauce over. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Top with cheese. Bake uncovered in a 350 degree fahrenheit oven for 25 to 30 minutes. ; name: orange barbecued ham ; ingredients: orange juice, honey, chives, oil, ham, barbecue sauce, orange marmalade, ground mustard ; preparation:Mix orange juice, honey, chives, and oil. Score the ham in a diamond pattern. Pour the orange mixture over the ham and marinate 4-24 hours. Grill on low heat for 75-90 minutes, brushing with marinade. Mix the barbecue sauce, marmalade, and mustard. Cook 5-10 minutes until blended. Brush the glaze on the ham and grill 10-15 minutes more. ; name: ham asparagus rolls ; ingredients: deli ham, prepared mustard, asparagus spears, butter, flour, milk, salt, black pepper, medium cheddar, green onion ; preparation:Steam or boil asparagus until tender-crisp. Spread each side of ham with mustard. Lay 3 asparagus spears on each slice, alternating. Roll these up and place seam side down in casserole dish. Melt butter in med size saucepan. Stir in flour slowly, then add milk. Stir and cook until boiling. Add salt and pepper. Stir in cheese until melted, add green onion slices. Stir and pour over meat rolls. Cover and bake in 350 f oven 30 minutes or until hot and bubbly. ; name: easy glazed baked ham ; ingredients: cooked ham, brown sugar, orange juice, ground mustard ; preparation:

name: marinated cucumber salad on salad greens ; ingredients: olive oil, white wine vinegar, frozen orange juice concentrate, honey, red pepper flakes, kosher salt, cucumbers, grape tomatoes, green onions, mixed salad greens ; preparation:In a bowl combine first 5 ingredients, mixing well. Add salt to your taste. Add cucumber mix to bowl, tossing to coat. Set aside at room temperature to marinate 30 minutes. Arrange chilled prepared salad mix on plates. Spoon cucumber mixture on top. ; name: sauteed pear salad ; ingredients: boston lettuce, olive oil, bosc pears, cider vinegar, dijon mustard, sugar, salt, black pepper ; preparation:In large serving bowl, place lettuce. In 12-inch nonstick skillet, heat oil on medium-heat 1 minute. Add pears and cook 10 to 15 minutes or until they begin to soften and turn golden. Meanwhile, in cup, stir vinegar, dijon mustard, sugar, salt, and pepper. Add vinegar mixture to pears in skillet, and cook 1 minute or until liquid begins to thicken. Pour pears and liquid from skillet into bowl with lettuce, toss to coat. Serve immediately. ; name: raspberry chicken for the pressure cooker ; ingredients: sweet red wine, vinegar, raspberry jam, soy sauce, honey, dijon mustard, garlic clove, whole chickens, orange zest ; preparation:Mix all ingredients together except chicken and zest, stir until well combined. Taste and adjust sweetness to your personal preference. Pout mixture over chicken and let it marinate at least 4 hours, preferable overnight, in the refrigerator. Place chicken with marinade in the pressure cooker and bring to a boil. Seal, bring up to 15 pounds pressure, reduce heat to stabilize pressure and cook for 12 minutes. Remove from heat, depressurize using cold water, remove lid and remove chicken leaving marinade in pot. If a thicker sauce is desired, boil sauce in uncovered pot until it thickens. Pour thickened sauce over chicken and sprinkle with orange zest. ; name: warmed herbed potato salad ; ingredients: potatoes, extra virgin olive oil, rice wine vinegar, dry white wine, dijon mustard, salt, ground pepper, red onion, fresh parsley, fresh herbs ; preparation:Cook potatoes until tender. While potatoes are cooking, combine olive oil, rice wine vinegar, wine if using, mustard, salt and pepper in large mixing bowl. Whisk well. When potatoes are tender peel or not. Dice potatoes. Add to dressing. Add the onions, parsley and herbs, and toss all gently to combine. Serve warm. Leftovers can be served cold, or reheated gently in microwave. ; name: grilled chicken with balsamic peach marinade ; ingredients: chicken breasts, fresh peach, balsamic vinegar, dijon mustard, honey, salt, ground black pepper, garlic, fresh thyme, olive oil ; preparation:Combine vinegar, mustard, honey, salt, pepper, garlic, and thyme. Whisk until well blended, then add olive oil and mix. Just before you are ready to marinate chicken, stir in peaches. Pour over chicken breasts. Allow to marinate for at least 2 hours and grill. ; name: field salad with snow peas grapes and feta ; ingredients: white wine vinegar, fresh orange juice, extra virgin olive oil, sugar, salt, fresh ground black pepper, gourmet salad greens, snow peas, red seedless grapes, feta cheese ; preparation:Combine first 6 ingredients in a small bowl. Stir well with a whisk. Combine remaining ingredients in a large bowl. Drizzle dressing over salad. Toss well. ; name: steamed new potatoes with dill vinaigrette ; ingredients: baby red potatoes, dijon mustard, red wine vinegar, fresh lemon juice, shallot, extra virgin olive oil, fresh dill, salt, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:Put about 2 inches of water in a large pot, insert a rack or steamer basket into the pot and bring the water to a boil. Steam the new potatoes in the basket for about 20 minutes. Let cool and then slice in quarters, lengthwise. Meanwhile, in a small bowl, whisk the dijon mustard, red wine vinegar and lemon juice together. Add the shallots and slowly whisk in the olive oil and dill. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Gently toss the quartered potatoes in the vinaigrette and serve. ; name: mixed greens with pecans goat cheese and dried cranberries ; ingredients: red wine vinegar, dijon mustard, fresh thyme, olive oil, mixed baby greens, dried cranberries, red onion, pecans, soft fresh goat cheese ; preparation:

name: rich buttermilk waffles ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, salt, sugar, baking soda, buttermilk, eggs, vanilla extract ; preparation:Combine the dry ingredients. Mix together the buttermilk, sour cream or yogurt and the egg yolks. Stir in the butter and vanilla. Brush the waffle iron lightly with oil and preheat it. Stir the wet into the dry ingredients. Beat the egg whites with the whisk or electric mixer until they hold soft peaks. Stir them gently into the batter. Spread a ladleful or so of batter onto the waffle iron and bake until the waffle is done, usually 3 to 5 minutes, depending on your iron. Serve immediately or keep warm for a few minutes in a low oven. ; name: golden vanilla wacky cake ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, sugar, baking soda, salt, whole milk, vegetable oil, vanilla extract, white vinegar ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Spray an 8-inch square metal baking pan with nonstick cooking spray. In a large bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking soda, and salt. Add in milk, oil, and vanilla to the flour mixture and stir until just blended. Whisk in vinegar until just blended. Immediately pour batter into pan. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a pick comes out clean. Let cool completely in pan on a wire rack. Can eat as is, or dust with powdered sugar or top with frosting. ; name: fat free pancake ; ingredients: whole wheat flour, baking soda, salt, vanilla extract, milk ; preparation:Mix first four ingredients and enough milk to make a runny batter. Spray a pan with olive oil spray. Pour batter onto pan. Fry on each side at medium heat for about 45 seconds. Top with berries, honey, etc. ; name: sugar hill inn s sour cream maple muffins ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, unsalted butter, maple syrup, sour cream, egg, raisins ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Butter standard muffin tins. In a small bowl, stir and toss the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Set aside. In a medium bowl, beat the butter until smooth then slowly add the maple syrup, beating constantly. Beat in the sour cream and egg. Fold in the raisins. Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, and stir until just blended. Spoon mixture into the prepared muffin tins, filling each cup about two-thirds full. Bake until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, about 15 - 18 minutes. Cool in the tin for 5 minutes, then remove. ; name: greeny s chewy chocolate chip cookies ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, baking soda, salt, butter, shortening, sugar, light brown sugar, eggs, vanilla, chocolate chips ; preparation:In a medium bowl, stir flour with baking soda and salt. Set aside. In large mixing bowl, cream butter and shortening with sugar, brown sugar, eggs, and vanilla. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Gradually blend dry mixture into creamed mixture. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop by tablespoon onto parchment-lined cookie sheets. Bake for 9-11 minutes. Cool completely on a wire rack before storing in an airtight container. To make bar cookies, pat the dough down into a 9x13 pan, and bake at 350 degrees f for 30 minutes. ; name: strawberry yogurt pancakes ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, sugar, eggs, butter, low-fat strawberry yogurt, buttermilk, vanilla ; preparation:In a mixing bowl, mix flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt and sugar. Add in the eggs, buttermilk, melted butter, yogurt and vanilla and mix until smooth. Spray griddle with pam or use a slab of butter for each pancake and heat over medium heat. Pour approximately cup of batter onto a preheated griddle. Cook for 8-10 minutes or the top is nice and bubbly. Turn and brown the other side. Serve with warm maple syrup. ; name: biscotti regina sesame seed cookies ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, unsalted butter, eggs, vanilla extract, orange zest, sesame seeds ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. Butter two baking sheets, or place silicon baking sheets on them. In a large bowl, stir together the flour, sugar, baking powder and salt. With an electric mixer on low speed, add the butter until blended. Whisk together the eggs, zest and vanilla, and add this to the flour mixture, and continue beating on low until you have a smooth dough. Pinch off a small piece of dough about the size of a small golf ball and roll it into a log about 2 inches long. Roll the log into the sesame seeds, pressing them so seeds stay on. Place the cookie on the prepared baking sheets keeping the cookies two inches apart. Bake for 25 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool, and store in airtight containers. ; name: whole wheat irish soda bread ; ingredients: whole wheat flour, unbleached all-purpose flour, salt, baking soda, white sugar, skim milk, lemon juice ; preparation:

name: mum s leek and potato soup ; ingredients: butter, leeks, onion, potatoes, salt, pepper, boiling water, chicken stock, milk, cream ; preparation:Wash leeks and chop up. Melt butter in saucepan and add chopped onions and leeks. Fry for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the potatoes, water, stock and salt. Bring to the boil and then simmer for 20 minutes. When vegetables are tender, put through blender. Return to saucepan and re-heat. Add milk, cream and pepper. Do not re-boil. Serve in soup bowls with bread and butter or french stick and butter on the side. ; name: uncle john s baked potato soup ; ingredients: baking potatoes, butter, flour, milk, sour cream, whole green onions, cheddar cheese, salt and pepper, bacon ; preparation:Bake potatoes until tender. Melt butter slowly in pan, blend in flour, making a roux. Gradually add milk, stirring constantly, then add salt and pepper to taste. Scoop out potatoes and set aside. Chop half of the potato peels to use in soup. When milk is very hot, whisk in potatoes, onions, and potato peels. Whisk well and add sour cream. Heat thoroughly. Add cheese a little at a time until all is melted. Serve with crumbled bacon. ; name: candied sweet potatoes ; ingredients: sweet potatoes, butter, brown sugar, orange zest, vanilla, cinnamon, salt, nutmeg ; preparation:Peel potatoes and cut into chunks. Place potatoes in 13x9 baking pan. In lg saucepan combine remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil. Boil for 2 minutes. Pour over potatoes. Cover and bake for 45 minutes. ; name: irish mashed potatoes colcannon ; ingredients: potatoes, butter, onion, kale, milk, sour cream, salt, pepper ; preparation:Cook potatoes in water until tender. Drain. While potatoes are cooking. Melt butter in large skillet. Add chopped onion and cook for 5 minutes. Stir in kale and cook 5 more minutes. Remove from heat. Mash potatoes, milk, sour cream, salt and pepper with mixer. Stir in kale mixture. ; name: sweet potato mash with caramelised onions ; ingredients: onions, oil, sweet potato, butter, salt and pepper ; preparation:Peel onions, cut in half and finely slice so you have half moon shaped circles. Put into a medium frypan and drizzle with oil and massage the oil in to break up the half rings. Cover frypan and cook over a low to moderate heat giving a stir occasionally until a nice golden colour, the longer you take the sweeter the onion will be. Put sweet potatoes in a pot of cold water and season with a little salt and bring to the boil and cook till tender. When potatoes are cook, drain and give a good shake, put in butter and mash till you get the consistency you like. Add your caramelised onions and mix in well and season with salt and pepper to taste. ; name: grams secret 24 hour potatoes ; ingredients: red potatoes, onion, milk, cheddar cheese, sour cream, salt, dry mustard, pepper ; preparation:Par boil peeled potatoes for 5 minutes. Do not let potatoes get cooked all the way through, potatoes should remain firm. Grate potatoes into shreds with box grater. In a large bowl mix potatoes, milk, onion, cheese, sour cream, salt, pepper and dry mustard. Pour mixture in to a 9 x 13 glass baking dish. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Remove dish from refrigerator 1 hour before baking. Bake at 350 for 45-50 minutes or until top becomes golden brown. ; name: gruyere potato gratin ; ingredients: potatoes, gruyere, onions, garlic, butter, heavy cream, salt and pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Boil whole potatoes for 10 minutes. Remove from heat and allow to cool to room temperature. In the meantime, saut onions and garlic in butter until they are soft and translucent. Layer potato slices and onions in a 9 x 9 baking dish. Pour cream over the potatoes. Season to taste and sprinkle gruyere over the whole shebang. Bake 4050 minutes or until golden. ; name: orange mashed potatoes ; ingredients: butter, onions, sour cream, orange juice, salt, baking potatoes, orange zest ; preparation:

name: classic chocolate chip cookies ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, baking soda, salt, butter, sugar, brown sugar, eggs, vanilla extract, semi-sweet chocolate chips, walnuts ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a medium mixing bowl stir together flour, baking soda, and salt. Set aside. In a large mixing bowl with an electric mixer on medium speed cream butter and sugars until fluffy. Beat in eggs, one at a time, then vanilla. On low speed gradually add flour mixture and mix just until blended. Stir in chocolate chips and walnuts. Drop dough by rounded tablespoonfuls 2 inches apart on ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 9 to 12 minutes. Transfer cookies to cooling racks to cool. ; name: katie s chocolate chip cookies ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, baking soda, butter, sugar, brown sugar, vanilla extract, instant vanilla pudding, eggs, chocolate chips, baking powder ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375f. Mix dry ingredients with wire whisk. Add butter, eggs, and vanilla to dry mix. Stir in chips with your hands. Roll into 1-inch balls and place on ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 375f for 8-10 minutes. ; name: applesauce raisin cake ; ingredients: unsalted butter, sugar, applesauce, all-purpose flour, cinnamon, nutmeg, baking soda, salt, vanilla, raisins ; preparation:Preheat oven to 325. Butter and flour a 10-inch tube pan. Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Stir in applesauce and vanilla. Sift dry ingredients together and then sift over applesauce mixture. Sprinkle with raisins and blend gently. Pour batter into pan and bake approximately 65-75 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes up clean. Cool in pan 10 minutes then remove from pan to finish cooling. ; name: white chocolate pecan drop cookies ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, baking soda, salt, unsalted butter, sugar, light brown sugar, egg, vanilla extract, pecans, white chocolate ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 350. In a bowl, combinte the first 3 ingredients. Set aside. In a larger bowl, cream the butter with the sugars for 2 minutes or until smooth. Add in the egg and vanilla. Beat well. Add in the dry ingredients and mix thoroughly. Stir in the pecans and white chocolate. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until lightly golden. Let cookies cool on cookie sheet for 5 minutes. Then tranfer to wire rack to cool completely. ; name: fruity whole wheat yogurt muffins ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, whole wheat flour, white sugar, baking powder, baking soda, plain yogurt, egg, vanilla extract, oil, apples ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease 12 muffin cups or line with paper muffin liners. Stir together flour, sugar, baking soda and baking powder. In a separate bowl, combine yogurt, egg, vanilla, oil and fruit. Stir mixtures together just until combined. Batter will be very thick. Scoop into prepared muffin cups and bake in preheated oven for 25 minutes. This helps the leavening process. ; name: double chocolate cake ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, brown sugar, cocoa, baking soda, salt, water, vegetable oil, vinegar, vanilla, semi-sweet chocolate chips ; preparation:Heat oven to 350f. Mix flour, brown sugar, cocoa, baking soda, and salt with fork together. Mix in remaining ingredients except chocolate chips and pour into an ungreased 8x8x2-inch baking pan. Sprinkle chocolate chips over batter. Bake until wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean, 35-40 minutes. Sprinkle with powdered sugar if desired. ; name: martha s soft baked chocolate chip cookies ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, dark brown sugar, unsalted butter, light corn syrup, eggs, vanilla, semi-sweet chocolate chips ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Whisk together flour, baking soda, baking powder and salt. In a large bowl, using an electric mixer, beat sugar, butter and corn syrup until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs and vanilla. With mixers on low, gradually add flour mixture, beating just until combined. Fold in chocolate chips. Drop dough by tablespoons onto two baking sheets, 2 inches apart. Bake until cookies are no longer shiny - 10-12 minutes. Let cool two minutes and transfer to wire rack. ; name: easy applesauce cookies ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, clove, margarine, brown sugar, unsweetened applesauce ; preparation:

name: ramp ribs ; ingredients: pork rib rack, ramps, garlic cloves, habanero peppers, balsamic vinegar, salt and pepper ; preparation:Rub the salt and pepper and garlic into both sides of the ribs. Place the ribs curve up on some aluminum foil. Place on the concave surfaced the ramps and sprinkle over with the hot peppers. Give it several dashes of vinegar. Wrap it up in foil and bake on the grill for 1 hour. Carefully open the foil and mush what is left of the ramps and smear over the meat. Place the meat on the grill and brown both sides. Baste the meat with the juice ramp mixture left in the foil. Just before removal coat well with your favorite barbecue sauce. Forget the napkins everyone will want to lick their fingers. ; name: kathleen s burgundy pork tenderloin ; ingredients: pork tenderloin, salt, ground black pepper, garlic powder, onion, celery, red wine, brown gravy mix ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Place pork in a 9x13 inch baking dish and sprinkle meat with salt, pepper and garlic powder. Top with onion and celery and pour wine over all. Bake in preheated oven for 45 minutes. When done baking, remove meat from baking dish and place on a serving platter. Pour gravy mix into baking dish with wine and cooking juices and stir until thickened. Slice meat and cover with the gravy. ; name: diabetic herb roasted pork chops ; ingredients: fresh lemon juice, scallions, garlic cloves, dried rosemary, black pepper, pork chops ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 400f. Coat an 8-inch square baking dish with cooking spray. Combine the lemon juice, scallions, garlic, rosemary, and pepper in a shallow dish. Dip each pork chop into the mixture to coat completely then place in the baking dish. Lightly coat the chops with cooking spray and bake for 15 to 20 minutes, or until desired doneness. ; name: saucy spareribs ; ingredients: pork spareribs, dark soy sauce, orange marmalade, garlic clove, onion, salt, pepper, beef stock, vinegar ; preparation:Brown the ribs in a frying pan with a little oil. Place the sliced raw onion into the bottom of a casserole dish large enough to hold all the ribs. Mix together the soy sauce, orange marmalade and the garlic in a bowl. Place the browned ribs on top of the onions in the casserole dish then spread them with the soy mixture. Season the ribs with salt and pepper. Mix the stock with the vinegar in a jug then pour over the ribs and cover with lid. Cook for 1 hour at 200 degrees with the lid on then for another half and hour with the lid off. ; name: pork chops with garlic and apples in wine ; ingredients: pork chops, olive oil, garlic, apple, white wine, salt and pepper ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 200 c and put a baking dish in the oven while you preheat it. Meanwhile, separate the cloves from the garlic head but do not peel them. Smash the cloves with a knife. Heat the oil in a pan and add in the garlic. Fry for a couple minutes and put in the pork chops. Season with salt and pepper. Brown for just 1-2 minutes on each side. Put the chops and garlic in the pan that has been heating in the oven. Meanwhile, put the apple in the pan and fry for a couple minutes. Add the wine and let bubble until reduced by half. Pour over the chops and bake for 12-15 minutes, braising with the juice if you like. Take out and serve immediately with your choice of veggies. ; name: root beer baked beans ; ingredients: bacon, yellow onion, pork and beans, root beer, barbecue sauce, garlic cloves, dry mustard, tabasco sauce ; preparation:Cook bacon in a skillet over medium heat until crisp. Remove and drain on paper towels, reserving 2 tablespoons drippings in skillet. Crumble bacon and set aside. Saut diced onions and garlic in hot bacon drippings in skillet over high heat for about 5 minutes or until tender. Remove skillet from heat and add crips bacon, beans, rootbeer, barbecue sauce, dry mustard and tabasco to the skillet. Stir until well combined. Pour bean mixture into a lightly greased 1-quart baking dish. Bake beans, uncovered, at 400f for 55 minutes or until sauce is thickened. ; name: brown sugared pork tenderloin ; ingredients: cider vinegar, light brown sugar, salt, garlic, paprika, pork tenderloin ; preparation:Combine first 6 ingredients in a large zip-top freezer bag. Add pork to bag. Seal bag, and marinate in refrigerator 30 minutes, occasionally turning bag. Preheat grill to medium-high. Drain marinade from plastic bag into a small saucepan. Bring to a boil. Boil 1 minute. Remove from heat and set aside. Grill tenderloins, uncovered, over medium-high heat 10 to 12 minutes on each side or until pork is barely pink inside or a meat thermometer inserted in thickest portion of tenderloin registers 155, basting often when reserved marinade. Remove from grill. Let stand 10 minutes. ; name: caramelized carnitas ; ingredients: pork shoulder, brown sugar, tequila, molasses, salt, pepper, garlic cloves, water, green onion ; preparation:

name: grandma chin s sponge cake ; ingredients: eggs, sugar, salt, vanilla, butter, milk, flour, baking powder ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Beat eggs until light. Beat in sugar, salt and vanilla. Beat in milk and butter. Add dry ingredients very quickly and pour into a greased 9x13 pan. Bake 25 to 35 minutes or until toothpick placed in middle comes out clean. Serve with strawberries and whipped cream. ; name: lots of cinnamon coffee cake ; ingredients: sugar, flour, salt, baking powder, cinnamon, egg, milk, sour cream, butter, vanilla ; preparation:Mix first 5 dry ingredients together. Beat egg, add milk, sour cream, melted butter and vanilla. Combine with dry ingredients only until blended. Pour into a greased, floured 8 or 9 inch round or square pan. Sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon. Bake in a 400 degree oven for 25 minutes. ; name: basic cupcakes ; ingredients: eggs, vanilla, sugar, butter, flour, baking powder, salt, frosting ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Place all ingredients in a bowl and beat together until mixture is smooth. Line muffin pan. Half fill each muffin paper with batter. Bake 18 to 20 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean. Frost as desired. ; name: crustless milk tart ; ingredients: milk, butter, flour, salt, baking powder, eggs, sugar, vanilla essence ; preparation:Melt the butter, add the egg yolks and sugar. Beat with a fork. Add the dry ingredients and milk to the egg mixture. Stifly beat the egg whites, fold into the mix and blend well. Pour into an oven dish about 35x20cm- the mixture should be about 3cm deep. Bake at 160c for 45-60mins. It is lovely with cinnamon sprinkled on top before cooking. ; name: betty crocker fudge brownies homemade ; ingredients: sugar, flour, cocoa, salt, baking powder, eggs, oil, vanilla ; preparation:Mix all these ingredients together with a whisk and dump them into a ziploc to save. Should be good in the pantry for 6 months. When making the brownies, preheat oven to 350f. Add eggs, oil and vanilla and mix with a fork til just blended. Do not overmix. Pour into a silicone or buttered 9x9 pan. Bake for 20-25 minutes. ; name: mom s peanut butter criss cross cookies ; ingredients: shortening, peanut butter, white sugar, flour, brown sugar, baking soda, eggs, salt, vanilla ; preparation:Thoroughly cream shortening, sugars, eggs, and vanilla. Stir in peanut butter. Sift dry ingredients. Stir into cream mixture. Drop by rounded teaspoon on ungreased cookie sheet. Press with back of fork dipped in flour to make crisscrosses. Bake in 350 degree oven about 10 minutes. ; name: frosted creams ; ingredients: shortening, sugar, eggs, molasses, sour milk, baking soda, salt, flour, cinnamon ; preparation:Cream shortening and sugar well. Add beaten eggs and molasses, mixing well. Dissolve soda in sour milk and add to creamed mixture. Mix together flour, salt and cinnamon, then add to creamed mixture. Bake at 350 in greased jelly roll pan for 20-25 minutes. Cool and frost with thin powdered sugar butter icing. ; name: jewish coffee cake ; ingredients: shortening, sugar, eggs, flour, baking powder, salt, milk, vanilla, cinnamon ; preparation:

name: south of the border deviled eggs ; ingredients: hard-boiled eggs, avocado, green onions, sweet pickle juice, mayonnaise, dry ranch dressing mix, chili powder, salsa ; preparation:Slice eggs in half and remove yolks. Mash the eggs and avocado together. Add in the onions, pickle juice, mayonnaise and dressing mix. Stir until blended. Spoon this mixture into the egg halves. Sprinkli with chili powder. Cover and chill at least 1 hour.
